FNZ, the Global FinTech firm have opportunities for high-calibre Graduates to join our Graduate programme as an Analyst Tester. We offer an industry-leading remuneration package, first-class graduate training programme, mentorship support and the opportunity to deliver on projects impacting millions of users globally.

About The Role

FNZ is the power behind many high-scale financial services platforms. Our customers rely on us to create web applications that meet their own high standards for usability and design. These range from highly usable sites for direct investors to sophisticated systems for wealth managers. They always need to be fast, reliable, responsive/adaptive and accessible.

To join our Graduate Programme as an Analyst Tester, you do not require any technology focused commercial experience or Finance knowledge, we will support your learning, development and help to build your career.

Our Analyst tester roles combine Business Analysis, System Analysis and Testing and focus on engaging with our customers, who include some of the worlds best known financial services brands You'll be involved throughout the full project life-cycle from gathering client requirements to go-live and will help to shape client's technology landscape. You'll also learn various methods to test new and upgraded software to make sure problems are identified, reported and solved before rolling out to clients.

You Are

An outside-the-box, or big picture thinker
An excellent communicator, with strong emotional intelligence and the ability to communicate effectively to different audiences
A curious person who likes finding problems and coming up with solutions,
Someone who is self-motivated
Someone who isn’t afraid to try and fail and try again
Methodical in how you do things, with an eye for detail
Someone who cares about the customer

Responsibilities

In this role you will learn many key skills in Consulting/Client Engagement, Systems Analysis and Implementation and testing. Once you are fully established you'll be involved in the following:

Business and functional solution design, technical analysis of FNZ’s platform capabilities, business processes analysis and end to end testing (including supporting client UAT).
Examine existing IT systems and business models, analyse requirements (both business and technical) and to translate these into user stories and core functionality documentation. These activities will likely all include the management of stakeholders (internal and external) to ensure that solution designs meet client requirements. The analyst also be required to work closely with IT developers to provide oversight and clarity on the development solution.
Gain a broad knowledge of FNZ platform capabilities and a deep understanding of assigned functional areas of the FNZ platform. Work on a consultative basis to support Solution Consultants in workshops and provide input into requirements.
Have involvement in all aspects of analysis/testing from the more technical testing approaches including test automation, database manipulation and xml injection testing to functional specification testing and supporting UAT.

There is an expectation that the analyst will learn about our application, our business and the industry we operate in as well the range of test tools and methodologies we use to support our business.

What can FNZ offer you?

A first-rate development programme and a chance to work with the world’s best developers creating platforms at the forefront of technology.
Mentorship and buddy support to help you during your FNZ journey.
For new joiners outside of the Czech Republic, FNZ offers full relocation including air fares, relocation bonus and city centre accommodation for the first few weeks.
Be part of a highly successful, rapidly growing, global business that is leading the delivery of financial services via cloud computing and partners with some of the world’s largest companies.
Remuneration and career advancement is based on individual contribution and business impact rather than tenure or seniority.
We provide global career opportunities for our employees at any of our offices in the UK, Czech Republic, Australia, New Zealand, China and more.

Key Responsibilities
As Role holder, you will be providing Database administration for Oracle databases as well as support for installed applications, including complex setups with high availability / disaster recovery requirements (Oracle RAC, Oracle DataGuard)
Analysing system requirements of architectures and complex distributed systems
Producing operational and technical documentation, such as: work instructions, concepts, scripts
Autonomous planning and implementation of new database systems in close cooperation with customers
Providing standby duty outside office hours
Soft Skills
Ability to meet the customers’ needs in line with the business requirements
Focusing on the objectives and the required outcomes of the processes while delivering a service
Working with a cooperative and positive attitude in a group setting to achieve common goals
Communicating effectively and efficiently while adapting to your audience and getting the message through as intended
Taking the responsibility and taking care of the consequences of making a decision
Ability to find root causes of problems and to focus on their quick and efficient solution
Professional Skills
In-depth knowledge of all administrative activities for Oracle databases (11g,12c,19c) within a Unix/Linux and Windows environment
Experience in design, sizing, implementation and tuning of Oracle databases
Knowledge of any of the following technologies, running on AWS: PostgreSQL, Aurora DB, MySQLis advantage
About Rackspace Technology

We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.

More on Rackspace Technology

Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

At Brooks, new ideas, new technologies and new ways of thinking are driving our future. Our customer focused culture encourages employees to embrace innovation and challenge the status quo with novel thinking and collaborative work relationships.

All we accomplish is grounded in our core values of World Class, Empowered, Accountable, Respectful, Engaged.

Applications Engineer (m/f/d)

Job Description

We Are Brooks.

Brooks is a growing, fast-paced technology leader of automation solutions which boost the dynamic and expanding semiconductor and life sciences lab markets. At Brooks, innovative ideas, technologies, and ways of thinking are driving our future. Our customer-focused culture encourages employees to embrace innovation and collaborate with one another to achieve new heights.

We are looking for our next as we accelerate our growth journey. The Applications Engineer position will be customer facing position will work closely with, and support, our OEM and end-user customers to solve their stimulating & high-value problems through the application of our automation product lines in close corporation with Product team and Engineering.

The ideal teammate will promote our growth by becoming the product use-case expert for our customers and provide their technical expertise to both customers and our regional sales staff in sponsor of Design-In Win opportunities.

What you will do:

Applications
Work alongside the sales team to determine what the customer really needs.
Be a self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills and motivated by a challenge.
Have a “can-do” mentality, and willing to roll up their sleeves to help a colleague or customer.
Becoming an expert with our products’ use-cases, e.g., vacuum robots & wafer handling systems, atmospheric wafer handling systems, loadports, underlying motion controls & software, to provide pre-sales technical support to our customers and account teams.
Guiding product integrations at customer sites as well as directly working on the products for:
Demonstrating product features and performance
First Article sign-off
Product escalations
Debugging complex issues with the Field Service staff
Working objectively and as a team member to quickly respond to customer needs.
Answering questions from OEM customers about all aspects of our products
Building and maintaining relationships with customers to become their technical interface and trusted advisor .
Understanding Customers’ applications and markets
Preparing detailed product specifications to define solutions to meet customers’ high value applications.
Working with the sales, & marketing staff to identify, assess and prioritize potential customers and applications of our products.
Communicating customer needs and wishes to our marketing, & product engineering staff and launching internal projects for customer requests, leading to new Products, Product enhancements, features or software.
Supporting customer visits, attending & presenting at trade shows and seminars
Developing and delivering demonstrations to win opportunities.

What you will bring:

Technical ability to read a drawing, understand how it works, and electrical/mechanical skills.
Self-starter that is inquisitive, excellent problem-solving skills, and motivated by a challenge.
Fast learner, a great teammate, have a “can-do, no fear” mentality, and willing to roll up their sleeves to help a colleague or customer.
Experience in a customer-facing role.
Understanding of electronic components such as sensors, switches, relays, actuators, etc. Able to understand system-level wiring diagrams.
Helpful, patient and possesses the ability to relate to many types of people.
Able to work through problems systematically and document the findings.
Strong commitment to goals and team-first attitude.
Experience in 2D CAD, 3D CAD experience is a plus.
Basic Experience with scripting Languages or programming.
Able to travel internationally including USA.
Up to 50% travel; plannable.

What We Offer:

A combined environment that values continuous learning & growth, problem solving, innovation, and teamwork to achieve mutual success.
Supporting personal growth and continuous learning with internal/ external training programs and conference attendance
Motivated compensation
Flexible working
Employee Referral Program

Brooks Automation is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive environment for all.

If any applicant is unable to complete an application or respond to a job opening because of a disability, please email at HR.Recruiting@brooks.com for assistance.

Brooks Automation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

En Almato Iberia estamos buscando a un programador Senior con al menos 7 años de experiencia como programador y mínimo 3 años de experiencia laboral en Java SE.

Si buscas un puesto estable, eres profesional y responsable, entonces sigue leyendo. Este puesto sería a tiempo completo y 100 % remoto en España.

La persona ideal para cubrir esta posición debe tener experiencia sólida en Spring Boot y haber utilizado tecnologías Reactive para desarrollar una solución consolidada en el sector médico en la región D-A-CH (Alemania, Austria y Suiza) . Construirás sobre la solución médica existente, creando, implementando y manteniendo componentes basados en Java. Aportarás experiencia en el ciclo completo de desarrollo de la solución, desde el principio hasta el final del proceso.

Conocimientos, habilidades y experiencia requerida:
Estudios superiores de Sistemas, Informática o formación equivalente
Experiencia laboral sólida en Java SE
Conocimiento de la conexión de servicios Backend a través de RESTful APIs
Conocimientos de Spring Boot
Experiencia en Reactive programming (Asynchronous and Event-Driven programming)
Experiencia en desarrollo ágil de software (Scrum)
Excelentes conocimientos de inglés (nivel mínimo B2)

Habilidades deseadas:
Conocimiento en el desarrollo con TypeScript y React así como HTML y CSS
Se valorará la experiencia en el ámbito de la tecnología de la salud y el conocimiento del alemán

Lo que ofrecemos:
Empleo a tiempo completo
Contrato de trabajo indefinido
Proyectos innovadores y grandes oportunidades de formación continua
Oportunidad de crecimiento
Trabajo 100% remoto o híbrido en España a elegir
Oficina con ubicación céntrica en el distrito 22@(Barcelona)
Buena conciliación de la vida laboral y familiar
Horario de trabajo flexible a elegir
Bebidas gratuitas en oficina (café, agua, infusiones, zumos)
Servicio de fruta semanal de Casa Ametller en oficina
Snacks en oficina
Beneficios para los empleados con el Banco Sabadell
Beneficios para empleados para la formación continua
Acceso al programa de beneficios corporativos

Acerca de Almato
Almato es una filial al 100% de DATAGROUP SE, que cotiza en bolsa. La empresa es uno de los principales proveedores de software y servicios para la digitalización inteligente de las empresas. Con el software de Almato, las empresas automatizan y movilizan sus procesos de negocio. Las aplicaciones incluyen la automatización de procesos robóticos (RPA), asistentes digitales, aplicaciones inteligentes, robots de software ya preparados, servicios de aprendizaje automático, así como soluciones completas para tareas individuales, como la gestión de la mano de obra. Almato emplea a más de 120 personas en sus sedes de Bonn, Duisburgo, Hamburgo, Reutlingen, Stuttgart y Barcelona.

Empresas de todos los sectores utilizan el software de Almato para reducir sus costes y mejorar su servicio. Entre los clientes de Almato se encuentran Aida, Deichmann, Deutsche Telekom, H&M, Innogy, Lands End, Lidl, Sparda, Santander y Tchibo.

Almato mantiene asociaciones como revendedor de valor añadido con proveedores de tecnología de importancia mundial, como Abbyy, Automation Anywhere, Nuance, SAP y UiPath, y emplea a más de 120 personas en sus sedes de Bonn, Duisburgo, Hamburgo, Reutlingen, Stuttgart y Barcelona.

Summary

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.

We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

What You'll Do
Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team.
Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang).
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale.
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions.
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.

Who You Are
You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure.
You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python and/or Golang.
You know your way around relational and non-relational databases and can effectively design data models that perform well, and tune queries to access them.
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.

What Canonical offers:
Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

#stack

You will be responsible for:

Monitoring of IT security alerts and triggering an appropriate actions
Creating, processing and escalating IT security incidents
Participating in the Security Incident Response Process
Automating the alert and incident management process
Cooperating on daily basis with SIEM administrators on the use cases improvements
Preparation and maintenance of the SIEM service documentation
Working on the process improvements

Desired Skills & Expierience:

Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology or related field of study
Experience in Windows/Linux/DBs or network devices administration
Interest in IT security, network and server administration technologies
Good communication skills, customer oriented and a structured, analytical approach
B2 level (or higher) of Spoken and Written English including technical vocabulary

Preferred Skills:

Experience in security incidents investigations
Basic hands-on experience with security related tools
Experience in one of the scripting languages
Security related certificates, such as: CompTIA Security +, CISM, CISSP, etc.

What do we offer:

You will work in a collaborative, close-knit team
You will be encouraged to work smart and work in your own way
You will be a part of a leading global technology business
You will be trusted to deliver your work
You will get an extensive benefit package supporting your work-life balance, health and comfort to work from home


About the Team
Fujitsu in Poland
Fujitsu offices in Poland are located in Warsaw, Łódź and Katowice. In Warsaw we perform sales and client support services. The Global Delivery Center Poland, located in Łódź and Katowice, employs specialists within business areas: Service Desk, Service Management, DX Services, Application & Multi-Cloud Services, Workforce & Workplace Services, Enterprise Cyber Security Services, Business Process Services oraz Program & Project Services.
In Łódź, Fujitsu also employs professionals for Fujitsu Business Services, in the following areas: Finance (P2P, O2C, General Ledger, Project and Contract Accounting, Treasury, Master Data, Bid Finance Team and Product Pricing Office), Supply Chain (Order Management & Procurement), Internal Audit, Assurance as well as HR Service Delivery.
At Fujitsu we firmly believe that technology enables people's happiness and wellbeing. As it plays a more important role than ever before, we must put people at the center of everything that we do. We believe a human-centric approach is the only way to deliver on the promise of the digital.

job_title: Senior Statistical R/R-Shiny Programmer - Fast Progression– Remote – Fully Remote
description:
SENIOR STATISTICAL R/R-SHINY PROGRAMMER- Team Environment – Remote – Fully Remote

As we approach the end of 2022, many of us will question our careers and begin looking for new opportunities. But did you know statistically that most job applications are sent on Christmas and New Year's Day.

With the increased number of applicants looking, that means increased competition, reducing your opportunity to land the perfect role.

Why not beat the rush and get in touch today?

Are you ready to join a CRO that promotes a healthy work-life, that prioritizes balancing project demands with your home life, giving you more time to focus on family, friends, or hobbies? We are currently partnered with a genuinely employee-centric company that has recently won many awards for its valued culture and diversity.

The Senior Statistical R/R-Shiny Programmer provides technical expertise for the conduct of clinical trials, acts as an internal subject matter expert in specific areas providing technical support and expert advice, and works independently to support various programing activities related to the analysis and reporting of clinical study data. Specifically, the Senior Statistical R/R-Shiny Programmer will be used to build tools to support the operational key indicators/milestones for studies/programs or to support TLF macro development. Programmer will liaise with sponsors, Biostatistics Leads, Data Management Leads, and other functional areas as required. Further, the Senior Statistical Programmer will monitor quality, timelines, resource allocation, and productivity in relation to projects to which they are assigned.

Role Responsibilities:
Programming Lead contributing to global projects
Develop and maintain project timelines as well as budgets.
Provide training, guidance, and project leadership to your team members
Increase skills in programming, technology, and techniques for clinical trials and the Pharma industry

We are partnering with a global CRO that is passionate about being data and technically agile, this allows you to stay at the cutting edge of technology developing valuable skills for your career. You’ll be joining an award-winning CRO with over 25,000 employees globally operating in more than 100 countries worldwide who are looking to grow their biometrics department and are in search of a talented SAS programmer.

Desired Skills:
Proficiency in R/R-Shiny (2+ years in real-world application).
Candidate must have worked in a highly regulated environment if experience is not in a CRO or Pharma
Extensive knowledge and understanding of the programming and reporting process.

Location: UK, Home-based, Remote Working

Competitive Salary: Our clients are offering lucrative salary increases (10-15% increase) and so we can discuss a good uplift for you.

Interviews are being conducted in the coming weeks and so apply now to avoid missing out on this opportunity.

Please apply below or email your CV to at Max.trafford@peoplewithchemistry.com

Are you passionate about working in the automotive industry?

ADC Eastern Europe is looking for a proactive and eager to learn Requirements Engineer to be part of our System Engineering team!


Technical skills:

System Engineering / Electrical Engineering background
Previous experience in automotive industry
Experience on Requirements Analysis/Client Specifications Review
Automotive development V-cycle
Knowledge of DOORS tool
Knowledge of CAN, LIN, ASPICE


Soft skills:

Fluent in English, minumum B2 level
A great “can do” attitude and ability to communicate effectively at all levels
Problem solving skills
Strong interpersonal skills



Responsibilities:

Enabling developers on system level to document what they are doing and to track the current progress according to ASPICE process
Requirements management
Maintain and provide overview metrics to monitor the overall progress concerning requirements development
Identify gaps in requirements engineering
Support the definition of attributes and structure system requirements
Support the configuration management within the client's projects, including creation of baselines, providing suitable configurations for specific SW releases


Our Benefits package:

Hybrid way of working
Continuous learning and opportunities
Health and Wellness (Medical Subscription, Eyes Glasses vouchers, 7Card & Bookster)
25 annual leave days
Meal tickets
Floating Days policy
Loyalty bonus


Apply & let’s meet!

Also, you can send your application to recrutare.adc@alten.com

Responsibilities
Design client-side architecture
Build the front-end of applications through appealing visual design
Designing user interactions on web pages.
Developing back-end website applications.
Ensuring responsiveness of applications.
Build features and applications with a mobile responsive design
Working alongside graphic designers for web design features.
Seeing through a project from conception to finished product.
Designing and developing APIs.
Meeting both technical and consumer needs.
Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.

Requirements
Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Familiarity with JavaScript frameworks such as React, React, and Amber.
Proficiency with server-side languages such as Python, and PHP.
Familiarity with database technology such as MySQL, ElasticSearch and MongoDB.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Good problem-solving skills.
Attention to detail.

We are Different Tales, an award-winning indie studio and publisher based in Warsaw, Poland. Our previous projects include Werewolf: The Apocalypse – Heart of the Forest and Wanderlust: Travel Stories.

We are looking for a Gameplay Programmer to join our team in the development of our next title - a life sim RPG about the ups and downs of everyday life in a floating village, which will be released in cooperation with a leading European publisher.
Our ideal candidate is someone who will write the code for the interactions that make a game fun to play. If that sounds like you, we want to talk!

UE4 Gameplay Programmer – Warsaw, Poland / Remote

What you might do in this role:
Work with the design team to iterate and improve various gameplay mechanics.
Take part in sprint events with the rest of the team, including planning sessions and daily scrums.
Report progress in our tracking tools.
Work with QA to fix bugs.

What we offer:
26 days of paid vacation a year.
Flexible work time, mindful of our core hours 10:00-16:00 CET.
Fully remote or hybrid work environment.
Private healthcare package for employees located in Poland.
Company culture encouraging growth, independence, and pursuit of your passions.

What we need from you:
Knowledge of C ++.
Knowledge of Unreal Engine 4.
Knowledge of optimization and debugging.
2 years of professional gamedev experience, or a shipped game.
Fluent English.

If you are interested, send your CV to jobs@differenttales.com
Different Tales is a mostly remote work environment, but people living in Warsaw have the possibility to work hybrid or in-office if desired.

Please include the following clause on your CV:
I hereby give consent for my personal data included in the application to be processed by Different Tales S.A. for the purposes of the recruitment process and any future recruitment processes.

If you want us to keep your CV in our database, add the following consent in your CV:
I consent to the processing by Different Tales Sp. z o.o. personal data contained in my recruitment application for the purposes of future recruitment for a period of 6 months.

job_title: Software Engineer Data Presentation - Remote Germany
description:
Headquartered in New York City, Dataiku was founded in Paris in 2013 and achieved unicorn status in 2019. Now, more than 1,000+ employees work across the globe in our offices and remotely. Backed by a renowned set of investors and partners including CapitalG, Tiger Global, and ICONIQ Growth, we’ve set out to build the future of AI.

Data visualization is often the most striking (and for some, the most accessible) part of the data-to-insights process. Let’s face it — there’s nothing more exciting than beautiful fit-for-purpose data viz.

We are looking for a talented software engineer to create usable, intuitive, beautiful interfaces and scalable engines for Dataiku DSS. Dataiku DSS brings together big data and AI technologies into a unique and easy-to-use platform. It allows data scientists to process data with SQL databases, Spark, and Kubernetes with either user-friendly interfaces or code. The same platform also allows business analysts to create powerful machines or deep learning models with just a few clicks.

What We Do

We design and code experiences that resonate with our growing customer base. We empower non-technical users with user-friendly and well-thought tools to let them quickly and efficiently visualize, analyze, or process their data. Our current technical stack is based on Javascript, AngularJS, Angular, and D3.js on the frontend (we only support the latest versions of Chrome and Firefox!). We develop using Java, Spring, and Python on the backend.

What You Will Do

With your top-tier teammates from the engineering team and the help of the UX team, you will:

Build the components that allow Dataiku DSS users to create and display charts, dashboards, and ad-hoc web applications in a scalable way (both frontend and backend).
Prototype and create new ways to interact with data or integrations with other products such as Tableau, PowerBI, Salesforce, Slack, etc.
Work closely with product managers and UX designers to brainstorm on new features and iteratively refine solutions.
Shape a safe place to work where all ideas and suggestions are welcome and taken into account, and where we all know everyone does their best.
Write high-quality code, as your teammates do!
You are the ideal recruit if:

You have experience in software development and you are interested in data visualization tools.
You are customer-oriented — you want to understand customer needs and how the product is used.
You are at ease with both frontend and backend development, or you’ve mastered frontend development but are not afraid to dive into backend code to better understand how it works.
You know that a chart is worth a thousand grid cells.
You have firsthand experience (either professional or personal) building a real product.
You blink each time you see a misaligned pixel!
You are humble and kind. You don't hesitate to ask questions when you don't know, and you treat your colleagues with respect, kindness, and honesty.
Dataiku’s culture is right for you if:

You want to be able to define your own version of work-life balance - flexible is our go-to word, it applies equally to remote work, vacations and parental benefits
You need autonomy to thrive - we trust our people, give them space to do their best and stay away from artificial deadlines
You enjoy spending time with your colleagues and learning from your peers - meet for Friday universities, annual offsites, virtual trivia nights and more
You like feeling cared about - watch out for the magical Christmas box delivered at home and an unforgettable onboarding week
You care about giving back - it’s what our Ikig.AI program is all about: Dataikers are encouraged to work pro bono for one or several nonprofits of their choosing

If you want to learn more about our hiring process, you can read this article about our engineering hiring philosophy .

About Dataiku

Dataiku is the platform for Everyday AI, systemizing the use of data for exceptional business results. By making the use of data and AI an everyday behavior, Dataiku unlocks the creativity within individual employees to power collective success at companies of all sizes and across all industries. Don’t get us wrong: we are a tech company building software. Our culture is even pretty geeky! But our driving force is and will always remain people, starting with ours. We consider our employees to be our most precious asset, and we are committed to ensuring that each of them gets the most rewarding, enjoyable, and memorable work experience with us. Fly over to Instagram to learn more about our #dataikulife.

Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at: reasonable-accommodations@dataiku.com

Fairmarkit is the intelligent sourcing platform that empowers organizations to more efficiently purchase the goods and services they need. By equipping procurement and supply-chain teams with automation and data, Fairmarkit promotes competitive bidding while reducing manual work within existing processes. Fairmarkit has been recognized with awards by organizations such as Gartner and IDC, and is backed by strategic investors like GGV Capital, Insight Partners, 1984.VC, and Newfund.

About this role:

Fairmarkit is looking for a QA Engineer to join Fairmarkit and strengthen our growing engineering team in Poland.

Technologies used on the team:

Python 3.9
Django, DRF, FastAPI
PostgreSQL, Redis, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch
AWS: EKS, Security Groups, ALBs, RDS, ElastiCache, ElasticSearch, EC2, S3, SES, SQS
Docker & Docker-compose
Nginx
Celery
Jira, GitLab, Datadog, Sentry

We need from you:

Commercial experience in software testing
Experience in testing of web applications
English intermediate level or higher, both verbal and written
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development team
Experience in writing clear, concise and comprehensive test documentation
Experience with project and test management tools (Jira, TestRail or similar)
Experience working in MacOS and Windows environments
Experience in Back-End testing
Basic level of API testing

Your work will be:

Working closely with developers, architects, product owners and others in establishing effective test cases based on business requirements
Ensuring test cases are complete and are traceable to requirements and design
Completing tasks within the estimated time and ensuring that the technical and functional objectives are met
Gathering and reviewing technical documentation for accuracy, testability, and completeness
Communicating product issues to development team for timely resolution of issues
Participating in team meetings

Headquartered in Boston, and backed by a $35.6M Series C co-led by OMERS, Highland, GGV Capital, Insight Partners, and Service now. We are looking for exceptional candidates who want to help grow our company into a global enterprise and make their mark on the B2B tech industry. Come soar to new heights with us!

Fairmarkit is an equal opportunity employer, and selects individuals best matched for the job based upon job-related qualifications regardless of race, religion, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, gender identity, genetic information, disability, pregnancy, veteran or military status or any other status or characteristic protected by law.

Test&Quality engineer

Lokalita: Praha, Česká republika

Název pozice: Test&Quality engineer

Hledáme testera (test & quality engineer) pro tým zabývající se webovými projekty. Úkoly pozice budou: definice testovacích strategií a stanovení rozsahu práce na konkrétních projektech, tvorba testovacích plánů a případů, tvorba podrobných bug a issue reportů, realizace různých typů testů - build/integration/regression ad., tvorba frameworku pro automatizované testování, navrhování opatření ke zlepšování quality assurance při vývoji SW ad.

Požadujeme:

VŠ vzdělání (Bc.) v oboru informatika nebo podobném, praxi minimálně 2 roky v SW společnosti a v testování SW, výborné komunikační schopnosti, schopnost analýzy se smyslem pro detail, schopnost pracovat v distribuovaném týmu, dobrou úroveň písemné i ústní angličtiny, ochotu dále se vzdělávat.

Uvítáme zkušenosti se SW usability, zejména ve webových a mobilních prostředích, zkušenosti s Microsoft Test Manager with Lab Environment a s automatizovanými testy.

Nabízíme:

Zázemí a podporu úspěšné a rostoucí společnosti se sídlem v The Greenline (Kačerov), práci na mezinárodních projektech pro prestižní značky v ČR a EU, HPP na dobu neurčitou, odpovídající finanční podmínky, prostor pro trvalý osobní, odborný i kariérní rozvoj, řadu firemních benefitů (stravenky, příspěvek na penzijní připojištění, týden dovolené navíc, flexibilní pracovní doba, home office...). Nástup možný ihned nebo podle dohody.

Description

Business Insights Analyst

Serves as the business analyst for centralized and consolidated activities of the Business Insights team. Collects analyzes and reports actionable insights and recommendations in order to achieve growth targets, support corporate strategies and increase employee knowledge.

Syneos Health is the only fully integrated biopharmaceutical solutions organization purpose-built to accelerate customer success. We lead with a product development mindset, seamlessly connecting our capabilities to add high-value insights to speed therapies to patients and provide practical value to help our customers achieve their objectives.

Every day we perform better because of how we work together, as one team, each the best at what we do. We bring a wide range of talented experts together across a wide range of business-critical services that support our business. Every role within Corporate is vital to furthering our vision of Shortening the Distance from Lab to Life®.

Discover what our 29,000 employees, across 110 countries already know:

WORK HERE MATTERS EVERYWHERE

Why Syneos Health
We are passionate about developing our people, through career development and progression; supportive and engaged line management; technical and therapeutic area training; peer recognition and total rewards program.
We are committed to our Total Self culture – where you can authentically be yourself. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally, and we are dedicated to taking care of our people.
We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts, backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong.
Job Responsibilities
Acquires data from primary and secondary data sources / systems.
Identifies, analyzes and interprets trends or patterns in complex industry and customer data sets in support of strategic and ad hoc requests.
Under the guidance and direction of Business Insights leadership, supports the development of management level presentations and reporting of data-driven insights that lead to improvement in sales performance and realization of strategic goals across the enterprise.
Supports large strategic projects during their lifecycle including gathering requirements, project planning, progress tracking, evaluation of success metrics and status reporting.
Ensures ongoing department reporting related to competitor analysis, market modeling, pipeline / patent analysis and analysis of industry trends are current.
Identifies opportunities to streamline / automate and efficiently produce information for ongoing requests. Supports the integration of data sets for more comprehensive customer and competitive insights.
Promotes and contributes to a team environment by sharing successful ideas and reports with colleagues in order to further the groundwork for standardization and continuity of reports within the organization to drive credibility.
Integral member of a positive, results orientated work environment while building partnerships through teamwork and communicating in an open, balanced and objective manner. Viewed as a positive change agent while demonstrating collaboration across the business.
Qualifications

What we’re looking for
BA/BS degree in a science or business related field, or equivalent related education and experience, plus moderate experience in a data analysis function, or equivalent education and experience with some data analysis experience preferred.
Experience in the Contract Research Organization (CRO) or pharmaceutical industry preferred, or comparable experience in a related field of study.
Experience working with sales data and /or business intelligence information preferred. Possesses a strong understanding of data organization / structure.
Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite, Salesforce, web-based systems, voicemail, Email and Internet are necessary. Proficient Business Intelligence skills in Tableau, Business Objects, Qlikview, Oracle BI, MS Power BI, etc. are preferred.
Excellent oral and written communication skills, attention to detail, analytical ability and demonstrated critical thinking skills are essential.
Ability to organize, prioritize, meet deadlines, follow-up, and coordinated multiple assignments simultaneously.
Flexibility and the ability to handle multiple tasks to meet deadlines while delivering high quality work in a dynamic, team-oriented environment are essential.
Get to know Syneos Health

Over the past 5 years, we have worked with 94% of all Novel FDA Approved Drugs, 95% of EMA Authorized Products and over 200 Studies across 73,000 Sites and 675,000+ Trial patients.

No matter what your role is, you’ll take the initiative and challenge the status quo with us in a highly competitive and ever-changing environment. Learn more about Syneos Health.

Additional Information

Tasks, duties, and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company, at its sole discretion and with no prior notice, may assign other tasks, duties, and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience, skills, and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company, at its sole discretion, will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further, nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally, required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates, including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive, in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, including the provision of reasonable accommodations, when appropriate, to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.

We are seeking a skilled Python/Django developer to join our team. This role is open either in our Amsterdam office or remote (EMEA). Visa sponsorship is possible.

What You Will Be Doing

You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our web applications using the Python programming language and the Django framework. The systems that will be worked on as part of the job include a moderation dashboard, Chat and Feeds admin panel, internal tools as well as the integration of external services.

Responsibilities:

Design and develop web applications using Python and Django
Collaborate with the rest of the development team to design and implement new features
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code
Troubleshoot and debug issues as they arise
Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the Python and Django communities
Monitor production environments for performance and troubleshoot issues as they arise.

About You

You have:

5+ years of experience as a software developer
Strong experience with Python and Django
Experience with JavaScript and web development frameworks such as React or Angular
Strong understanding of Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts
Experience with relational databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL)
Experience with Git and version control
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies
Strong problem-solving and debugging skills
Good communication skills
Strong work ethic and ability to work independently or in a team.

Bonus points:

Experience with message queues such as RabbitMQ
Experience with automated testing and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD)
Experience with designing and building REST API’s
Experience with cloud-based platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure)
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field.

Our tech stack

At Stream, we use a wide collection of technologies to offer highly optimized and available features to our customers. Here is a shortlist of the technology that we currently use:

Go, gRPC, RocksDB, Python
Postgresql, RabbitMQ
AWS, Puppet, CloudFormation
Grafana, Graphite, ELK, Jaeger
Redis, Memcached

Why join Stream?

History of success. From Amsterdam to Boulder and Techstars in-between, Stream has raised over $58.25M to build the best Chat Messaging & Activity Feed infrastructure available, with best-in-class support.
Freedom and endless growth opportunities. As a rapidly growing startup (since 2020 we have gone from 30 to 150 employees), Stream gives you unique personal and professional growth opportunities. The opportunity of true ownership and accountability has a massive impact on your career. These are the things you can rarely experience in huge corporations.
Be on the front line of progress and innovation. While working with cutting-edge technology, we are passionate about tackling difficult tech problems at scale and creating reusable components for them, empowering engineering teams to ship apps faster, more securely, and with a better user experience.
They believe in us: Stream is backed by leading VC companies (Felicis Ventures, GGV Capital, 01.Advisors, Techstars, Arthur Ventures), including backers like Dick Costolo (01 Advisors, ex-CEO of Twitter), Olivier Pomel (CEO of Datadog), Tom Preston-Werner (Co-Founder of GitHub), Nicolas Dessaigne (Co-Founder of Algolia), Johnny Boufarhat (Founder and CEO of Hopin).
Complete location and working hours flexibility. If you prefer working from the office, working 100% remotely, combining both, or relocating to our AMS office, you have total freedom to choose what works best for you and makes you happy. We’re here to support you in being productive and feeling part of the team, no matter where you are.

What We Have To Offer You

Stream employees enjoy some of the best benefits in the industry:

A team of exceptional engineers
The chance to work on OSS projects
28 days paid time off plus paid Dutch holidays
Company equity
A pension scheme
Remote work flexibility
A Learning and Development budget
Commute expenses to Amsterdam covered or the option to use a company bike within the city
Fitness stipend
Monthly in-office chair massages by a professional
MacBook Pro
Healthy team lunches and plenty of snacks
A generous relocation package
An office in the heart of Amsterdam
The opportunity to attend or present at global conferences and meetups
The possibility to visit our office in Boulder, CO
Parental leave paid at 100%

Note: this list of benefits applies to Netherlands-based employees and is adjusted per your location of residence.

Our culture

Stream has a casual social culture, our team is diverse and we all have different backgrounds. Now, Stream is a team of over 130+ peers from over 35 countries across the globe.

We value transparency, aim for excellence, and support each other on our way to new victories.

Our team consists of the strongest talents worldwide, making Stream a great place to learn and improve your skills.

When it comes to software engineering, our culture is oriented towards ownership and quality: our goal is to deliver stable software.

If you are interested in becoming a part of what we do, apply now!

Vivira. Simply move.
The first app on prescription for back pain.

Vivira develops digital health applications (DiGA) for patients with musculoskeletal disorders to reduce pain and restore physical function.

Vivira is a CE-marked medical device and was the first digital health app in Germany for musculoskeletal conditions to be listed in the DiGA directory of the German Federal Institute for Drugs and Medical Devices (BfArM). Since the BfArM listing, all doctors can prescribe Vivira, and all statutory health insurers and increasingly also private health insurers cover the costs.

Vivira helps doctors and patients to close gaps in care where conventional therapies reach their limits: we provide access to therapeutic training independent of time and place, patient-centred and personalised, unlimited by conventional remedy budgets.

In our work, we place the highest value on medical effectiveness, patient safety, data protection and information security. Our fast-growing team, headquartered in Berlin, works entrepreneurially, purposefully, quickly and with an absolute focus on quality.

Data Analyst (m/f/d) (Full-time)
As a Data Analyst at Vivira, you will be vital in helping the company get more transparency on specific business activities and make important operational and tactical. As you tackle complex business questions and innovate in response to medical data-related concerns, you will become a real “flagship” in a rapidly developing and rewarding industry.

Your tasks with us
You have responsibility for visualising requirements from various stakeholders in our Business Intelligence tool
You optimise, maintain and enhance our existing dashboards
You will work closely with our data engineer for gathering more data from existing and future data points
You are a contributor to the enhancement and optimisation of the data gathering and storing, including improving the data quality and efficiency

What you should bring
At least 3 years of full-time experience as a Data Analyst or similar
Strong SQL skills
An analytical and entrepreneurial mindset with passion for pioneering new operations from the ground up from a technical and commercial perspective
Experience in data modelling and data visualisation
Analytical mindset, ability to interpret and translate data into actionable insights
You are a problem solver who is able to think independently, go beyond the requirements and suggest new developments
Very good communication skills in English (spoken & written)
Excellent collaboration skills, working in a fast-paced dynamic team environment

What to expect
A meaningful topic with the unique opportunity to make a difference in a completely new area of digital healthcare
A growing company with challenging goals
The flexibility in the arrangement of your working place (office or remote in Germany)
30 days of annual leave
The possibility to work in another EU country for up to 1 month
You will be welcomed by highly motivated and friendly colleagues in a dynamic, transparent and open corporate culture

Persönliche Entfaltung in der BI Welt von morgen!

Unserem Leitspruch «experience the sense of tomorrow» verpflichtet unterstützen wir zukunftsorientierte Kunden dabei, aus der Vielzahl ihrer Daten businessrelevante Informationen zu visualisieren und zuverlässige Unternehmenssteuerung in ein erfolgreiches Morgen zu ermöglichen. Wir bieten Dir eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem professionellen und marketingorientierten Unternehmen an, welches die Digitalisierung vorantreibt und Dir die optimale Basis für eine zukunftsorientierte Entwicklung im Consulting ermöglicht. Bei uns kannst du visionär mitgestalten mit viel Eigenverantwortung in einem motivierenden und abwechslungsreichen Arbeitsumfeld. Du arbeitest in abwechslungsreichen Business Intelligence Projekten bei namhaften Kunden in verschiedensten Branchen. Deine Begeisterung für Daten, Selbständigkeit und Berufsstolz sind bereits gute Voraussetzungen, um mit uns ins Gespräch zu kommen.

Innerhalb unserer Wachstumsstrategie suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine hochmotivierte und engagierte Persönlichkeit für unseren Standort in Deutschland. Der Arbeitsort ist flexibel und grösstenteils arbeiten wir in Deutschland remote, es sollte aber eine gewisse Reisebereitschaft vorhanden sein.

Deine Aufgaben

Beratung von Kunden in vielfältigen BI-Themen im Zusammenspiel mit verschiedenen Quell- und Umsystemen
Unterstützung unseres Sales Teams bei der Gewinnung von Neukunden und dem nachhaltigen Ausbau unseres Kundenstamms
Mit Deinem koordinierten Vorgehen ermittelst Du den Informationsbedarf aus der Sicht unserer Kunden und bist entweder verantwortlich für die Beratung, Konzeptionierung, Planung, Entwicklung sowie der nachhaltigen Betreuung von BI- und Datawarehouse Lösungen auf der Basis von Microsoft Power Plattform und Data Integration (SQL-Server, Synapse, SSIS etc.) on Premises, Azure oder in HybridClouds oder von BI-Lösungen auf der Basis von Qlik und Jedox
Selbständige Durchführung von Projekten und Koordination mit dem Kunden

Dein Profil

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in der Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Erfahrung im Datawarehouse- und BI-Umfeld mit Microsoft Produkten insbesondere Power-BI und Synapse oder Erfahrung mit Qlik
Du verstehst Daten und sprichst SQL
Vorkenntnisse im Bereich SAP BI, SAP BW etc. sind ein Plus
Du hast eine hohe Kundenorientierung, gehst Herausforderungen gezielt an und es macht Dir Spass Projekte lösungs- und budgetorientiert mit und für Kunden umzusetzen
Du fühlst Dich wohl dabei, eine hohe Kommunikationskultur innerhalb von Projekten und Kundenbeziehungen zu etablieren
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb von Deutschland und der Schweiz

Unser Angebot
Eine vielseitige Herausforderung in einem spannenden, modernen Spielfeld und einem starken, erfahrenen Team. Es erwarten Dich ein moderner Arbeitsplatz, flexible Arbeitsbedingungen, spannende und herausfordernde Projekte. Bei uns kannst Du etwas bewegen!

Bist Du unsere Verstärkung? Dann bewirb Dich jetzt, wir freuen uns, Dich kennenzulernen.

job_title: Dutch Language Data Analyst in Barcelona
description:
TELUS International is looking for Language Data Analysts in Barcelona, Spain to work onsite for a machine learning project! At the moment, we are looking for candidates with fluency in Dutch. We offer relocation assistance!

Language Data Analysts will analyze data in a given language and identify potential issues. They will also collaborate with international testing teams and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features. Data obtained will be used to train and improve speech recognition and AI systems.


RESPONSIBILITIES:
Includes, but is not limited to the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Linguistic data labeling
Analyzing language data in the given language and identifying potential issues and patterns.
Collaborating with an international testing team and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features.
Communicating with various departments.

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:
Fluency in Dutch.
Preferred educational background: linguistics, literature, or translation.
Available to work onsite in Barcelona, Spain.
Excellent reading, writing, and comprehension skills in English; ability to understand and closely follow elaborate guidelines in English.
In-depth knowledge of native culture and history, staying up to date with day-to-day news and happenings in the target country, and regular use of the language required.
Strong attention to detail and ability to meet project targets.
Self-motivated and able to work as part of a team or independently.
Good computer and software skills across different operating systems.
Strong typing skills.
Good organizational skills.
Adaptable to changing environments.

WHAT WE OFFER:
Attractive salary
Permanent, full-time contract with TELUS International
Private medical insurance for employees and relatives
Great office at a top location
Positive international working environment (relaxing zones, terrace, kitchen)
Discounts in gym memberships
Career development opportunities
No overtime or weekend work
Continuous support and learning
Access to counseling sessions

If this opportunity sounds appealing to you, apply now!
*Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

ABOUT US:

AI Data Solutions

Creating and enhancing the world's data to enable better AI via human intelligence

We help companies test and improve machine learning models via our global AI Community of 1 million+ annotator and linguists. Our proprietary Ground Truth AI training platform handles all data types across 500+ languages and dialects. Our AI Data Solutions vastly enhance AI systems across a range of applications from advanced smart products, to better search results, to expanded speech recognition, to more human-like bot interactions and so much more.

TELUS International values people's diversity and grants equal opportunity regardless of age, civil status, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion and political beliefs, sex, or sexual orientation.

Description

Position at Premier Research

At Premier Research, we help biotech and specialty pharma companies transform life-changing ideas into reality. What we do is profoundly connected to saving and improving lives, and we recognize our staff members are the most valuable asset in delivering success. Inspiring and nurturing staff to do their best work means a better, healthier future for all. We’re a community of 2,000 people in more than 20 countries delivering unmatched expertise, operational skills, and dedication to meet the most challenging needs facing clinical trials today.

We’re looking for a Data Management Reporting Programmer to join our Functional Services team that is passionate about improving healthcare through innovative clinical research. As a member of the Premier Research team, you’ll help create tangible solutions for patients in need while building cross-functional partnerships that enable your growth and success.

What You Will Be Doing
Works with cross-functional study team members in a programming capacity to create reporting solutions that support the quality and timely delivery of data management reports and visualizations required per standard and study specific data review plans
Creates, enhances, and decommissions data management reports in accordance with applicable standard operating procedures
Ensures timelines and milestones are met in collaboration with cross functional teams
Creates any needed documentation for reports and ensures proper filing
Works across the portfolio to increase automated reporting (e.g. - JReview, Spotfire) and review in order to streamline effort on data intensive studies
Enhances available reporting tools or creates new ones to support the review of clinical trial data and trial status information for cross-functional use
Provides input on data management reporting standards as required
What We Are Searching For
Bachelor’s degree, or international equivalent from an accredited institution, preferably in a programming, technical, clinical, or health-related field, or equivalent combination of education, training and experience
1 to 3 years of practical experience using commercial clinical data management systems (eg – Oracle RDC / Inform, Medidata Rave, Datalabs, etc) or data visualization reporting tools (e.g. Spotfire, jReview). Alternatively, must have proven experience in all primary job functions
Practical experience with SQL or similar programming language required
Demonstrates excellent English verbal and written communication skills
Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment including proficiency in the
Microsoft Office Suite of tools (eg - Outlook, Work, Excel, etc)
Proven ability to drive a successful customer experience through positive customer interactions, provision of quality and timely deliverables, and task ownership
Strong analytical and organization skills, able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
Why choose Premier Research?
Premier Research is more than a company – it’s a community of people that truly care about one another, about our clients, and about our mission of furthering research to improve the lives of patients in critical need.
Our cultural anchors – Caring & Empathy, Empowerment, Aspiration, One Team – mirror the flexibility and trust that our team embodies. As a Premier team member, you have the power to make an impact, regardless of job title and location.
Our dedication to biotech and specialty pharma is unlike any other. We provide our staff with innovative technologies and continuous learning opportunities so that they have the tools they need to be successful.
Because we are transforming life-changing ideas into new medical treatments for a diverse population, we require the perspectives of a diverse staff thinking creatively, challenging ideas, and solving complex problems fearlessly. Through a commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and empowerment, we create a community of belonging that welcomes differences, fuels innovation, and better connects us to the patients, physicians, and customers we serve.

We hire people that add to our culture, then invest in developing skills and abilities. If you are excited about this role, but your past experiences do not perfectly align with the position as described, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be exactly the right candidate for this role or others.

Description

Perceptyx is the most comprehensive listening solution platform available in the HR Tech world today. It illuminates the employee experience for millions of people globally. Our work helps whole organizations thrive (enterprise level to an organization with 5,000 employees).

We are looking for a new team member to join our Platform Services Professionals in Poland (you must be based in Poland). This role will be executing daily tasks to build, configure, and update employee surveys using an internal shared task list. Work will be on the front end of our platform and products.🙌 😊.

We don't like micromanagement and are looking for a professional who will be in charge of their own daily tasks and will deliver high-quality results on time. Our next colleague will have a passion for data and will be interested to grow together with us! We have a great internal career path for like-minded professionals. Remote work is preferred, however, we do have an office for networking in Wroclaw.

Our Platform Services Specialist will:

Receive tasks from the Customer Solutions team aimed at loading, updating, and personalizing the platform for customers
Focus on front-end configurations (toolkit builds, English email setup, dashboards, etc.)
Work closely with other team members
Successfully complete configuration tasks across Perceptyx products to solve the customers’ business problems. This is not a client-facing role but will involve completing work for our clients
Support Perceptyx internal Customer Solutions Partners, Implementation Experts, and Customer Care Coordinators
Follow procedures based on best practices for the daily customer tasks
Present task completion reports to the Manager, Platform Services bi-weekly to be used at the internal sync ups

Requirements

We would like you to have:

Minimum 1 year of relevant experience with strong technical, data, and configuration skills in data management or configurations
Passion for technical data and interest to grow in tech and data-related industry
Understanding of HTML, SQL, CSS, Excel, and grep
Explicit attention to detail, ability to pick up new systems and processes quickly, and ability to navigate tasks and technical work quickly
Good time management, organization, and personal effectiveness skills
Good written and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact with individuals at all levels of an organization
Good problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Good written and spoken English skills to communicate with international teams

We would like you to be:

Quick learner, self-starter, able to work efficiently with minimal supervision
Confident, ready for a challenge, and be not afraid of sking questions. This position is a great learning opportunity
Comfortable with using new systems and technology, specifically in web-based systems
Adaptable to change within the process, workflow, or systems
Willing to work with people from diverse backgrounds and experiences

Benefits

Working remotely from home (based in Poland) with the possibility to network in person with our other team members in Wrocław, Poland, and remotely with your manager in the USA and the team in Europe
Premium healthcare package
Fitness reimbursement programme and internal wellness initiatives
Opportunities to grow with like-minded professionals in a truly international tech environment. We offer continuous learning and development in interesting projects (people analytics, employee survey, and customer service) while providing you guidance and support throughout your journey with us
You are in charge of your daily work. We provide the tools and training- you make a meaningful impact, your way
A diverse and inclusive culture. You will be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others

Perceptyx Equal Employment Opportunity Policy:We celebrate diversity and an inclusive environment. Perceptyx is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

Description

Our vision is clear. Arming companies with the insights to ensure every piece of software built or bought is safe. That every threat is detected, and the deployment risks are well understood. An innovative vision requires creative people to help forge this transformational journey at ReversingLabs. ReversingLabs is recognized by the cybersecurity industry as a leader in innovation. Investment from Crosspoint capital of $56M will support our growth and efforts to build scalable, automated and intelligent software security solutions.

In this day and age, with systems and people under attack day and night by highly advanced cyber threats, a swift but detailed analysis of current threats and attack vectors is necessary. Given the number of such attacks, this is no small feat. As a member of the threat detection team, your focus will be on identifying malicious threats, behaviors, components, and exposure risks (such as vulnerabilities) of various applications, and to provide actionable intelligence for our customers and community on how to improve their security posture. You will often have to put yourself in the attacker’s shoes, correlate even the tiniest clues with millions of metadata records, and try to connect the dots to completely understand the impact. Finally, to automatically identify threats and risks, you will need to transform your knowledge into a rule-based format that our analysis solutions understand, effectively shielding other potential victims.

We will guide you through the details of various file formats so you can better understand the foundation of our work. You will familiarize yourself with the way applications are structured, learn how to identify benign or malicious behavior, and how to use popular and in-house developed technologies for analysis. Working alongside industry experts, you will understand how your work ties into our overall product offering, and get feedback on the impact of your work.

Of course, we don’t expect you to be able to tackle threats right off the bat. Based on your skill level, you will undergo a specially crafted training during the first few months to sharpen your skills before entering the arena. Do you have what it takes?

Responsibilities

Keeping track of the latest cybersecurity threats
Providing timely and accurate analyses of threat capabilities
Identifying and analyzing software, and providing actionable feedback to improve security

L'azienda

REVIVA è la scaleup fintech real estate che sta rivoluzionando il vecchio mondo dei crediti e delle aste giudiziarie immobiliari.
Siamo un team di 33 energiche e affiatate persone in continua crescita che lavorano insieme con l’obiettivo di risolvere il problema delle aste deserte (oltre 150.000 annue, il 70% del totale, 3,9 Miliardi di euro), abbattere le diffidenze e far acquistare gli immobili in asta a un prezzo più equo, aiutando debitore e creditore e favorendo così un'economia più florida.

Il Manifesto di REVIVA

Non amiamo le grandi strutture gerarchiche, preferiamo organizzarci in piccoli team che collaborano tra loro orizzontalmente per trovare le migliori soluzioni
Non giudichiamo le idee in base a chi provengono, ma ci piace testarle e lasciare che siano i dati a mostrarci quali siano le migliori
Siamo orientati all'obiettivo: diamo maggiore importanza all'impatto e ai risultati, piuttosto che a come le persone decidono di raggiungerli
Ciò che fai ha effettivamente un risultato tangibile per l'azienda e fa la differenza: non c'è burocrazia in cui perdere tempo e energie
Siamo consapevoli del valore del tempo delle persone e ci teniamo ad utilizzarlo per lavorare su cose significative e ad alto impatto
Da noi le persone non eseguono semplicemente una lista di attività, ma contribuiscono insieme a definire le soluzioni più efficaci ed efficienti alle esigenze che emergono
Ci teniamo al Benessere dei nostri colleghi, che alimentiamo sia con attività extra lavorative che con una cultura Meritocratica che premi l'impegno e i risultati di ognuno

Cosa cerchiamo
Ricerchiamo un DATA ENGINEER con esperienza middle/senior che si occuperà delle seguenti attività:
pulire e mantenere la qualità dei dati
sviluppare pipeline di automazione in python
far evolvere l'architettura dati
sviluppare integrazioni tra servizi interni ed esterni
garantire l’operatività degli sviluppi e delle architetture implementati
creare le API necessarie per rendere fruibili dati/servizi
facilitare la messa in produzione i modelli di Machine Learning
scegliere le modalità e gli strumenti più efficaci per gli sviluppi futuri
partecipare attivamente alle riunioni di pianificazione
parlare con colleghi per capire le loro esigenze per i prodotti interni

Competenze specialistiche e informatiche:
Python (ottima conoscenza)
buona conoscenza di SQL
librerie Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn
versioning del codice (git)
capacità di utilizzare sistemi Linux e rispettivo terminale per semplici configurazioni di server

Saranno considerati dei plus:
Competenze DevOps / MLOps
Conoscenza Docker e Kubernetes
Conoscenza di un broker di messaggistica (es. Kafka)
Esperienza con Apache Spark
Database non relazionali (NoSql)
Implementazione e gestione operativa di sistemi di Business Intelligence

Caratteristiche personali
proattività
doti comunicative
forte volontà d'apprendimento
voglia di mettersi in gioco e di fare la differenza
analytical thinking e problem solving mindset
curiosità e voglia di far evolvere il team nel quale si lavora, offrendo il proprio aiuto e condividendo idee per affrontare nuove sfide

Sei la persona che stiamo cercando se:
ti piace lavorare in un ambiente flessibile e dinamico da startup nel quale nessuno viene lasciato mai indietro
ti piace lavorare from scratch, affrontare nuove sfide, creare nuove cose da zero e non dover lavorare solo su progetti legacy
non ti spaventa avere grande autonomia ed ownership su quel che fai
ti interessa contribuire allo sviluppo dei progetti a 360°

cerchi un ambiente meritocratico in cui crescere

Söker du ett samhällsnyttigt arbete där du får jobba med effektutvärderingar? Här ges du möjligheter att klargöra effekter av förändrade skatteregler och Skatteverkets verksamhet. Genom ditt arbete och dina utvärderingar stödjer du ledningen med kvalificerade beslutsunderlag. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!

Om jobbet

Du arbetar med att utvärdera effekterna av förändringar i skattesystemet samt myndighetens verksamhet. Du gör även kvalificerade analyser inom något av analysenhetens övriga ansvarsområden som bland annat innefattar bedömningar av skatte- och folkbokföringsfel och konsekvensanalyser av regelförändringar.

Ditt arbete bygger på din analytiska förmåga, din noggrannhet och ett eget självständigt driv. Du måste också stimuleras av att samarbeta med andra. Du arbetar främst med mikrodata från Skatteverkets register. Uttag av data sker med SQL, medan dataanalys även kan göras i R eller Stata.

Du har flexibel arbetstid och kommer ha en balans mellan arbete och fritid. Arbetet är kvalificerat och du lär dig och får nya kunskaper dagligen, både på bredden och på djupet. Arbetet sker växelvis självständigt och i grupp, vilket i hög grad kan ske virtuellt genom Skype.

Du tillhör analyssektionen på analysenheten som finns på Ekonomi-, styrnings- och analysavdelningen. På vår sektion är vi 16 kollegor placerade på olika orter. Din placeringsort är enligt överenskommelse på något av kontoren i Sundbyberg, Malmö, Göteborg, Östersund eller Umeå. Du rapporterar till sektionschefen som är placerad i Sundbyberg.

Om dig

För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.

I det här jobbet ska du:

vara initiativrik och drivande
självständigt kunna planera och driva ditt arbete framåt
vara hjälpsam, serviceinriktad och ha en god samarbetsförmåga
vara pedagogisk och ha en god kommunikativ förmåga i tal och skrift på svenska
ha en god analytisk förmåga och kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband och avgränsa.

Du ska även ha:

lägst magister- eller masterexamen i nationalekonomi
aktuell erfarenhet av arbete med stora datamängder
aktuell erfarenhet av effektutvärderingar.

Det är önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av att utforma effektutvärderingar. Det är även önskvärt att du kan programmera i R eller Stata eller likvärdigt program. Det är också önskvärt att du har forskarexamen i nationalekonomi eller ämne som bedöms likvärdigt.

Bra att veta

Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.

En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.

På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.

När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.

Välkommen med din ansökan!

About Revolut
People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.
As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.
About The Role
We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘
We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨
Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇

Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions
What You'll Need
Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages
Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge
Nice to have
Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming
