#COICareers

ENTREPRISE

MeilleureCopro est devenue, en 5 ans, la principale centrale d'achats groupés pour les acteurs de l’immobilier et leurs clients, une expertise s’appuyant sur l’analyse des charges de plus de 30% des copropriétés en France.
Spécialisées dans la maîtrise des charges de copropriété, les équipes MeilleureCopro accompagnent les promoteurs immobiliers, les syndics et les conseils syndicaux dans la conduite d'appels d’offres sur l’ensemble des contrats d'une copropriété : assurance, fourniture d’énergie, maintenance multitechnique… Cette solution permet à nos partenaires clients une optimisation totale des charges sur les immeubles dont ils sont responsables et augmente la satisfaction de leurs clients.

MeilleureCopro a levé 3 M€ pour accélérer son développement et a remporté le prix de la meilleure start-up de l’année au salon Rent, dédié aux innovations pour les professionnels de l’immobilier !

Rejoindre MeilleureCopro, c'est partager la même passion de l’immobilier en s’inscrivant dans un projet entrepreneurial innovant. Dans le cadre de son développement, MeilleureCopro recrute un Ingénieur Développement Informatique H/F.

MISSIONS

Rattaché(e) au LEAD DEVELOPPER, vous serez notamment chargé(e) du développement et de la MCO de la plateforme interne et du site web de l’entreprise.

Vous serez amené(e) à développer des solutions aux problèmes remontés par les équipes commerciales et de production, ce qui passera par le développement de nouvelles features, par le renforcement des bases de codes et la correction de bugs sur ces deux projets.
Vous interviendrez majoritairement sur ces sujets, mais pourrez également être amené(e) à participer à d’autres projets en cas de besoin.

Véritable bras droit du Lead Dev, vos actions auront un impact concret sur le travail quotidien des opérationnels, en leur faisant gagner en productivité ainsi qu’en efficacité, et en assurant le scaling des outils pour accompagner la croissance de MeilleureCopro.

Vous aurez également l’occasion de vous pencher sur des problématiques techniques transverses comme la refonte d’interfaces et l’optimisation du code. La taille de l’équipe permet et impose une grande autonomie ainsi qu’une bonne part de curiosité, vue l’amplitude métier traitée dans les différents projets.
Le poste présente donc une diversité importante dans les missions qui vous seront confiées. COMPÉTENCES
Sont requis :
● 2 ans ou plus d’expérience en développement Python
● Expérience avec Django et/ou DRF
Seraient un plus pour votre candidature :
● Expérience avec Angular ● Expérience avec Google Cloud Plateforme
● Expérience avec du code legacy

PROFIL

Idéalement issu(e) d’une formation en informatique de niveau école d’ingénieur ou master 2 et justifiant d’au moins 2 années d’expérience en développement Python, vous recherchez à vous épanouir professionnellement au sein d’une entreprise à taille humaine.
Débordant d’énergie et avec le goût du challenge, vous souhaitez rejoindre une équipe dans la même dynamique, et étant exigeante en termes de robustesse et d’optimisation.
Vous avez besoin d’une activité stimulante par la diversité des missions qui vous seront confiées, et d’un lieu où le partage d’idées constitue la clé de notre réussite commune.
Poste en Full Remote.
Démarrage : dès que possible Rémunération selon profil & expérience + ordinateur.

PROCESSUS D’ENTRETIEN
● Premier contact pour parler de vous et du poste (~20 min)
● Test technique à faire chez soi
● Debrief du test avec le lead dev
● Entretien avec le CEO
● Entretien avec la DRH

Intéressé(e)? - > Adresse un email à welcome@meilleurecopro.com avec ton CV !

About Credativ - Part Of Spot By Netapp

Are you passionate about Linux and Open Source software? Are you looking to combine your personal interests with your profession? Then we have an interesting offer for you!

credativ have been one of the most successful German service companies in the Open Source environment since 1999. Our Open Source Support Center offers you professional support for numerous Open Source projects, which are of great or even strategic importance in the IT structures of many companies. Now we are operating under the umbrella of Spot by NetApp. This makes credativ one of the biggest players in the global open source market and is an amazing advancement in our ability to provide career growth and opportunities for all our employees.

We are looking for a permanent position to support our team of PostgreSQL experts with immediate effect.

PostgreSQL Database Engineer/Consultant (m/f/d)

You will become an important member of our Open Source Team, where many of the leading German Open Source specialists realize our customer projects. Your future colleagues have extremely broad knowledge, which makes our company so unique and which they would like to share with you.

Job Summary

The credativ-Postgres team is an association of PostgreSQL specialists, which successfully collaborates in remote work and hybrid work models. PostgreSQL is especially used by many of our customers as a business critical database. Here we actively support its operation and are looking for a highly motivated additional team member.

What tasks you can expect:
Long-term PostgreSQL projects like migrations
3rd-level PostgreSQL support, optionally on-call
PostgreSQL-related projects
Database reliability engineering
Architecture review, performance analysis and health checks
Training and conference talks

Job Requirements
Extensive knowledge of PostgreSQL at administrative and at architectural/source code level
Coding experience in C/C++, Python or other languages
Implementation and operational experience with PostgreSQL high availability solutions (especially Patroni and Pacemaker)
Experience with other PostgreSQL ecosystem projects like pgbouncer, backup (pgBackRest, Barman) and monitoring solutions
Knowledge of configuration management systems (e. g. Ansible) and general Linux system engineering
Motivation and team spirit
The willingness to contribute your ideas and knowledge
Spoken and written communication in English and German
The ability to seek and find customer oriented solutions
The willingness to travel occasionally

Education

IC - Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience.Mgr & Exec - Typically requires a minimum of 3 years of related experience.

job_title: Business Development Representative Nordics, English Speaking
description:
About The Opportunity

This position is one of the first touch-points that our customers and potential prospects will have with the Contentful brand. This role requires an energetic, organized, and motivated individual to research and understand the marketplace as well as how Contentful can help organizations drive digital transformation and best-in-class customer experiences. As a Business Development Representative, you will gain experience interacting with customers of all levels across a variety of industries. You will work closely with assigned Regional Sales Executives and supporting teams to hunt new business in the Nordics region.

Part of this unique opportunity includes attending our Contentful training program. This is a program that is focused on enabling future all-star sellers within our organization. This is a multi-step learning and skill development program with hands-on training. The program consists of multiple levels, which gives more responsibility and earning potential.

What to expect?
Gain in-depth knowledge of customers, industry, Contentful’s solution offerings
Effectively manage campaigns and reach out to new prospects
Lead generation activities including strategic research on LinkedIn, among other hunting tools and outbound prospecting, calling, emailing, and social outreach
Book at least 1 sales appointment per day and input all activities in CRM
Send weekly activity reports to sales leadership
Collaborate with assigned Account Executives, handing off qualified prospects
Educate AEs on the complete qualification meeting details (SLAs)
Successfully meet or exceed opportunity and pipeline targets on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis
Build relationships with decision-makers and key executives in all industries and verticals
What you need to be successful?
1+ years experience in sales, Lead Generation, Marketing, SaaS experience preferred
Strong team player with a self-starter attitude
Fluent English language skills are a must
Multi-lingual preferred
Enthusiastic, engaging communicator comfortable working with large groups
Excellent demonstrable written and verbal communication skills
A positive outlook with a "scoreboard mentality" of wanting visible and measurable success
Excellent listening skills and coachability
Ability to stay flexible and productive in a fast-changing environment with multiple priorities
What's in it for you?
Join an ambitious tech company reshaping the way people build digital products.
We set you up for success, equipping you with the latest and greatest hardware
Enjoy a full range of events, including workshops, Contentful-hosted meetups, guest speakers and team activities. Meet your team members from across the globe at our annual offsite.
Get fit! We offer a variety of health and fitness classes and a discount on Urban Sports Club.
Use your personal education budget to improve your skills and grow in your career. Join a free German class or one of our many internal learning initiatives!
Plus, Contentful socks! Oh yeah!
Who are we?

Contentful is the leading content platform that powers digital experiences for over 30% of the Fortune 500 companies and thousands of global brands. Our platform unifies content in a single hub, structures it for use in any digital channel and integrates seamlessly with hundreds of tools through open APIs. It lets developers and content creators work in parallel, increasing team efficiency and happiness. Companies such as Shopify, Staples, Atlassian, Electronic Arts, Chanel, Roche, Vodafone use Contentful to build their mobile and web products, voice-controlled apps and more.

We’re growing rapidly and we have secured over $330 million in funding from top-tier partners such as Tiger Global, Sapphire Ventures, Salesforce Ventures, General Catalyst and Benchmark.

More than 750 people from 70 nations contribute their energy and creativity to Contentful, working from hubs in Berlin, Denver and distributed around the world.

Everyone is welcome here!

“Everyone is welcome here” is a celebrated component of our culture. At Contentful, we strive to create an inclusive environment that empowers our employees. We believe that our products and services benefit from our diverse backgrounds and experiences and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical [dis]ability, or length of time spent unemployed. We invite you to apply and join us!

If you need reasonable accommodations at any point during the application or interview process, please let your recruiting coordinator know.

Please be aware of scammers who may fraudulently allege to be from Contentful. These types of fraud can be carried out through copycat websites, fake email addresses claiming to be from our company, or social media. We do not ask for your personal information such as bank account numbers, identification numbers, etc through social media or chat-based apps, nor do we request or send money for the purchase of business equipment. If you suspect fraud, please report it to your local authorities, as well as reaching out to us at security-esk@contentful.com with any information you may have.

By clicking “Apply for this job,” I acknowledge that I have read the “Contentful’s Candidate Privacy Notice”, and hereby consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of my personal information as described therein.

Additional Information

What's in it for you?

A one-product software company creating real value for the largest enterprises and millions of end customers globally, striving for a world where software works perfectly.
Working with the latest technologies and at the forefront of innovation in tech on scale; but also, in other areas like marketing, design, or research.
Working models that offer you the flexibility you need, ranging from full remote options to hybrid ones combining home and in-office work.
A team that thinks outside the box, welcomes unconventional ideas, and pushes boundaries.
An environment that fosters innovation, enables creative collaboration, and allows you to grow.
A globally unique and tailor-made career development program recognizing your potential, promoting your strengths, and supporting you in achieving your career goals.
A truly international mindset with Dynatracers from different countries & cultures all over the world, and English as the corporate language that connects us all
A culture that is being shaped by the diverse personalities, expertise, and backgrounds of our global team.
A relocation team that is eager to help you start your journey to a new country, always there to support and by your side.  If you need to relocate for a position you are applying for, we offer you a relocation allowance and support with your visa, work permit, accommodation, language courses, as well as a dedicated buddy program.

Compensation And Rewards

We offer attractive compensation packages and stock purchase options with numerous benefits and advantages.
Due to legal reasons, we are obliged to disclose the minimum salary for this position, which is € 56,000 gross per year based on full-time employment. We offer a higher salary in line with qualifications and experience.

Si te apetece participar en el desarrollo desde cero de aplicaciones que tendrán como objetivo el desarrollo óptimo de distintos proyectos para la gestión de grandes obras de ingeniería esta es tu oportunidad.

¡Sigue leyendo!

Cultura abierta somos una empresa internacional con una cultura abierta diversa e inclusiva en la que destaca el trabajo en equipo entre compañeros y compañeras de distintas partes del mundo. Si necesitas algo solo tendrás que abrir un hangouts y ahí habrá siempre alguien dispuesto a ayudarte

Trabajo remoto llevamos muchos años apostando por el modelo remote-first (incluso antes de la pandemia) porque somos una compañía dinámica respetuosa y conciliadora con las personas que trabajan aquí. Para ello también ofrecemos horario flexible real que puedes adaptar a tus necesidades.

Como parte de nuestra cultura abierta podrás cobrar una parte del salario en criptomoneda. Un proyecto que ya empieza a tomar forma gracias al impulso de compañeros expertos en blockchain y fans del mundo cripto.
Phantom Shares para agradecer y recompensar a aquellas personas que llevan tiempo siendo parte de este proyecto demostrando una alta implicación y compromiso los socios han desarrollado un programa de Phantom Shares correspondiente a un 5 de la sociedad.

Tendrás la posibilidad de llevar a cabo el desarrollo de aplicaciones con ASP.Net. y la codificación y rebuid de aplicaciones web basados en tecnología ASP y ASP.NET

¿Qué te hará conseguir el éxito?

Contar con sólida experiencia con tecnologías Microsoft

Experiencia con bbdd.

En los distintos proyectos usan Azure DevOps para la gestión así que si previamente has trabajado con ello sería genial.

Hoe lever je een bijdrage als System Engineer NH90?

Als System Engineer voer je integratie / system engineering werkzaamheden uit voor de NH90 in samenwerking met je counterparts in Airbus Germany, Airbus France en Leonardo Helicopters Italy. Je bent met jouw berekeningen aan de voorkant van de veiligheid van onze luchtvaart. Dankzij jouw input vliegen vliegtuigen en helikopters over de hele wereld veilig rond. Je hebt een helicopterview nodig om besluiten te nemen, initiatief te tonen en in teamverband Fokker | GKN Aerospace internationaal te vertegenwoordigen. Je focus ligt vooral op veiligheidstechniek en composietconstructies. Als onderdeel van het NH90 team heb je 6 directe collega's in je team. Je bent gevestigd in Papendrecht.

Wat worden je verantwoordelijkheden in deze rol?

Je houdt je bezig met de vertaling van technische en functionele eisen vanuit luchtwaardigheid en klant op H/C niveau naar eisen op Fokker component/part niveau. Verder zorg je voor een compleet en consistent eisenpakket zowel op H/C-systeemniveau als voor alle GKN/Fokker-componenten. Hier is afstemming (van de eisen) met onze Partner Companies, klanten en de werkmaatschappijen binnen GKN/Fokker belangrijk want je dient de technische engineeringswerkzaamheden (analyses, testen, simulaties); nadruk op veiligheidsanalyses acuuraat en nauwkeurig uit te voeren. Men kan op jouw vertrouwen dat de belangen van GKN/Fokker worden gerespecteerd in het internationale consortium en richting de klant. Het technisch beheer van werkpakketten en onderaannemers alsmede de identificatie van technisch risico op GKN/Fokker scope vallen onder jouw verantwoordelijkheden.

Verder Werk Je Op Taakniveau Aan

Downflow van systeemniveau naar componentniveau van technische gegevens;
Specificatie van vereisten op systeemniveau tot specificatie van componentvereisten en voorgestelde wijzen van naleving;
Oplossen van afhankelijkheden (technische inhoud);
Technische vertegenwoordiging van Fokker in het internationale veld;
Technisch generalist voor contract / project;
Technisch (veiligheids)specialist internationaal voor GKN/Fokker NH90 artikelen;
Integratie van component tot H/C-systeemniveau inclusief aantonen van conformiteit.

Dit breng je mee voor deze rol?

Met een Universitair diploma in bijvoorbeeld; Wiskunde of Natuurkunde of Lucht- en Ruimtevaarttechniek, Werktuigbouwkunde kun je deze rol aan. Er komt namelijk flink wat analytisch vermogen bij kijken.

Verder ben je bereidt tot het opdoen van meer kennis of je beschikt over het volgende:

Uitgebreide inhoudelijke kennis voor de (integratie van) disciplines van H/C-systemen.
Ervaring met het opzetten en uitvoeren van Systems Engineering Processen.
Ervaring met het beheer van werkpakketten en onderaannemers.
Ervaring met het uitvoeren van veiligheidsanalyses.
Bekend met EASA deel 21 en/of EMAR deel 21.
Goede interpersoonlijke vaardigheden (o.a. nauwkeurig, diplomatiek, organisator).
Goede onderhandelingsvaardigheden.
Goede mondelinge en schriftelijke beheersing van het Nederlands en Engels.

Over Fokker | GKN Aerospace

Fokker | GKN Aerospace bestaat sinds 1759 en in meer dan 260 jaar zijn we wereldwijd uitgegroeid tot een van de grootste spelers op het gebied van engineering binnen de vliegtuigindustrie. De mensen van Fokker | GKN Aerospace hebben o.a. vliegtuigonderdelen, motorsystemen, elektrische bekabelingssystemen tot wereldklasse niveau ontwikkeld. Daarom produceren wij 90% van de meest geavanceerde vliegtuigen en vliegtuigmotoren. GKN Aerospace ontwikkelt, bouwt en levert een uitgebreide reeks geavanceerde lucht- en ruimtevaartsystemen, componenten en technologieën – voor gebruik in vliegtuigen variërend van zakenjets, helikopters en militaire vliegtuigen tot de meest gebruikte enkele gangpaden en de grootste passagiersvliegtuigen ter wereld.

Fokker | GKN Aerospace Defense

Voor onze defensieklanten over de hele wereld leveren we van systemen en componenten die vliegtuigen sneller, verder en groener laten vliegen. Ons portfolio varieert van de F-16 tot en met de NH90, de meest succesvolle Europese helikopter. Onze betrouwbare systemen en componenten variëren van aerostructuren en elektrische bedradingssystemen tot motorcomponenten. Onze langdurige betrokkenheid ondersteunt de groei in UAV / RPAS (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle)/RPAS (Remotely Piloted Aircraft System) van de defensiemarkt. Het markt- en technologisch leiderschap van Fokker | GKN Aerospace op het gebied van geavanceerde aerostructuren, EWIS en lichtgewich technologieën, heeft aangetoond goed aan te sluiten bij de vereisten van de UAV OEM's.

Ambities en Talenten

De jonge Anthony Fokker had altijd al grote plannen, en is zijn nalatenschap nooit verloren. Want het aanpakken van grote uitdagingen ligt nu nog steeds geheel in lijn met de huidige uitdagingen. Zo ook op het gebied van duurzaamheid. Momenteel werken we aan een emissievrij regionaal vliegtuig voor 48 passagiers. Het vliegtuig vliegt dan met nul CO2-emissies en nul NOx-emissies. Met als enige bijproduct: water. Dus we staan als Fokker | GKN Aerospace niet aan de zijlijn van de huidige transities, maar we maken het ook echt werkelijkheid. Hier zitten de talenten met de juiste vaardigheden en passie voor hun vak die bezig zijn met de hoogste kwaliteitseisen.

Groei en ontwikkeling

Fokker | GKN Aerospace groeit hard en met geweldige mensen houden we de lucht in beweging. Hier werken we samen met passie en vastberadenheid om vliegtuigen verder, sneller en groener te laten vliegen. We putten uit elkaars expertise en ervaring om het hoogste te bereiken en we bouwen onze teams op vertrouwen en respect.

Wat zit er voor jou in?

Een uitdagende werkomgeving: Een baan waarbij je samen de lucht in beweging houdt en waar je deel uitmaakt van een divers (internationaal) team van experts.

Salaris en meer: Uiteraard een meer dan goed salaris dat past bij de inhoud van deze rol, en flink wat goede secundaire voorwaarden zoals:

Vakantiedagen en ADV-dagen (40 - 42 per jaar)
Pensioenregelingen bij PME
Reiskostenvergoeding woon-werkverkeer
Winstdelingsregeling

Extra Informatie

Waar kom je te werken?: Deze rol is een internationale rol en vereist internationale reizen.

We werken 50% hybride. In overleg met je manager en je team werk je deels thuis en deels op kantoor.

Fulltime/ parttime?: De functie is fulltime (40 of 32 uur per week).

Onderdeel van de selectieprocedure is het uitvoeren van de nodige checks en screenings om te kunnen voldoen aan eisen die klanten, partners en leveranciers van GKN Fokker stellen binnen het programma. De checks en screenings zullen beoordeeld worden aan de hand van kaders die door onze afdeling Export Compliance & Security gesteld worden. Iedere medewerker binnen GKN Fokker moet uiteindelijk geautoriseerd worden om inhoud te kunnen geven aan zijn of haar functie. Beoordeling van checks en screenings kan er toe leiden dat er geen inhoud gegeven kan worden aan de functie en er zodoende geen dienstverband of inzet kan volgen. De onboarding bij Fokker neemt doorgaand 3 weken in beslag.

De eerste gesprekken voer je met de Talent Aqcuisition Specialist eventueel eerst online en daarna een fysieke ontmoeting met de Inhurende Manager.

Als we na deze gesprekken allemaal positief zijn, dan zullen we je een mooie aanbieding doen.

Happy?! Fasten your Seatbelts want dan maak je onderdeel van een sterk, leuk en goed team van specialisten!

Hoe kun je solliciteren?

Heb je interesse in deze rol, en voldoe je aan de eisen? Wacht dan niet, en reageer gelijk. Nog vragen? Neem dan contact op met onze Talent Aqcuisition Specialist François Roskam op francois.roskam@fokker.com.

Diversity Inclusion and Belonging (DIB)

As a global engineering company, innovation is what differentiates us from our competitors and is central to our success.

A balance of cultures, ethnicities and genders help bring new ideas and creativity to GKN. We need people of different backgrounds, with different skills and perspectives to spark originality, imagination and creativeness in our teams around the world.

GKN is an equal opportunity employer.

We treat all our employees and applicants fairly and are committed to ensuring that there is no discrimination or harassment against any employee or qualified applicant on the grounds of age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_title: Airbnb Resolution Customer Agent Spanish & English(Remote)
description:
Are you looking for a great career and a place to shine?

Join us as a Resolution Customer Agent on our Airbnb project!

Your profile:
Ability to write and speak fluently, clearly and concisely in Spanish and English
Availability for a full-time schedule, in shifts covering 09:00 AM - 00:00 AM, Monday - Sunday, 5 days/ week
Excellent problem-solving abilities
Empathetic and can communicate in a caring and friendly manner
Strong time management skills and motivation to exceed expectations
Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable working with computers and the ability to work with multiple systems and the ability to learn and adapt to new ones
Strong team spirit with passion and drive to help users and deliver the best in customer service.
High level of mediation and composure

As a Customer Support Agent:
You will master the skills of effective communication, problem-solving, customer service, and strong cultural awareness.
You will have the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives with our technology, amazing people and a strong brand to serve modern society.
You’ll be the face of some of the world’s top brands!

We offer:
Work from anywhere in Romania
Above-average fixed salary, performance and tenure-based bonuses, depending on the position
Monthly meal tickets
Free access to our modern and fully-equipped employees' gym space in our office building in Bucharest
Private medical subscription coverage
Extra health benefits: special discounts for dental care and optical services with our partners
Reimbursement for your public transportation subscription, after the trial period (if you work from office)
Gym subscription reimbursement, after the trial period
Free subscription to the Bookster virtual library
Dedicated psychologist available for free sessions (online or face to face)
Special discounts and rates for a variety of services and products: from telecom and banking to tech and home appliances, library, wellness, travel and many more
Paid training and international career opportunities
Multilingual exposure - improve your spoken and written language skills
Community projects – want to make the world a better place? We run CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) events all year long

Mobility
The Role: Software Engineer
Location: Gdansk, Poland

The Team: You may know CARFAX as the company that has provided trusted vehicle information reports for over 35 years but we are so much more! CARFAX is on a mission to help millions of people shop, buy, own and sell used cars with more confidence.
The Banking & Insurance Group (BIG) is one of the most successful divisions within CARFAX, serving the insurance, automotive finance, and credit union industries. We are in high-growth mode as the use of vehicle history in these markets is increasing exponentially.

The Impact: You will be part of Development team in CARFAX BIG division and closely working with our colleagues from US.

What’s in it for you:

Programming in JVM
AWS
Collaborating with US

Responsibilities:

Code developing
Showing independence on your tasks
Be a contributor in a highly collaborative team environment using Agile/XP practices
Constantly educate others thanks to Pair Programming
Work with cross-functional teams like DBAs, network/infrastructure engineers, and other developers on a variety of applications
Supporting our production environment

What We’re Looking For:

2 years of working experience
JVM language (Java or Kotlin or Scala or Groovy) practical knowledge
Spring framework
REST/GraphQL
Basic knowledge of AWS
Database knowledge
Unit and integration testing
Git version control
Gradle or other building tools
Gitlab or other CI/CD tools
Knowledge on Linux server environments

Benefits:

Working with the newest technologies
Job position matched to your experience and expectations
Cash Incentive plan
Recharge - is S&P Global’s flexible time-off approach under which there is no prescribed maximum amount of time off you can take
Global Wellbeing Support - S&P Global will reimburse you each year, up to 1500 PLN for wellbeing-related activities, for expenses that help you achieve your own healthy lifestyle – mind, body and spirit.
Five days off for charity/volunteering
5 additional Wellbeing days in year
Free day on birthday and work anniversary
Paid parental leave of 26 weeks for all parents
10 days of fully paid sick leaves
Options to work from home
Chillout & fun room (table tennis, table football, Xbox, billiards)
Attractive benefits package (private health care, life insurance, MultiSport card)
Fruit days, coffee, tea, chocolate

About Company Statement:
S&P Global Corporate
S&P Global provides businesses and organizations with essential intelligence–including data, expertise, and technology that makes it easy and efficient to bring insight into daily decision-making. As the world’s leader in credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics, and financial market data, we help people navigate the market in a constantly changing world. We help customers identify opportunity, take on challenges, and accelerate progress, but it’s only through our talented team that this is possible.
Our people come prepared every day to creatively approach and solve new problems. They are instrumental in helping our customers see things differently and take on tomorrow’s challenges, today.
For more information, visit www.spglobal.com

job_title: iOS / Android Engineer (F/m/d) | on-site or remote
description:
Hello. We are BestSecret. And we will tell you the secret.

We are Europe’s most exclusive closed fashion shopping community and are on our way to become the #1 online destination for off-price fashion in Europe. With our diverse team of more than 1,700 international fashion and technology enthusiasts from over 70 countries we create an extraordinary online shopping experience for.

iOS / Android Engineer (F/m/d) | on-site or remote

Location: remote, Spain; remote, Greece

The selected candidate will be integrated into an international, multidisciplinary and agile team operating with Mobile Apps within Kotlin or SWIFT, MVVM, Clean architectures, Pair-programming and more. In addition to our direct, the team collaborates in all the tasks of the development cycle, from estimation of functionalities; design and maintenance of the technological Mobile Apps to create the greatest user experience

Responsibilities

Design, build and run the systems that deliver our APP web shop experience
The team will work in a data-driven environment, in close collaboration with product teams, with short release cycles and full ownership of the products you build
You will take part in software design & architecture decisions to ensure our e-commerce platform is highly scalable and supports the strong growth of our business
Focus on Data Driven Development: we all contribute in what data we should collect and why
Agile-oriented, open-minded and out-of-the-box thinking: You review and work towards improvements
Attention to detail and Quality-oriented: You eagerly look for optimal testing strategies, deployment and monitoring of the features delivered

Qualifications

You have in depth practical experience with Android or IOS in complex environments.
Previous experience in an agile work environment before, such as Scrum, DevOps, Pair Programming
The importance on quality, from clean code and application design to reliable CI/CD
Know-how in pipelines enabling painless delivery (Jenkins | GitLab) and monitoring of deployed applications
Passion not only for building new applications with the latest technologies, but also working with and future-proofing existing large-scale applications, e. g. by decomposition
Fluency in English (working language across all teams)

Benefits

Become part of our success story and work in an innovative working environment

Individual training for your personal development

Hybrid or full remote working gives you a high degree of flexibility

Great employee discounts for your perfect style

Highly motivated colleagues and a thorough induction phase

Attractive salary package and 30 days of vacation

Are you interested?

Is this exactly the job you are looking for? Perfect! Then apply today! We are looking forward to receiving your application.

Your Contact

Best Secret GmbH

Jaime Fajardo

Follow us on

Summary

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.

Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.

We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

What You'll Do
Collaborate remotely with a globally distributed team.
Write clean web service APIs to support both CLI and web frontend clients, using Python (and optionally Golang).
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production and ongoing operations at scale.
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions.
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.

Who You Are
You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure.
You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python and/or Golang.
You know your way around relational and non-relational databases and can effectively design data models that perform well, and tune queries to access them.
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world's #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realise the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 700 professionals across 50 countries - we want to be the world's best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.

What Canonical offers:
Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

#stack

job_title: Software Engineer II (Frontend - Open to remote)
description:
Your opportunity
We are looking for an experienced front-end engineer to join us in building The New Relic One! The platform will be used by your coworkers throughout the company and will help make their lives—and the lives of the customers they work with—easier and more enjoyable each and every day. Some of the problems we work on involve frontend API’s to interact with the internal framework, extensible architecture solutions, UI components and deal with modern frameworks and libraries such as ReactJS or Redux.

What you'll do
Implement rich, interactive data visualizations using modern JavaScript and software development techniques in conjunction with the team members.
Select the best frameworks and tools needed to do the job done quickly, while also optimizing for codebase stability, product stability, and target use case growth.
Work with our product manager and a team of data engineers to ensure data exploration products accurately render complex data that are aligned with the needs of our internal customers.
Produce highly performant and flexible user interfaces.
Collaborate with designers and other UI engineers across the company to learn from others and to ensure you stay up to date on the company’s UI best practices.
Learn and improve your skills to continuously push us to deliver higher quality data products and improve how we view data visualization as a company

This role requires
4+ years of experience working with modern JavaScript front-end frameworks
Familiarity with modern development and build tools such as git, npm, babel, and webpack; experience with front-end JS testing tools and a comprehensive understanding of UI testing techniques
Experience integrating the UI with data from service endpoints and expertise in modern HTML and CSS, including extension languages like Sass

Bonus points if you have
Passion about the whole stack a complex modern application requires!
Interest in learning new languages, platforms, and ideas.
Thrive in a fast-paced environment focused on delivering production code at a regular cadence using Agile techniques, tools, and methodologies.

We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to help every engineer do their best work, every day, using data, not opinions, at every stage of the software lifecycle. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.

We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional and business success through a workforce model called Flex First. Flex First allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or hybrid.

Read more about Flex First.

New Relic currently has offices in Germany, Ireland, Spain, and the United Kingdom, and based on business needs may approve work in Belgium, France, Italy, The Netherlands, Switzerland, Sweden, UAE, and other locations throughout the region. Some of our opportunities are limited to specific hiring locations. Talk with your recruiter about your goals and how we can work with you in our Flex First approach!

Our hiring process

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.

New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here.

#railway #engineering #consulting

IKOS is the European leading consulting firm specialized in railway engineering. We are committed to participate in the ecological transition and to develop the means of transportation of the future that are safe and durable. With 1200 consultants on our team, supported by our R&D hub IKOS Lab, we provide you the opportunity of an international career in a multicultural environment. The Group currently holds 24 offices in 12 countries (France, Spain, Belgium, Germany, Switzerland, Sweden, Italy, the UK, the USA, Canada, Morocco and Portugal). Since our creation in 2005, we strive for excellence to meet our clients’ needs in signalling and control systems, rolling stock, low voltage and telecoms, energy and high voltage, as well as infrastructures and tracks.

Your role

To keep on building IKOS’ growth and strengthen our engineering team in Belgium, we are currently looking for engineers, keen to work on projects in the railway or energy sector. Your tasks will include:
Be in charge of activities in railway projects
Manage a project in order to complete a work package
Analyze project requirements and define the appropriate strategy
Provide pieces of advice on technical problems
Monitor the progress of the project
Participate in coordinating activities in the field

Your profile
Master’s Degree in Engineering in the field of electromechanics, electronics, telecommunications, software, infrastructure, mechanics, electricity or construction
A first experience as an engineer is an asset
Flexibility, initiative, autonomy and team spirit are your key words
Excellent communication skills (professional and concise)
Good knowledge of French and/or Dutch

We thank all applicants for their interest however only those under consideration will be contacted.

#Belgium

Who We Are

In our Embedded Technologies department, we are focusing on client projects in the Automotive sector. The top-class services we provide consist mostly of software development and testing solutions for products such as Instrument Clusters and Head-up Displays, Control Units, Active and Passive Safety Systems (with a particular focus on Advanced Radar Systems) or even Low Level Drivers.

We are a friendly and distinguished community where colleagues are empowered to act, can choose their future development path and are great team players that truly care about the work they do in the industry.

What You'll Be Doing

Analyze specific project documents: Software Requirements Specification, Software Interface Specification
Create and maintain the build environment framework (build scripts, batch files, CI configuration) and offer support to development teams
Configuration and integration of embedded C software including 3rd party SW components
Prepare delivery package (release notes, flashing files, test results, etc)
Design and perform Software Integration test according to Software Integration Strategy and document the results according to the process
Continuously improve the integration strategy and process
Ensure quality processes requested by automotive standards and coding rules (SW Documentation, SW Review, MISRA Checks, etc)
Analyze and address integration issue to the responsible teams
Participate in project planning and estimation process

What You'll Bring Along

Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, or related field
Min 3-5 years of experience in an Embedded SW development position, with a particular focus on integration processes
Experience with Continous Integration
Experience with requirements tools and system engineering tools
Good knowledge about server architecture, client installation and configuration and integration strategy;
Support development activities in a structured and process oriented way (Experience with Agile or/and V-Model, ASPICE)
Good knowledge of embedded C, AUTOSAR Standard, Version management tools
Good communication skills and proactiveness in communication with different stakeholders
Scripting knowledge in other programming languages (e.g.: CAPL, Python) would be a plus
Good written and oral skills in English

Document

What’s In It For You

✔ New beginnings can be a challenge. We promise a smooth integration and a supportive mentor

✔ Pick your working style: choose from Remote, Hybrid or Office work opportunities

✔ Early bird or night owl? Our projects have different working hours to suit your needs

✔ Nobody is born an expert. Sharpen your tech skills with our sponsored certifications, trainings and top e-learning platforms

✔ We want you to stay healthy! Enjoy our Private Health Insurance ⁠– it’s custom-made for you

✔ A clear mind is a healthy mind. Attend individual coaching sessions or go one step further by joining our accredited Coaching School

✔ Make the most of our epic parties or themed events – they’re lovingly designed for our people and their families

NTT DATA Romania is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants regardless to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees.

Should you have any queries, we are happy to hear from you at ro.start.career@nttdata.com. Not the job for you? Perhaps you have a friend who would be a perfect fit. Send them this link!

What is it like to be a software developer at InnovationCast?

We are looking for software developers based in Portugal, interested in growing with our company, willing to learn and expand their knowledge and make a dent in the universe.

As a software developer you will:

Write pragmatic, performant, and testable code
Develop and maintain the code for an ever-evolving product that helps companies innovate
Work with the product owner to elicit requirements
Field second level support for customers, diagnose bugs or issues
Step up to resolve issues, large and small
Collaborate with colleagues during product brainstorms, technical design discussions and code reviews
Propose and implement solutions for customer requests and issues

You will contribute to the architecture of the product, participating in feature and implementation discussions. You will not be just another cog in the machine, but rather a crucial part of a company where its software product is key and valued by leading customer brands (don’t take it from us, read the testimonials on our homepage!).

We do code reviews to help build both the software and the team. Automated tests help in defining behaviours and fixing bugs, and getting the bugs to stay fixed.

Here’s what we’ll expect from you as a .Net Backend Developer

Backend developers design the services in use by both internal and external customers.
You need to be proficient in modelling scenarios and entities required for use cases, including weighing trade-offs between different implementations and approaches.

Developers also need to consider non-functional requirements during development. Performance needs to be considered whenever designing and implementing features, and those services must also be secure against attackers.

Qualifications

Advanced web development using ASP.NET MVC, .NET Core or ServiceStack
C#
At least 2 years building and maintaining backend services for web applications
Experience with document and relational databases
Experience with source control

Experience that can set you apart from other candidates

We use the following stack and tools, so direct experience with these is valuable

Git
RavenDB
PostgreSQL
ServiceStack
Redis
Powershell

Experience with the following practices is also a plus:

OWASP secure coding practices
Test-driven development

Base qualifications
Learning mindset and motivation to further develop your skills
Love to ship features that make a difference. We move fast!
Willingness to learn new technologies
Experience collaborating with product/design to build polished user-facing products
Communicate clearly in written English
Experience developing web applications (preferably >2 years, but competency is what we are looking for)
Experience developing a SaaS Product is a plus

Pay range

35k€-55k€ gross anual

Benefits
Opportunity to work in a fast-growing, VC-backed, award-winning, and ambitious startup
Work on an innovative product used by leading companies all over the world to create innovations that can have a positive impact valued and cared for in a people-first company where you will have the recognition you deserve and can be at your best
We still like to meet and work in person, but we are a remote-first team
Be in an environment where you have a voice and can make a difference
Work on innovation management will help you learn what it takes to become an Entrepreneur
Regular two-way feedback to accelerate your career growth and help us to improve
Potential Stock Options in a healthy, growing and promising SaaS business
No micro-management, you will have great amounts of autonomy
Competitive remuneration package
Health insurance
No bureaucracy

How do you know if you want to work at InnovationCast?

You seek to learn and want to grow personally and professionally. The real magic of innovation happens when committed people work smarter to turn ideas into new value. If we don’t become better at what we do, we won’t help our customers do the same. So if you value repetition more than discovery, this job is not for you.

You want to do work that matters for people who care. We’re a startup working to solve a big and relevant problem - one that won’t go away. Helping our customers to get better results through innovation management is - and will ever be - a work in progress. But it is so important and makes a difference for so many people, that the mission inspires you.

You welcome change and actually like to drive it. We strive to give our customers the best tools so they can keep making progress with innovation. This means that we have to experiment a lot with new ideas. As expected, some of them will work, others won’t. You need to be willing to be wrong, not afraid to make mistakes and actively learn from the process.

You don’t want to be micromanaged and want to bring actionable ideas to the team. Innovation is a team sport. Sometimes your work will seem tricky and confusing because you will be working on something that doesn’t exist yet. You will reflect on and understand our thinking and be humble to ask for help, and share difficulties and potential ways forward. But you don’t expect to be given a checklist. When you feel others may be wrong, you speak up and explain your point of view. You value honest communication.

You believe innovation and entrepreneurship can help companies change the way they work and how business is done. You may even want to become an entrepreneur. We’re set to use innovation management and entrepreneurship practices to provide software that helps companies think and act differently at scale. By opening innovation to employees, customers and partners, organizations can explore unforeseen possibilities and make real progress they couldn’t do on their own.

About InnovationCast

We’re a rapidly growing startup with an excellent SaaS product used by top brands globally. And we are on a mission to change the way organizations innovate: for better and for good. Want to join us?

InnovationCast is the collaborative innovation management software (SaaS) that helps organizations discover, incubate, and accelerate ideas. In short, we connect people and ideas and enable them to bring the best ideas to life and make a difference.

We have fantastic customers like DHL, Mayo Clinic, or Delta. We’re backed by Indico Capital, Shilling Capital and accelerated by Google for Startups.

We make innovation simpler, faster, more productive, and even fun. We believe that innovation and entrepreneurship mindsets and practices will become part of how people work daily. And we are set to make it possible and accessible for companies of all shapes and sizes.

Would you like to join a growing team and have an impact on the development of a world-class product? Do you want to work on a software used by thousands of people from top brands worldwide, which is used to innovate on new products, business models, and even social challenges? Then this job may be for you!

Job Farm ricerca n. 10 risorse interessate a specializzarsi nelle Risorse Umane.
Il percorso è rivolto sia a chi vuole acquisire competenze per operare nel settore, sia a professionisti che vi operino già e desiderino aggiornarsi.

- Laurea in Psicologia, Psicologia del Lavoro, Lauree Umanistiche;
- Laurea in Giurisprudenza, Consulente del Lavoro, Economia Aziendale e affini, Diploma di Ragioneria.

Il Master è organizzato da Job Farm sede di Palermo. Le lezioni avranno avvio a Maggio 2023 e saranno realizzate in modalità online (FAD sincrona) e in formula week-end, sabato e domenica.

HEAD HUNTING & DIGITAL RECRUITING

PAYROLL
TALENT & PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT
FORMAZIONE
POLITICHE ATTIVE DEL LAVORO

Rilascio della Certificazione delle Competenze riconosciuta a livello europeo.

job_title: Python Software Engineer - Ubuntu Hardware Certification Team
description:
Canonical is hiring a Python Software Engineer to join the Certification team, who make the tools which enable us to know that a desktop, laptop, server or IoT device is working properly. We work at the interface of hardware and software, so the ideal candidate is a Python developer familiar with hardware.

The Certification team develops the tools needed to certify hardware as working with Ubuntu Core as well as Ubuntu Desktop and Server: https://ubuntu.com/certified

We design hardware which can be used to probe devices independently, and frameworks for software tests that check every aspect of Ubuntu on that hardware.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact for adoption of Linux across multiple device categories and industries. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development opportunities. This team is centered in EMEA time zones, and works with colleagues on related teams in both the Americas and APAC.

We work together with silicon companies, OEMs, ODMs and teams within Canonical to ensure a smooth, secure out of the box Ubuntu experience, with success in this role leading to a great Ubuntu experience being offered on more and more devices.

Role description

We are looking for a self-motivated software engineer with experience developing in Python, to work on test automation tools or Linux based embedded hardware. This role offers an exciting opportunity to push the industry forward by enabling entirely new Linux based hardware testing capabilities, scaling up hardware certification efforts and allowing for deeper test coverage.

The role involves the development and maintenance of Canonical's open source certification tools, supporting the creation of hardware solutions for test automation, and automating our existing processes. We seek out continuous process and tooling improvements as part of expanding the certification test suites, ultimately to improve the quality of Linux experience felt by millions of Linux end users.

Key responsibilities
Maintain and develop new features to our Python based test automation tools like Checkbox, used by both in-house teams and industry partners.
Invent new ways to enable remote, automated testing.
Help build the software counterpart to in-house designed testing hardware to help test device enablement (graphics, hotplug, bluetooth, etc).
Write functional and performance tests to support hardware enablement and to protect from regressions.
Participate in meetings involving international travel 2-3 times per year.

Required Skills And Experience
Knowledge of Python programming language.
Quality oriented, pragmatic approach to software design and implementation.
Interest in test automation methodologies.
Previous experience working with Ubuntu or other Linux distributions.
Ability to be productive in a globally distributed team.

Desired Skills And Experience
Passion for tinkering: you are a maker.
Experience working in an agile environment.
Hardware testing experience, for example in the IoT space.
Familiarity with the C programming language.

What is Canonical?

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

#Stack

Help us with our vision of making the best platform to find and book tours and travel activities online.

About TourScanner
TourScanner is the first search engine for tours & travel activities. TourScanner is revolutionizing how travelers look for tours, tickets, and travel activities by aggregating and comparing the deals offered by multiple partner websites. Check out our website to see what we are doing.

We are a small international team with a flat organization. The language of the team is English.

Important: See full info about how to apply below.

Your role

If:
You're an ambitious Backend developer with great initiative and drive
Developing your own solutions to technical problems gets you going
You thrive when you have great technical freedom over what methods, solutions or technologies to employ in your work
This could be the perfect role for you.

You'll be responsible for managing the web back end of the application, developing new features and pages and maintaining it, and taking charge of a part of the application.

You'll be supporting and improving the user journey by helping develop the logic behind new customer-facing components, as well as performing integrations with other applications used by other technical and non-technical teammates.

You will be joining our Tech team, currently composed of 3 developers. We are looking for a team member who wishes to stay in the company and grow with it (we are not interested in consultants or sporadic/short-term collaborations).

Requirements:
3+ years of experience working in a backend web development role
Good knowledge and experience with PHP
Good knowledge of MySQL or MariaDB
Git
Docker
Knowledge of any PHP Framework. We use Laravel, which is fairly simple to pick up and learn from scratch even if you've worked with a different one so far.
Apart from your great technical skill, you'll also need:
Good initiative. Express yourself fully, often talk with your teammates and promote your ideas to the table, both for development and collaboration.
A problem-solving mindset when encountering new challenges you're not already familiar with (will happen a lot). Personal initiative, out-of-the-box thinking, a sense of knowing when to bend technical rules and practices and when not to, and creative solutions to problems are all highly valued.
Good planning, being methodical and organized with your work. This is essential as you'll be taking on a piece of the application that will be primarily under your care.
Oral and written fluency in English
Interest in working in a startup environment: good flexibility and adaptability are needed. We are not a corporate company with a defined process for everything

Useful, but optional knowledge includes:
Elasticsearch
Laravel
Kibana
Experience with payment integrations
Experience with setting up management / administrative views or panels

Details:
Location: Full Remote
Schedule: Full Time (40 hours per week)
€52,000 to €80,000 yearly gross salary (in the case of a freelancer), depending on the experience and skills
€42,000 to €64,000 yearly gross salary (in the case of an employee in Portugal), depending on the experience and skills

What You Can Expect from our Recruitment Process:

Apply here by uploading your CV in English and with contact information and we'll get back to you
We'll conduct a 60-minutes technical screening test
Should you pass, we'll schedule an interview to talk about your experience, discuss your CV in more detail, talk about the company, the team, the environment, the contract, as well as answer any of your questions
After the interview, we'll send you a short technical challenge to solve at home with a deadline of seven days
If needed, we'll have a final non-technical interview

Description

About us

We are Digital Science and we are advancing the research ecosystem.We are a pioneering technology company, and our vision is of a future where a trusted and collaborative research ecosystem drives progress for all. We believe in better, open, collaborative and inclusive research. In creating the next generation of tools and working in partnership with the community we tackle some of the biggest challenges to research. In order to achieve our vision, we need innovative, inspiring and dynamic people to join our team. Want to join us?

Your new role -

Figshare employs a Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) microservices architecture and provides to its clients a highly-configurable research repository solution, chosen by academic, government and corporate institutions to store and share various types of outputs. As a migrations engineer you will assist new clients in transferring content from their existing platforms to Figshare, by maintaining, extending and executing the routines we already have in place for such migrations. You will work closely with both Figshare's support and implementations department and the development team in order to provide sound and expedite migration plans.

Along with the account manager and project manager devise content migration plans
Execute test migrations, provide results to clients and act on feedback
Carry out migrations of large corpora on Figshare's production systems

Familiarity with software development life cycle techniques and tools
Familiarity with web applications and APIs
Familiarity with relational databases and SQL is a plus
Very good English speaking and writing skills
Bachelor's degree

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up.

Products that will be used by millions of people around the world (18+ million people, not that we’re counting) 🌎

Do you have a weird thing for bugs? No, not insects – the computer ones 🖥

If so, you’re the one for us. We’re looking for a Junior Application Security Engineer to join our Information Security team.

But, it’s not that easy – remember, we Never Settle 💪

You’ll need to be able to show your passion with bug bounty findings, community talks, certifications, and blog posts on your interest.

If this is ‘so you’, you know where to find us… 👀

What You’ll Be Doing
Providing knowledge, experience and support across all our security teams, and wider Technology and Business teams, as well as associated initiatives
Performing source code reviews across Revolut’s projects
Performing web and mobile app security testing
Managing and reviewing external testing and bug bounty programs
Innovating & building tools and solutions to add to our arsenal of security monitoring and testing procedures
Getting involved in the Software Development Life Cycle, embedding security architecture principles and efficient risk-based change review processes to support our product releases
Thinking of and implementing new ways to automate and improve security across our business

What You'll Need
1+ year of experience in the information security field
Experience performing security testing (code review and web/mobile application security testing)
Experience with Java, Swift, Python, Scala
An understanding of the technology stack
An ability to automate and script your work (Python, bash scripts)
A love for solving problems
SAST/DAST skills
The ability to explain complex things in an easy way
An eye for details
Experience developing security tools
To be familiar with automations
An understanding of DevSecOps

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.
