LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) is a Conversational AI company creating digital experiences that are Curiously Human. Every person is unique, and our technology makes it possible for companies, including leading brands like HSBC, Orange, and GM Financial, to treat their audiences that way at scale. Nearly a billion conversational interactions are powered by our Conversational Cloud each month.

You'll be successful at LivePerson if you are excited to build something from the ground up. You excel by finding daily opportunities to grow at the same pace as the technology we're building, and you build partnerships that improve our business. Likewise, you're someone who sees feedback as a chance to learn and grow and believe decisions powered by data are the norm. You care about the wellbeing of others and yourself.

Overview:

Welcome to the Data Platform team at LivePerson! Here you will be working with internal and external AI platforms, making it better and easier for brands to help their customers via messaging.

In this role, you will be working across many internal teams, external partners, and large customers to enable AI-based agent matching and routing solutions. This is a new capability to the LivePerson platform and includes a mix of modernizing legacy systems and building entirely new features from the ground up.

You will:
Design, build, and deploy Java-based enterprise-level solutions.
Build and maintain high volume data pipelines using Spark, Databricks
Build innovative analytical solutions using Cloud, Big Data, and NoSQL related technologies
Actively participate in code review and test solutions to ensure it meets best practice specifications
Maintain and support existing applications and services with uptime on par with industry-standard.
Utilize monitoring tools and logging services to debug and analyze production issues.
Be responsible to maintain production pipelines for various services under the Data Platform team.
Test software to ensure proper and efficient execution and adherence to business and technical requirements

You have:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering
4+ years of experience in Java or Scala, backend systems developer.
Ability to build efficient and reliable SQL pipelines to support analytic use cases
Ability to effectively communicate designs via flowcharts, sequence diagrams, and similar.
Strong computer science fundamentals, including data structures and algorithms.
Experience working with data at scale, including Kafka and NoSQL databases.
Demonstrates the ability to self-learn and grow.
Solid understanding of software design principles, concurrency, synchronization, memory management, data structures, algorithms
Strong communications capabilities both written and verbally
Team player with a can-do approach

Nice to have: (Desired)
Experienced with cloud-based systems (AWS, GCP, or Azure).
Exposure to Databricks, Spark, SparkSQL is a huge plus
Data engineering experience

Benefits:
Health: medical, mental, dental, and vision
Time away: vacation, holidays, care days,
Additional: exclusive perks and discounts

Why you'll love working here:

Your entrepreneurial spirit will be supported. We love team members who chase down their big ideas, become experts, help colleagues, and own their work. These four company values guide our continued, holistic growth as individuals, as teams, and as a global organization. And to further make our point, let's just say we're very proud to be on Fast Company's list of Most Innovative Companies and Newsweek's list of most-loved workplaces.

Belonging at LivePerson

At LivePerson, people from diverse backgrounds come together to make an impact and be their authentic selves. One way we share and connect is through our employee resource groups such as: Live In Color, LP Proud, and Women In Tech. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law.

We are committed to the accessibility needs of applicants and employees. We provide reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should inform their recruiting contact upon initial connection.

job_title: Fullstack Software Engineer Onboarding eXperience - Paris or Remote France
description:
Headquartered in New York City, Dataiku was founded in Paris in 2013 and achieved unicorn status in 2019. Now, more than 1,000+ employees work across the globe in our offices and remotely. Backed by a renowned set of investors and partners including CapitalG, Tiger Global, and ICONIQ Growth, we’ve set out to build the future of AI.

Helping users to successfully use your product, continuously nudging them with the right elements, at the right moment with the right channel, is a critical part of any top-notch software. In that context, Dataiku is looking for a talented software engineer to create a seamless and unified help and onboarding experience for Dataiku. Dataiku brings together big data and AI technologies into a unique and easy-to-use platform. It allows data scientists to process data with SQL databases, Spark, and Kubernetes with either user-friendly interfaces or code. The platform is technology-agnostic and can adapt to any ecosystem.

What We Do

The goal of the OPALS project (Onboarding, Product Adoption, Learning, and Support) is to create an outstanding help and onboarding experience for the end users. In particular, by creating a unified experience between online Dataiku services and the product, we help users to understand the value of the product, find and implement use cases, get support along the way and upskill them into experts and champions.

What You Will Be Doing

You will work on full-stack projects for Dataiku, including some greenfield projects leveraging modern frameworks such as Node.js and Vue.js. Our current technical stack is based on a mix of Java, Javascript and Python.

Here Are Some Examples Of What You Might Do
Create public SaaS components and APIs, and securely integrate those components with third parties such as CRMs, live chat, chatbots and outbound messaging applications
Implement and leverage gamification mechanism
Create a unique learning center for user to upskill on the product
Design smart help assistant with user-centric recommendation mechanism
Design advanced in-product tutorials and tours framework
You Are The Ideal Recruit If
You have experience in software development and are interested in creating smooth onboarding experiences that strive to create adoption
You are customer-oriented - you want to understand how the product is used and solve actual customer problems.
You can't resist the beauty of gems
You're familiar with user experience concepts and methodologies
You have firsthand experience (either professional or personal) building a real product
You are humble and kind
You don't hesitate to ask questions when you don't know, and you treat your colleagues with respect, kindness, and honesty
Dataiku’s culture is right for you if:
You want to be able to define your own version of work-life balance - flexible is our go-to word, it applies equally to remote work, vacations and parental benefits
You need autonomy to thrive - we trust our people, give them space to do their best and stay away from artificial deadlines
You enjoy spending time with your colleagues and learning from your peers - meet for Friday universities, annual offsites, virtual trivia nights and more
You like feeling cared about - watch out for the magical Christmas box delivered at home and an unforgettable onboarding week
You care about giving back - it’s what our Ikig.AI program is all about: Dataikers are encouraged to work pro bono for one or several nonprofits of their choosing
If you want to learn more about our hiring process, you can read this article about our engineering hiring philosophy .

About Dataiku

Dataiku is the platform for Everyday AI, systemizing the use of data for exceptional business results. By making the use of data and AI an everyday behavior, Dataiku unlocks the creativity within individual employees to power collective success at companies of all sizes and across all industries. Don’t get us wrong: we are a tech company building software. Our culture is even pretty geeky! But our driving force is and will always remain people, starting with ours. We consider our employees to be our most precious asset, and we are committed to ensuring that each of them gets the most rewarding, enjoyable, and memorable work experience with us. Fly over to Instagram to learn more about our #dataikulife.

Our practices are rooted in the idea that everyone should be treated with dignity, decency and fairness. Dataiku also believes that a diverse identity is a source of strength and allows us to optimize across the many dimensions that are needed for our success. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment practices are based on business needs, without regard to race, ethnicity, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, veteran status or any other aspect which makes an individual unique or protected by laws and regulations in the locations where we operate. This applies to all policies and procedures related to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, performance, promotion and termination and all other conditions and terms of employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please contact us at: reasonable-accommodations@dataiku.com

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - External Device Interface (m/f/d)
description:
At CARIAD, it’s our mission to transform automotive mobility for everyone, everywhere, making it safer, more sustainable, and more comfortable in every way.

To deliver on that promise, we’re building a unified technology and software platform, including a vehicle OS and cloud platform, as well as a unified architecture. As a 100% subsidiary of the Volkswagen Group, we’re developing solutions for all of its brands, including Volkswagen, Audi, and Porsche, and will bring our software to over 40 million vehicles by 2030.

Is this an easy task? Not at all! To tackle such a huge challenge, we need a great team. And that’s where you come in. You’ll join more than 5,000 CARIDIANS already working on the latest vehicle features and functions like automated driving, state-of-the-art charging technology, as well as a new digital ecosystem. Together, we’re bringing sustainable change to one of the largest companies in the world.

YOUR TEAMThe Mobile & In-Car Apps department is building apps running on the mobile device as well as apps running on the infotainment system. The feature team Local Command & Control enables innovative features on the mobile device for direct communication with the vehicle. Examples are: Remote Parking (Control parking and pullout maneuver from outside of the vehicle), Personalisation (Automatically login to the infotainment system when approaching the vehicle), Light control (Demonstrate and personalize the exterior light of the vehicle), Holoride (Adapt virtual reality content to the movements of the vehicle), Calendar (Show calendar data from the mobile phone in the vehicle), External device interface (provides access to vehicle interfaces from a mobile device).

External device interface brings both worlds of mobile and in-car apps together: there is a software component on the infotainment system that makes the interfaces available over direct communication channels and there is an API on the mobile device that provides access to those interfaces. External device interface enables vendor specific extensions of CarPlay / Android Auto and controlling vehicle functions remotely from a mobile device from outside or inside of the vehicle.

#Infotainment

What You Will Do

Shape the software for providing access to vehicle interfaces on the infotainment system
Define and develop the software component in the infotainment system to make the vehicle interfaces available for certain use cases
Be actively involved in each step of the solution definition, including the feature definition, the architecture and the design
Collect and analyze requirements from stakeholders and turn them into features of the software component
Perform experiments in test benches or vehicles to evaluate the vehicle interfaces
Implement the software component, perform primal system integration and adapt it to new platforms
Analyze occurring issues along development chain
Be part of the validation and verification of the implemented solution at all levels

Who You Are

Successfully completed studies in the field computer science or an equivalent field
Several years of experience in Android development with Kotlin and/or Java an familiar with software development environments and analysis tools
Habituated in the usage of direct communication channels (Bluetooth Low Energy, WiFi, iAP2, Android VEC) inside Android
Experience in vehicle communication (SomeIP, CAN, …) and Android Automotive (AAOS or AOSP)
Ideally knowledge about the C and/or C++ programming language for native code and open to agile working model (SAFe, Scrum)
European Driving license class B
Fluent English language skills, German language skills are a plus

NICE TO KNOW

Remote work options
Temporary work from abroad in selected countries
Flextime / optional working hours
Company pension plan
Annual professional development
Sabbatical option up to 6 months
30 days paid + 10 days unpaid leave
Possibility for VW Group car leasing
If you have further questions about the candidate journey at Cariad, talk to Cari, our Cariad Chatbot. Can’t see it? Check your settings or visit our FAQ

job_title: Full Stack Engineer, Ruby on Rails
description:
iCapital is powering the world’s alternative investment marketplace. Our financial technology platform has transformed how advisors, wealth management firms, asset managers, and banks evaluate and recommend bespoke public and private market strategies for their high-net-worth clients. iCapital has more the 800 employees and services approximately $131 billion in global client assets invested in over 1’000 funds, with offices in New York (headquarters), New Jersey, Connecticut, Massachusetts, Zurich, London, Lisbon, Hong- Kong and Singapore.

iCapital was named Solutions Provider of the Year at the 2020 MMI/Barron’s Industry Awards and selected to the Forbes FinTech 50 for the past five years, a list of the top 50 innovative financial technology companies that are transforming finance through technology.

About The Role

The Full Stack Engineer at iCapital Network will work end-to-end on new features, enhancements, and defect resolution on one or more of iCapital's software platforms. You will work closely with our Product Management team throughout the software development process, detailing requirements, reviewing work in progress, and addressing issues found via manual test efforts. You will be working with Ruby on Rails for back end and React for front end.

At iCapital, we value expertise in other programming languages and business areas. More than checking the boxes on specific technologies, we are looking for driven team members with technical depth and a desire to deliver end products for our clients. If you are not already familiar with the technologies used at iCapital, you will have the opportunity to pick up these new tools and technologies while on the job—with support from management and mentors.

You’ll be able to opt-in into our internal technology rotation program that will provide you the opportunity to:
Work across multiple functional areas supported by technology
Gain a deeper and holistic understanding of how our technology platform operates
Be exposed to different management styles

Responsibilities

Backend feature development in Ruby (2.6.6) and Rails (6.x)
Frontend development in React and Redux
Unit and integration test development using RSpec, Cucumber, and Capybara
Active participation in daily stand up meetings
Active participation in Peer Code Reviews as part of our standard SDLC and Change Management Process

Qualifications

Degree in Software Engineering
4+ years of Full Stack, web-based application development
4+ years of development experience with Ruby on Rails. Python/Elixir would be a good substitute if less expertise on Ruby
4+ years of HTML / CSS development
Demonstrated understanding of relational database concepts and modeling practices
Passion for actively learning new technologies
Ability to work independently or as part of a group effort, as required
Solid problem solving abilities
Excellent communication skills
Collaborative approach to software development
Fluency in English and Portuguese required — written and verbal

Benefits

iCapital offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes a total compensation program consisting of competitive salary, annual performance bonus, and equity for all full-time employees; healthcare with 100% employer-paid health and dental insurance; and generous paid time off (PTO).

For additional information on iCapital Network, please visit https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us Twitter: @icapitalnetwork | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/icapital-network-inc

Department: Sales & Marketing

Reporting to the Senior Marketing Manager of Brand Services, the role will be responsible for Marketing tasks and objectives as part of the Brand Services marketing team.

The Brand Services division is focused on providing domain name and brand protection services to organizations all over the world.

The role is home based, with occasional travel to offices in London (UK) or St. Ingbert (DE) as required and permitted by global travel circumstances.

Return analyze

What's in it for you?

There are many reasons to come on board our team of talented professionals, but here are just a few…
We are collaborative, fair, consciously inclusive, and flexible
We trust, value, and support our people to make the difference
We believe that diversity of thought and experience provides the platform for innovation and creativity
We invest in the development of our people to drive our ambitions forward

If you need assistance completing an application for a position with us or need us to make any reasonable adjustments, please reach out to our Recruiting Team at talent@centralnic.com

#LI_REMOTE

ETAP bildet die Beleuchtung der Zukunft. Wir entwickeln qualitätsvolle, hochwertige Beleuchtungslösungen für professionelle Umgebungen. ETAP ist ein belgisches Familienunternehmen, das sich durch verlässliche, dauerhafte und innovative Produkte unterscheidet. Die Produktion findet komplett in unserem Hauptsitz in Malle statt. Über verschiedene Verkaufsstellen sind wir weltweit aktiv.

Stellenbeschreibung
Sie akquirieren in Ihrer Region aktiv neue Projekte und sprechen potentielle Kunden an (Berater, Installateure, Architekten etc.). Sie bauen langfristige Beziehungen zu unseren Kunden auf und sind in der Lage, deren Anforderungen zu identifizieren. Auf der Grundlage Ihrer hervorragenden Kenntnisse der Produkte von ETAP präsentieren Sie energisch, leidenschaftlich und begeistert unsere Lösungen. Falls erforderlich, stellen Sie Speziallösungen vor.
Mit großem Verhandlungsgeschick arbeiten Sie auf einen Win-Win-Deal hin und realisieren diesen.
Sie berichten dem Sales Manager unter Verwendung eines CRM-Tools über Ihre Aktivitäten.

Sie begleiten Ihre Projekte von A-Z und werden dabei von Ihrem internen Sales-Kollegen unterstützt.
Sie orientieren sich bei Ihrem Vorgehen an der Strategie für Ihre Region und den Aktivitäten, um Ihre Ziele zu erreichen.

Sie vertreten ETAP in der Region und präsentieren sich selbst jederzeit als zuverlässigen Beleuchtungsspezialisten.

Profil:

- Sie fühlen sich von der Stellenbeschreibung, unserem Unternehmen und unseren Produkten mehr als angesprochen und Sie sind davon überzeugt, zum Erfolg des Unternehmens einen positiven und entscheidenden Beitrag leisten zu können

Darüber hinaus sind folgende Aspekte ein Plus:
- Sie besitzen einen Bachelorabschluss in einem kaufmännischen oder technischen Studiengang.
- Und Sie verfügen über mindestens 5-10 Jahre Erfahrung in einem projektbasierten kaufmännisch-technischen Bereich, vorzugsweise mit hochwertigen gebäudetechnischen Produkten.
- Es fällt Ihnen leicht, Kontakte zu knüpfen, und Sie sind ein guter Organisator und legen Wert auf eine gründliche Nachbereitung Ihrer Aufgaben.
- Sie sind ergebnis- und dienstleistungsorientiert sowie ein loyaler Teamplayer.
- Sie sind ein belastbarer, positiv eingestellter Kollege, der lösungsorientiert und verantwortungsbewusst ist.

Wir bieten:
- Wir bieten eine herausfordernde Stelle in einem dynamischen Team, das energieeffiziente, innovative und nachhaltige Lösungen entwickelt.
- Sie arbeiten mit hochwertigen Produkten und für einen renommierten Partner, der für qualitativ hochwertige Beleuchtungslösungen steht.
- Sie erhalten eine umfassende Schulung, die alle Aspekte beinhaltet, die ETAP ausmachen.
- Einen (un)befristeten Vollzeitvertrag
- Ein attraktives Gehalt mit zusätzlichen Leistungen wie: ….., Gruppenversicherung (Altersvorsorge), Krankenversicherung und vermögenswirksame Leistungen.
- Einen Leasingwagen.

job_title: Python Software Engineer - Ubuntu Hardware Certification Team
description:
Canonical is hiring a Python Software Engineer to join the Certification team, who make the tools which enable us to know that a desktop, laptop, server or IoT device is working properly. We work at the interface of hardware and software, so the ideal candidate is a Python developer familiar with hardware.

The Certification team develops the tools needed to certify hardware as working with Ubuntu Core as well as Ubuntu Desktop and Server: https://ubuntu.com/certified

We design hardware which can be used to probe devices independently, and frameworks for software tests that check every aspect of Ubuntu on that hardware.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact for adoption of Linux across multiple device categories and industries. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development opportunities. This team is centered in EMEA time zones, and works with colleagues on related teams in both the Americas and APAC.

We work together with silicon companies, OEMs, ODMs and teams within Canonical to ensure a smooth, secure out of the box Ubuntu experience, with success in this role leading to a great Ubuntu experience being offered on more and more devices.

Role description

We are looking for a self-motivated software engineer with experience developing in Python, to work on test automation tools or Linux based embedded hardware. This role offers an exciting opportunity to push the industry forward by enabling entirely new Linux based hardware testing capabilities, scaling up hardware certification efforts and allowing for deeper test coverage.

The role involves the development and maintenance of Canonical's open source certification tools, supporting the creation of hardware solutions for test automation, and automating our existing processes. We seek out continuous process and tooling improvements as part of expanding the certification test suites, ultimately to improve the quality of Linux experience felt by millions of Linux end users.

Key responsibilities
Maintain and develop new features to our Python based test automation tools like Checkbox, used by both in-house teams and industry partners.
Invent new ways to enable remote, automated testing.
Help build the software counterpart to in-house designed testing hardware to help test device enablement (graphics, hotplug, bluetooth, etc).
Write functional and performance tests to support hardware enablement and to protect from regressions.
Participate in meetings involving international travel 2-3 times per year.

Required Skills And Experience
Knowledge of Python programming language.
Quality oriented, pragmatic approach to software design and implementation.
Interest in test automation methodologies.
Previous experience working with Ubuntu or other Linux distributions.
Ability to be productive in a globally distributed team.

Desired Skills And Experience
Passion for tinkering: you are a maker.
Experience working in an agile environment.
Hardware testing experience, for example in the IoT space.
Familiarity with the C programming language.

What is Canonical?

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, "the world's best free software platform". Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

#Stack

The MS datacentre development portfolio consists of complex, multi-disciplinary, large scale, multi-year datacentre construction and lease projects. The Microsoft Datacentre Land Development and Permitting team supports the development and delivery of Microsoft’s datacentre portfolio from site selection through design, construction and handover to operations.

Microsoft is looking for a Development & Permitting Project Manager to have a key role in coordinating across internal teams (e.g. Environment, Engineering and Design, Construction, Government Affairs, Community Engagement etc.) to ensure delivery of operation-ready data centre sites. They will support the development and execution of permitting strategies for the lifecycle delivery of datacentre development and will be a key contributor in the execution of comprehensive permitting programs and to the Microsoft pre-construction program.

In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

Responsibilities

The successful candidate will:
Lead stakeholder engagement and represent Microsoft in key meetings with applicable authorities having jurisdiction (AHJs), regulatory agencies, politicians and other external stakeholders to facilitate data centre development
Manage the development and permitting and approvals process for projects to enable new data centre development and construction throughout the EMEA Region
Conduct comprehensive assessments throughout due diligence, design and construction and coordinate with key counterparts to develop permitting and project delivery strategies in order to minimise risk
Own the land development budget for the projects and lead progress through decision stage gates and into construction
Negotiate development agreements with real estate developers and support site seller negotiations
Scope and negotiate local infrastructure improvements with AHJs
Work with partner teams to deliver utility easements and water connections
Prepare and present reports on project progress and potential risks to internal and external audiences
Work with internal and external stakeholders to identify innovative solutions to meet permitting requirements and facilitate timely approvals to resolve potential delays to construction or other activities
Work with construction and operation teams to hand over permits and facilitate future compliance
Qualifications

Required:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Construction, Real Estate, Urban Planning or equivalent area
Substantial experience in real estate or infrastructure project development
Experience delivering zoning, permits, planning and other development approvals for large scale and/or complex construction projects
Experience managing a portfolio of projects and associated budgets and schedules
Ability to establish and maintain cross-functional and positive working relationships with internal and external teams including environmental consultants, attorneys, contractors, and regulatory agencies
Strong written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail and high standards for quality of deliverables.
Preferred
Proficiency in relevant local languages
Community Engagement and Stakeholder engagement experience
Mission critical design and/or construction experience
Experience in delivering projects in multiple jurisdictions
These requirements include, but are not limited to, the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

#COICareers

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

Our Technology team isn’t just one of the best in the industry, it’s one of the best in the world. And we’re proud of it. It’s our driving force; our engine 🚀 From building a new banking backend to creating an award-winning app, there’s nothing (and we mean nothing) our tech team can’t do. Our Technology team isn’t here to fix legacy systems – it’s here to build world-class financial products from the ground up.

Products that will be used by millions of people around the world (18+ million people, not that we’re counting) 🌎

Do you have a weird thing for bugs? No, not insects – the computer ones 🖥

If so, you’re the one for us. We’re looking for a Junior Application Security Engineer to join our Information Security team.

But, it’s not that easy – remember, we Never Settle 💪

You’ll need to be able to show your passion with bug bounty findings, community talks, certifications, and blog posts on your interest.

If this is ‘so you’, you know where to find us… 👀

What You’ll Be Doing
Providing knowledge, experience and support across all our security teams, and wider Technology and Business teams, as well as associated initiatives
Performing source code reviews across Revolut’s projects
Performing web and mobile app security testing
Managing and reviewing external testing and bug bounty programs
Innovating & building tools and solutions to add to our arsenal of security monitoring and testing procedures
Getting involved in the Software Development Life Cycle, embedding security architecture principles and efficient risk-based change review processes to support our product releases
Thinking of and implementing new ways to automate and improve security across our business

What You'll Need
1+ year of experience in the information security field
Experience performing security testing (code review and web/mobile application security testing)
Experience with Java, Swift, Python, Scala
An understanding of the technology stack
An ability to automate and script your work (Python, bash scripts)
A love for solving problems
SAST/DAST skills
The ability to explain complex things in an easy way
An eye for details
Experience developing security tools
To be familiar with automations
An understanding of DevSecOps

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

There has never been a better time to join Extreme, with several acquisitions extending our portfolio and go to market strategy, we have seen enormous opportunity and growth within the region.

Aside from being a Technology Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant, we also adamantly promote an internal culture that truly embraces diversity, inclusion and equality in the workplace. Having Diversity and Inclusion as part of our core values and beliefs, we’re proud to foster an environment where every Extreme employee can thrive because of their differences, not despite them.

The SE provides specific technology/product consulting, technical sales support for major account opportunities, performs in-depth and high-level technical presentations for various departments / locations at the global account and potential affiliated businesses. The SE also performs technical consulting, support for RFI/RFP responses and upper level management and/or in-depth presentations on Extreme Networks technology solutions in context of the Global Account.

Candidate Requirements

Extreme Networks certifications is desirable, but not mandatory

Strong Gigabit and 10 Gigabit Ethernet LAN switching and routing technical skills

Ability to demonstrate a broad knowledge of key protocols and technologies, such as MPLS, Routing Protocols, Ethernet and Wireless Technologies

Ability to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of future trends and market directions

A sound knowledge with Layers 2-7 of the OSI model along with strong data communication network design experience

A good understanding of two or more of the following networking technologies:

Network Access Control (NAC)

Voice/Data Convergence

Wireless LAN

SDN OpenFlow/OpenStack/VXLAN

Ability to support customer evaluations, demonstrations and detailed design requirements

Good General Hands-on Lab Experience Is Required

Domestic/International travel will be required

At Extreme, we value your contribution

Training resources: you will have various resources to choose from for your technical & personal development

Technical equipment and work resources: you will be staffed with newest top technology and any equipment needed for feeling comfortable at your workplace

Direct participation at company’s success: aside commission earnings, you can voluntarily enroll to our subsidized Employee Stock Purchase Program

Flex First: our flexible work model is engrafted into our culture as we endeavor to have a global workforce that is seamlessly connected no matter where we are

Recreation time matters: our working time model gives you major flexibility on taking time off when you need it – in addition to your 30 vacation days a year (considering a 5-day-work-week)

Employee Assistance: we provide you with lots of programs and activities, but also individual support as desired

On top insurances: you will be enrolled to our insurances on Business Travel, Pension Scheme and Life & Occupational Disability

And so much more…

Nos bases de données (MySQL Aurora),

Tu travailleras plus précisément et principalement sur les connecteurs et API de nos partenaires ERP et logiciels de visio-conférence.

Stack

- Back : Nodejs/Typescript

au minimum 2 ans d'expérience en développement web avec Javascript, et plus particulièrement avec les frameworks Angular & Nodejs (fullstack),
idéalement déjà travaillé avec l'infrastructure AWS & l'environnement Linux,

Un.e bosseur.euse
Curieux.euse
Force de proposition

Rémunération définie en fonction de tes compétences.

Wheely brings technology and luxury together—blending modern engineering with traditional chauffeuring, for the world's most discerning clientele.

Over the past few years, we have rebuilt our infrastructure almost from scratch. And now we are expanding the infrastructure team.

As a part of the team, you will work to minimize the number of incidents (availability, performance, security) and speed up time-to-delivery new features to customers, building flexible, high availability, and protected infrastructure to ensure every customer's journey/request runs smoothly.

About Wheely

Wheely is building the future of luxury personal services—starting with a product that combines highly trained chauffeurs, the finest in-car experiences, and instant availability via a well-designed app. We currently manage 3,000+ chauffeurs in London, Paris, Moscow, and Dubai, and have raised $28mn USD to date.

Responsibilities
Create dedicated sandboxes for product teams to minimize possible conflicts when teams develop and test features at the same time
Implement the best practices to ensure the proper security level of our infrastructure
Ensure a comprehensive audit of access to any parts of the infrastructure
To complete implementation of single secrets storage
To finalize implementation of centralized authorization system in the infrastructure for developers
Build comprehensive monitoring/alerting system to prevent or proactively work with incidents
Help teams with incidents investigation relates to databases, message brokers, networks, and clouds
Participate in growing the engineering culture / DevOps practices to make Wheely one of the best places to work

Requirements

Tech stack: AWS, Kubernetes, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, RabbitMQ, Redis, Ansible, Terraform, Grafana, Prometheus, Datadog, Sentry, Loki, Jenkins.
Proven experience in designing and implementing cloud-based solutions (AWS/GCP)
In-depth knowledge of Linux troubleshooting, including networking, file systems, security, and the kernel
Experience in infrastructure automation using Ansible, Terraform, Bash, Python, etc
Experience with containers and platforms such as Docker, Kubernetes, etc
Experience with administration RabbitMQ/Nats/Kafka
Experience with SQL/NoSQL databases, preferably MongoDB, PostgreSQL
Have good writing and verbal communication skills to ensure efficient communication within and outside the team and to explain your decisions
Ability to focus on what matters most, manage your time, and get things done
To be a team player, ready to help engineers investigate issues or teach them new things
Love to automate manual work and try new modern technology/approaches

Benefits

Wheely expects the very best from our people, both on the road and in the office. In return, employees enjoy flexible working hours, stock options and an exceptional range of perks and benefits.
Competitive salary
Option plan for every employee
Medical insurance including dental services
Life and Critical Illness insurance
Lunch allowance
Relocation allowance
Top notch equipment
Continuous professional development

The role is a key function for supporting our sales teams and customers by being a technical acumen for our HMI techno-commercial solutions.

Your Main Responsibilities

Support the Sales Team in preparing and submitting technical and commercial offers to customers.
Proactively attend customer site meetings to conduct product presentations and site surveys.
Deliver with accuracy of the proposed HMI techno-commercial solutions.

Support the factory for price of component / equipment for which standard price list are not available.

Preparation / generate of a complete and comprehensive offer
Review of offer calculation and submittal prior to quote submission. Prepare Tender Vet, DOA and align with customer service team, product management & Engineering.
Take active role in new product integrations and drive to incremental sales.
Support product management in voice of customer.

Your essential skills we are looking for:

Completed studies or apprenticeship in the commercial field or business administration
Solid professional experience in the customer related field of the Electrical/Electronics industry
Strong technical knowledge of Industrial HMI products
Very good SAP knowledge
Strategic thinking and analytical personality with the ability to influence and drive things forward
Fluent English and German language skills

What We Can Offer To You

Challenging projects in dynamic collaborative team
We make your perspectives matter - Different points of view are what drive innovation and collaboration, and at Eaton, innovation begins with top-to-bottom diversity. Our senior leadership is made up of individuals from diverse groups to help create an environment where employees feel represented and heard at every level.
We make your growth matter - We invest in our employees for the long term – not just with salary and benefits, but with ongoing learning and development opportunities made available through Eaton University
We make your contributions matter - reliability, safety, efficiency, and sustainability are at the core of our dedication to improving people’s lives and the environment through power management technologies.


Eaton is an intelligent power management company dedicated to improving the quality of life and protecting the environment for people everywhere. We are guided by our commitment to do business right, to operate sustainably and to help our customers manage power ─ today and well into the future. By capitalizing on the global growth trends of electrification and digitalization, we’re accelerating the planet’s transition to renewable energy, helping to solve the world’s most urgent power management challenges, and doing what’s best for our stakeholders and all of society. Founded in 1911, Eaton has been listed on the NYSE for nearly a century. We reported revenues of $19.6 billion in 2021 and serve customers in more than 170 countries.


Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030.


Eaton is committed to having a workforce that is diverse and non-discriminatory at all levels, reflecting the diversity of our customers and the varied environments in which we conduct business around the world. Our success depends on our ability to attract and retain the very best people unlimited by race, color, social or economic status, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any protected status. Eaton follows relevant non-discrimination laws and regulations in the countries where we operate. It is the policy of the Company to make all decisions regarding employment, including hiring, compensation, training, promotions, transfers, or lay-offs, based on the principle of equal employment opportunity as defined above.

Job: Sales

Region: Europe, Middle East, Africa

Organization: EPG CHD HAC Hazardous Area Communications

Job Level: Team Leader/Supervisor

Schedule: Full-time

Is remote work (i.e. working from home or another Eaton facility) allowed for this position?: Yes – Hybrid

Does this position offer relocation?: Relocation from within hiring region only

Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

We are digital builders born in the cloud and currently, we are looking for Software Developers.

Joining Nordcloud is the chance of a lifetime to leave your mark on the European IT industry! We use an agile, cloud-native approach to empower clients to seize the full potential of the public cloud.

Your Daily Work
Working as part of our team of software professionals, building applications that are at the core of our client’s businesses, creating e.g. effective electronic customer service and distribution channels, information services, online stores, and applications for the industrial internet
Helping with technical and architectural planning of the application
Sharing your knowledge among team members and supporting them with their technical challenges
For us, it’s important to find interesting projects matching your career goals, be they more front-end, back-end, or data-heavy. Based on your interests, there are possibilities for various career paths, including team lead, coding cloud applications architect, data-driven developer, delivery or pre-sales support, solution architect, tech ambassadorship, cloud strategy consulting, etc.

Your Skills And Attributes Of Success
At least 3 years of work experience
At least 2 years of work experience in backend technologies: Node.js, Python, C#/.NET, Java, Clojure, or something else
At least 2 years of work experience in frontend technologies: JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Angular, Vue or Svelte
At least 6 months of work experience with the cloud: AWS, Azure or Google Cloud
We value experience with serverless or cloud-native solutions and container technologies (e.g. Kubernetes or Docker).
You value code that is easily read by humans and efficiently executed by machines
Fluent ways of communicating with the customer and your team members
Motivation to learn new, share your knowledge and grow to the next level
Fluent communication skills in English and Finnish
If you don’t meet all of the desired criteria, but still fit most of the requirements, we encourage you to apply anyway. Let’s find out together if we are a good fit for each other!

What do we offer in return?
A highly skilled multinational team
Individual training budget and exam fees for partner certifications (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) and additional certification bonus covered by Nordcloud
Access to join and the possibility to create knowledge-sharing sessions within a community of leading cloud professionals
Flexible working hours and freedom to choose your tools (laptop and smartphone) and ways of working
Freedom to work fully remotely within the country of Finland
Local benefits such as extensive private health care and wellness benefits
Please read our Recruitment Privacy Policy before applying. All applicants must have the right to work in Finland.

If you’d like to join us, please send us your CV or LinkedIn profile.

About Nordcloud

Nordcloud, an IBM company, is a European leader in cloud advisory, implementation, application development, managed services, and training. It’s a recognized cloud-native pioneer with a proven track record of helping organizations leverage the public cloud in a way that balances quick wins, immediate savings, and sustainable value. Nordcloud is triple-certified across Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services – and is a Visionary in Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud IT Transformation Services. Nordcloud has 10 European hubs, over 1500 employees, and counting, and it has delivered over 1,000 successful cloud projects.

Learn more at nordcloud.com

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity

Adobe Experience Platform is the Adobe solution that helps customers to centralize and standardize their customer data and content across the enterprise powering 360-degree customer profiles, enabling data science and data governance to drive real-time personalized experiences. With Experience Platform, enterprises are able to use fully-coordinated marketing and analytics solutions to drive meaningful customer interactions.

Adobe Audience Manager is a crucial part of this ecosystem, featuring the platform's most complex real-time data collection service. This solution supports some of the best known and most successful brands in the world. It accomplishes this by processing billions of requests every day and synthesizing petabytes of data with high fidelity and velocity. Adobe helps customers make sense of that data, get insights and run algorithms, so they can deliver delightful experiences in real-time, every time.

If managing, growing, and tweaking complex and robust solutions based on open-source technologies at large-scale is something you’re into or even might interest you, let’s share some thoughts, we’d like to meet!

Learn more:

https://www.adobe.com/experience-platform.html https://www.adobe.io/apis/experienceplatform/home.html

https://experienceleague.adobe.com/docs/experience-platform/rtcdp/overview.html?lang=en

https://experienceleague.adobe.com/docs/audience-manager.html

What You'll Do

You will join an autonomous and diverse Scrum team, assembled to craft, deliver and run distributed, resilient, scalable, highly available services and software components that compose our stack. The team is accountable for the design, implementation, deployments, maintenance and uptime, with a constant focus on quality, security and cost efficiency.
Collaborate with other peer groups and roles to transpose business requirements into feature specs, establish integration design, resolve dependencies and adopt best-practices.
Share knowledge via mentoring, presentations, blogs and conference.
Research, prototype and stay up to date with the evolution of the industry.
Perform on-call activities, on rotation with the rest of the team.
What you need to succeed

BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience, 5+ years of commercial software development experience
Proven development skills in Java / Scala with confirmed experience of writing clear, high-quality and well-documented code for building high-scale, high-performance and secure services.
Experience in RDBMS & NOSQL databases, web services, micro-services, REST, OOD, SLC, CI/CD, source control tools, DevOps principles, observability. Familiarity with distributed computing systems, Cloud infrastructures, Spark, Akka, Kafka, Kubernetes, is a huge plus!
Adaptable to changing priorities, accepting challenges, learning new technologies, prototyping new ideas, delivering viable solutions within defined time boundaries. Adopting iterative development cycles based on short and long term strategy.
A working style that influences good software development practices, open communication, and collaborative work ethics would make a flawless fit.
Good English level: written and spoken

At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

If you’re looking to make an impact, Adobe's the place for you. Discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the Adobe Life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer.

Adobe is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or veteran status.

Wer sind wir? Wir sind Daten-Versteher und setzen uns für die Gesundheit der Bevölkerung ein.

job_title: Backend Software Engineer (Application Platform team) - Engagement Pillar
description:
Bloomreach is the world’s #1 Commerce Experience Cloud, empowering brands to deliver customer journeys so personalized, they feel like magic. It offers a suite of products that drive true personalization and digital commerce growth, including:
Discovery, offering AI-driven search and merchandising
Content, offering a headless CMS
Engagement, offering a leading CDP and marketing automation solutions

Together, these solutions combine the power of unified customer and product data with the speed and scale of AI optimization, enabling revenue-driving digital commerce experiences that convert on any channel and every journey. Bloomreach serves over 850 global brands including Albertsons, Bosch, Puma, FC Bayern München, and Marks & Spencer. Bloomreach recently raised $175 million in a Series F funding round, bringing its total valuation to $2.2 billion. The investment was led by Goldman Sachs Asset Management with participation from Bain Capital Ventures and Sixth Street Growth. For more information, visit Bloomreach.com.

We are currently expanding our Application Platform team and we are looking for Backend Software Engineer. Is "security", "curiosity" or "growth" your middle name? Then you are a good fit and you can be one of us. You can work remotely or from one of our local offices. The salary starts at €3,000 based on your experience level.

About your role and the team:

The Application Platform team empowers other engineering teams to build their services effectively and with security and compliance built-in by designing, implementing, and maintaining the magic solid foundations and the core frameworks of the Bloomreach Engagement.

Examples of the initiatives driven by this team are:
Integrated zero-trust authentication and authorization management system.
Platform for collecting and processing audit logs in a distributed environment.
Notification center, which allows other teams to communicate information to customers through a single unified channel (upcoming project).

What you might like about this role:
Wide reach - we deal with teams across the company - product, security, architects, engineers, even customers.
Security perspective will be a key element of your day-to-day work
Developing Cloud Native services consumed by customers as well as other engineering teams

What your typical day might look like:

You start your day with a code review of your colleague’s tasks while sipping a cup of fresh-brewed tea or coffee, looking for any signs of problems and possible optimizations. Then you join your teammates on a quick daily standup, where you discuss what you’re currently working on and the plan for the next few days.

After the meeting, you get into “the zone” and spend a few undisturbed hours working on the new authentication framework while making sure it’s safely covered by a suite of unit tests. With a few clicks you quickly spin up a brand new instance of the system in the development cluster, deploy your change and notify the frontend engineer that it’s ready.

You grab a snack and take a little break from coding. Instead, you help a fellow backend engineer from another team figure out the best way to integrate their new service with the audit logging platform. In the meantime the frontend engineer gets back to you and confirms that all the new endpoints work as expected, so you create a merge request and ask your teammates for a code review. It’s a complex piece of code, so you go through it together.

After your code is approved, you merge it, automatically deploying it to the staging environment where it receives further testing by the QA team and automated integration tests before being released to production.

You end your day in a short meeting with a product manager and the director of engineering, where you flesh out the idea you had over lunch yesterday for a new approach to release management that would make the whole process even faster.

Our tech stack:
Python & Go
MongoDB, Redis, Apache Kafka
Kubernetes (GKE)
Various Google Cloud Platform services (Pub/Sub, BigTable, DataFlow, ...)
Gitlab CI/CD, Prometheus and Grafana

What we expect of the candidate:

The ideal candidate has:
At least 3 year experience developing in Python or Golang
Designing and implementing production-grade REST APIs
Having experience with operating services in production is beneficial
A working understanding of fundamental web security principles (OWASP), Authentication and Authorization practices
Experience with database systems of different kinds (MongoDB, Redis, Apache Kafka)

Regional benefits:
Monthly lunch entitlement by up to 110€ per month
Pension scheme or Health insurance depending on region

More things you'll like about Bloomreach:

Culture:
A great deal of freedom and trust. At Bloomreach we don’t clock in and out, and we have neither corporate rules nor long approval processes. This freedom goes hand in hand with responsibility. We are interested in results from day one.
We have defined our 5 values and the 10 underlying key behaviors that we strongly believe in. We can only succeed if everyone lives these behaviors day to day. We've embedded them in our processes like recruitment, onboarding, feedback, personal development, performance review and internal communication.
We believe in flexible working hours to accommodate your working style.
We work remote-first with several Bloomreach Hubs available across three continents.
We organize company events to experience the global spirit of the company and get excited about what's ahead.
We encourage and support our employees to engage in volunteering activities - every Bloomreacher can take 5 paid days off to volunteer*.
The Bloomreach Glassdoor page elaborates on our stellar 4.6/5 rating. The Bloomreach Comparably page Culture score is even higher at 4.9/5

Personal Development:
We have a People Development Program -- participating in personal development workshops on various topics run by experts from inside the company. We are continuously developing & updating competency maps for select functions.
Our resident communication coach Ivo Večeřa is available to help navigate work-related communications & decision-making challenges.*
Our managers are strongly encouraged to participate in the Leader Development Program to develop in the areas we consider essential for any leader. The program includes regular comprehensive feedback, consultations with a coach and follow-up check-ins.
Bloomreachers utilize the $1,500 professional education budget on an annual basis to purchase education products (books, courses, certifications, etc.)*

Well-being:
The Employee Assistance Program -- with counselors -- is available for non-work-related challenges.*
Subscription to Calm - sleep and meditation app.*
We organize ‘DisConnect’ days where Bloomreachers globally enjoy one additional day off each quarter, allowing us to unwind together and focus on activities away from the screen with our loved ones.
We facilitate sports, yoga, and meditation opportunities for each other.

Compensation:
Stock options are granted depending on a team member’s role, seniority, and location.*
Everyone gets to participate in the company's success through the company performance bonus.*
We offer an employee referral bonus of up to $3,000 paid out immediately after the new hire starts.
We celebrate work anniversaries -- Bloomversaries!*

(*Subject to employment type. Interns are exempt from marked benefits, usually for the first 6 months.)

If this position doesn't suit you, but you know someone who might be a great fit, share it - we will be very grateful!

Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Bloomreach are considered property of Bloomreach and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

PRÉSENTATION DE L'ENTREPRISE
NetCeler est une entreprise de plus de 65 personnes en forte croissance. Une équipe soudée et animée de valeurs fortes de partage, transparence, réactivité et réalisme, où les talents de chacun sont mis en valeur.
Depuis plus de 25 ans, en France et à l’international, NetCeler propose des logiciels innovants de monitoring pour l’industrie dans 3 secteurs phares : le métier du stationnement, l’industrie pharmaceutique et le transport d’électricité.
TYPE DE POSTE ET MISSIONS
Rattaché au directeur du département Parking et en collaboration avec une équipe d’une dizaine de personnes, vous intégrerez une équipe de développement pluridisciplinaire pour développer des produits logiciels innovants à destination du métier du stationnement.
Nos stacks techno s’appuient principalement sur Python, PHP/Javascript, C mais aussi SQL (PostgreSQL), Java ou C/C++.
PROFIL ATTENDU
De formation bac+5 de type ingénieur, vous êtes passionné par le développement informatique de logiciels métier, et avez à cœur de comprendre le métier des utilisateurs.
Vous maîtrisez Python, PHP, C et Linux et connaissez les outils de développement, de test et d'intégration associés.
Des connaissances en WebService, socket TCP réseau et/ou Java seront un plus.
Vous êtes adepte des pratiques et outils de développement modernes (Intégration continue, Jenkins, TDD, Devops, etc…) et des outils de travail collaboratif (Jira, BitBucket, Git, Google WS, etc…).
Vous recherchez un travail en équipe vous permettant de vous exprimer au sein d’une structure à taille humaine où les talents de chacun sont mis en valeur.
Vos qualités : rigoureux, communicant, réaliste et conscient que les enjeux humains sont au cœur de la réussite des projets.
Vous maîtrisez l’anglais professionnel.

Niveau de formation : bac +5 ou équivalent exigé - Domaine informatique industrielle et réseaux

Avantages : mutuelle / chèques-vacances/intéressement
Durée hebdomadaire travail : 35 h
Déplacements : occasionnels France / Europe

job_title: Juniorberater im Bereich Green PLM (m/w/d) mobiles Arbeiten
description:
InMediasP steht für Digitale Transformation – mit unseren Beratungs- und Softwareentwicklungsprojekten gestalten wir den Product Lifecycle von morgen, vom Konzept bis aufs letzte Bit. Zu den Herausforderungen unserer Kunden gehören zunehmend Themen wie Nachhaltigkeit, CO2-Footprint und Kreislaufwirtschaft sowie die damit verbundenen Anforderungen an die Produktdokumentation – von der ersten Idee bis zum Recycling und der Entsorgung der Produkte. Wir unterstützen diese Anwendungsfälle mit innovativen Prozessen, Methoden und Technologien des Product Lifecycle Managements – „Green PLM“. Mit einem Team aus Allroundern und Spezialisten kreieren wir seit 1998 Software-Unikate und individuelle Prozessabläufe abseits vom Gewöhnlichen. Für unsere Kunden aus der Automobil- , Hausgeräte-, Schienenfahrzeug- und Luftfahrtindustrie entwickeln wir unser Leistungsangebot stetig weiter und sind damit immer am Puls der Zeit.

Deine Aufgaben
Die Entwicklung marktfähiger Produkte unter Einhaltung aller Regularien aus den Bereichen Nachhaltigkeit, Ökobilanz und Kreislaufwirtschaft ist äußerst komplex. Die Gewährleistung einer konsistenten Produktdokumentation über den gesamten Lebenszyklus wird immer mehr zum Erfolgsfaktor der Unternehmen. Ein aktives Umweltbewusstsein in Bezug auf die eigenen Produkte, verbunden mit einer klaren sozialen Verantwortung, sind für die Kunden gleichermaßen relevant wie für die eigenen Mitarbeiter. Unterstütze uns bei der Entwicklung geeigneter Methoden und datenbasierter Lösungen für „grüne“ Anwendungsfälle. Gestalte mit uns und unseren Kunden eine nachhaltige und umweltschonende Wertschöpfung:

Mithilfe von Workshops und/oder Interviews identifizierst Du die relevanten Anwendungsfälle, nimmst die Anforderungen des Kunden auf und stehst auch im weiteren Beratungsprozess als Ansprechpartner zur Verfügung
Du lernst die regulatorischen Anforderungen aus den Bereichen Kreislaufwirtschaft, Produktzertifizierung etc. kennen und zu verstehen und leitest daraus relevante Anforderungen der Kunden an ihre PLM-Prozesse und -Systeme ab
Du entwickelst IT-Konzepte, -Lösungen und -Methoden zur Unterstützung einer nachhaltigen, umweltverträglichen Wertschöpfung
Als Schnittstelle zur Softwareentwicklung stimmst Du erarbeitete Ergebnisse ab und validierst diese in Form von Tests
Du konzipierst Schulungsunterlagen und implementierst die neu entwickelten IT-Lösungen in Form von Schulungen bei den Stakeholdern
Eigenständig verantwortest Du das Projektmanagement

Dein Profil
Du hast einen Hochschulabschluss in einem Ingenieurs-, Informatikstudiengang oder in einer verwandten Studienrichtung
Du hast Interesse daran, IT-nah zu arbeiten und bringst erste theoretische Kenntnisse aus dem PLM-Umfeld mit
Sich mit Produktentwicklungsprozessen zu beschäftigen und sich auf die Entwicklung von IT-Konzepten oder das Anforderungs- und Testmanagement zu fokussieren, bereitet Dir Spaß
Dir ist der Austausch im Team wichtig
Wechselnden Herausforderungen stellst Du Dich gern
Du bringst die Bereitschaft zum Reisen mit

Deine Einsatzorte
Hennigsdorf bei Berlin, Stuttgart oder München
Mobiles Arbeiten

Deine Benefits
Eine unbefristete Einstellung
Work Life Balance: Gleitzeitsystem mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit zum mobilen Arbeiten
Spannende Einblicke in die Produktentwicklung großer Industrieunternehmen
Individuelle Einarbeitung und Heranführung an wachsende Verantwortung durch erfahrene Kollegen
Regelmäßige inner- und außerbetriebliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Sehr gute Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten durch regelmäßige Orientierungsgespräche
Über 100 tolle Mitarbeiter-/innen, die gemeinsam mit der Geschäftsführung und den Führungskräften ein außergewöhnlich gutes, familiäres Arbeitsklima schaffen und fördern
Wir arbeiten nicht nur, wir können auch feiern – und zwar zu diversen Anlässen im Jahr!
InMediasP bezuschusst die betriebliche Altersvorsorge sowie die Bildung vermögenswirksamer Leistungen
Corporate Benefits - Mitarbeiterangebote zu super Konditionen

Mein Kunde, ein dynamisches und innovatives Unternehmen, welches es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht hat, durchdachte und maßgeschneiderte Kampagnen und Konzepte hinsichtlich Technik, Design und Content zu entwerfen sucht zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt ein neues Teammitglied.

Fundierte Deutschkenntnisse

job_title: Full Stack Engineer (Ruby on Rails) - Vice President
description:
iCapital is powering the world’s alternative investment marketplace. Our financial technology platform has transformed how advisors, wealth management firms, asset managers, and banks evaluate and recommend bespoke public and private market strategies for their high-net-worth clients. iCapital services approximately $113 billion in global client assets invested in 942 funds, as of January 2022.

iCapital was named Solutions Provider of the Year at the 2020 MMI/Barron’s Industry Awards and selected to the 2018, 2019, 2020 and 2021 Forbes FinTech 50, a list of the top 50 innovative financial technology companies that are transforming finance through technology.

About The Role

The Full Stack Engineer at iCapital Network will work end-to-end on new features, enhancements, and defect resolution on one or more of iCapital's software platforms. You will work closely with our Product Management team throughout the software development process, detailing requirements, reviewing work in progress, and addressing issues found via manual test efforts. You will be working with Ruby on Rails for back end and React for front end.

At iCapital, we value expertise in other programming languages and business areas. More than checking the boxes on specific technologies, we are looking for driven team members with technical depth and a desire to deliver end products for our clients. If you are not already familiar with the technologies used at iCapital, you will have the opportunity to pick up these new tools and technologies while on the job—with support from management and mentors.

Responsibilities

Backend feature development in Ruby (2.6.6) and Rails (3.x)
Frontend development in React and Redux
Unit and integration test development using RSpec, Cucumber, and Capybara
Active participation in daily stand up meetings
Active participation in Peer Code Reviews as part of our standard SDLC and Change Management Process

Qualifications

Degree in Software Engineering
10+ years of Full Stack, web-based application development
10+ years of development experience with Ruby on Rails. Python/Elixir would be a good substitute if less expertise on Ruby
10+ years of HTML / CSS development
Team management experience
Demonstrated understanding of relational database concepts and modeling practices
Passion for actively learning new technologies
Ability to work independently or as part of a group effort, as required
Solid problem solving abilities
Excellent communication skills
Collaborative approach to software development
Fluency in English and Portuguese required — written and verbal

Benefits

iCapital offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes a total compensation program consisting of competitive salary, annual performance bonus, and equity for all full-time employees; healthcare with 100% employer-paid health and dental insurance; and generous paid time off (PTO).

For additional information on iCapital Network, please visit https://www.icapitalnetwork.com/about-us Twitter: @icapitalnetwork | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/icapital-network-inc

The Developer Relations team at Canonical engage with community and enterprise software developers to help them embrace the Canonical approach to open source. We enable community developers and ISVs to deliver their applications to millions of Linux users and devices as snaps, charms, debs and Docker images. We also bring their feedback to engineering teams at Canonical for continuous improvement.

As a Developer Relations Engineer, you will spearhead the adoption of new technologies in upstream communities. You will identify exciting new areas of development, programming languages, and classes of application, and explore ways to deliver those applications to Ubuntu users. Then you will reach out to community leaders and technical leaders in those ecosystems and build a common understanding of the best approach to application delivery on Ubuntu for their work. You will contribute to code and technical documentation. This position will challenge you to become an expert in the technologies on which we build the Ubuntu ecosystem, and will utilize your communication, presentation and persuasion skills. We aim to inspire the next generation of engineers to work more efficiently with open source, adopting the latest practices and shaping Canonical tools to suit new workflows and priorities.

This role is a good fit for someone who is tech-savvy, passionate, collaborative, and who can communicate with a wide range of audiences. You must be a professionally qualified software engineer with open source experience. You will definitely need to be technically skilled with Linux. Experience with Ubuntu, snaps, charms or Docker images and familiarity with desktop and Linux server software development are valuable skills for the role.

You will represent not only the Ubuntu community but also Canonical as a contributor to the wider open source ecosystem. You will work in a distributed team and travel internationally 2-4 times per year for engineering sprints, community summits, industry events, and strategic planning sessions.

What you will do
Gain a deep understanding of snaps, charms, debs and Docker images
Grow the developer community by attracting software developers and ISVs to the platform
Create content to scale up adoption, demonstrate best practices, and showcase new features
Provide input to development teams at Canonical based on feedback from ISVs, developers, and the wider community
Collaborate with software developers, product managers and technical writers
Write ecosystem specific guides, tutorials, release notes, and white papers
Curate existing documentation, performing periodic reviews, triage user feedback/bug reports and determine priorities for remedial work
Engage with the community through various means, including discourse, IRC, social media, conferences, etc.
Identify relevant influencers and devising plans on how to effectively engage with them
Deliver training workshops in person and remotely
Represent the platform via speaking engagements at industry events and community conferences

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
You value soft skills and are enthusiastic, thoughtful, and self-motivated
You have experience with developer tools and open source projects
You have a clear public record of accomplishments (talks, blog posts, GitHub, Twitter, etc)
You have interest and experience with two or more of Ubuntu Linux - kernel or userspace, DevOps, software development, testing and QA, package management, container technology
You can work autonomously and assume full ownership of objectives as needed
You can be flexible with your time and enjoy working with new technology in a fast-paced environment
You are experienced working with open source communities and understand the workflow of volunteer contributors

Nice to have
Experience with community management
Experience with developer advocacy
Experience as a software developer
Examples of contributions to the Ubuntu Community
Experience with contributing to open source projects

We offer
Learning and development opportunities and budget
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority pass for travel

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit globally and set a very high standard for people joining the company.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Rackspace are the multicloud solutions experts. Consistently named a 'best place to work' year-after-year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. As a leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Public Cloud MSPs, we keep the customer at the heart of everything we do and our Fanatical Experience™ is renowned throughout the industry!

Our EMEA Cloud Native Development Team consists of highly skilled professionals specializing in cloud native development on the three major public cloud platforms - AWS, Azure and GCP. We offer cloud native development and end-to-end testing – this is categorised into two main streams: Application Modernization - where we modernize an existing application, and Cloud Native Development of a net new application - in this case we build the application with latest cloud technologies like Serverless, Cloud SQL etc. ground up, fully taking advantage of all cloud native services.

If you’re looking for a challenging career working in a vibrant environment with access to training and a global network of experts, this could be the role for you. We like people who get involved in all levels of technical discussions, from architecture to hands on coding. As part of our global team, you'll be working with cutting-edge technologies and will have the opportunity to develop a wide range of new skills on the job.

Responsibilities
Participation in agile rituals (such as sprint planning, refinement, dailies, retrospectives, etc.)
Planning, realization, documentation of the work packages agreed upon in the agile iterations (including epics, stories, tasks, bugs, etc.)
Support of customer projects for the build-up and tear-down of cloud resources
Planning, realization, documentation of project components for automating cloud resources
Participate, support and help the customer Cloud Community with questions about the Cloud topic
Plan, participate and lead rituals, such as daily, sprint showcase or red/brown bag sessions, etc.
Service delivery is to be done in a nearshore model
Monitoring of the Customer Cloud Foundation cloud infrastructure and troubleshooting of outages.
Operation and further development of the Customer Self Service Portal Cloud Foundation
Refactoring and rearchitecting of the existing Self Service Portal

Requirements
Proven experience in software development or engineering.
Solid software engineering fundamentals gained through training, course work or relevant experience.
Scripting languages: Bash, PHP, Python, JavaScript or similar.
Infrastructure as Code: CDK, Terraform, Cloudformation or similar.
Code versioning: GIT (Bitbucket, Gitlab, Github).
Project organization tools: JIRA, Confluence
Virtualization/container services: Docker
RESTful web services and Domain Driven Design
Authentication mechanisms such as SAML, OIDC or oAuth.

Trust, Communication and Accountability are their core values. They deliver value and ensure growth by working in the team.
