Modernes Equipment von Apple
Teambuilding und Entwickler Meet-up ́s
Interne Fortbildungen, Teilnahme an Seminaren
Ein ideales Umfeld, in dem Du Dich selbst verwirklichen können
Abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben
Ein attraktives Gehalt

Über uns

Wir sitzen mit unserem Team in Köln im Rheinauhafen im KAP am Südkai, wo wir an innovativen Konzepten, Lösungen und Technologien von morgen für unsere Kunden arbeiten. Nicht nur der Blick auf den Rhein wirkt motivierend und inspirierend, sondern vor allem unser erfahrenes Team und unsere spannenden Kunden machen jeden Tag zu einem Erlebnis. Hier kannst Du Deine eigenen Ideen einbringen und selbstverantwortlich mitarbeiten.

Bayard unterstützt Unternehmen aus Handel, Industrie und Gesundheitswesen mit Data Syndication Services, die Grundlage für digital Commerce zu schaffen. Mit langjähriger Erfahrung in der Product Content Management-Beratung, umfassender Kompetenz in der Implementierung von PIM-Lösungen wie Syndigo, Stibo und Informatica und der eigenen Plattform byrd sind die Experten von Bayard die richtigen Partner des europäischen Einzelhandels, der Konsumgüterindustrie und des Gesundheitswesens für die digitale Transformation.

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

Adobe’s Enterprise team is looking for a hardworking, proactive Account Manager to ensure that the needs of our Enterprise clients are being supported. The Account Manager is responsible for the end-to-end management of Adobe's existing client relationships. Measures of success include revenue delivered vs. targets, up-sell and optimization effectiveness, client satisfaction and retention levels, and contribution to overall sales team and business unit. We are looking for an account manager in Germany who can demonstrate a history of quota over-achievement and deep customer relationships.

What You’ll Do

Maintain and grow existing client base including expansion of new offerings.
Drive specific product revenue in your accounts
Build strong, lasting relationships with customers by understanding their needs
and business objectives.
Perform outbound contact to existing customers to sell additional solutions.
Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of the complete capabilities of our
solution offerings.
Convert customer challenges into new opportunities
Maintain an active pipeline of forecasted opportunities to meet monthly, quarterly
and annual quota objectives.
Improve overall customer satisfaction in assigned customer accounts.
Work with various groups within Adobe (Product, Marketing, Finance and Engineering)
to provide customer feedback and drive revenue opportunities in the
region.

What You Need To Succeed

Minimum 3+ years proven track record of field account management/account
executive experience.
Proven Track record selling Complex Enterprise Solutions.
Ability to forge and maintain good business relationships.
Demonstrated analytical and computer skills.
Excellent communication and presentations skills with top-notch customer service
approach.
Proven experience in using quantitative and qualitative analysis to assess customer
relationships and make recommendations for each account.
Ability to remain calm in a fast-paced work environment and to demonstrate
thoughtful leadership in assessing problems/ opportunities and recommending
an approach to solving problems and pursuing opportunities
Ability to work successfully in a team environment with your Adobe ecosystem
including Renewals Specialists, Product Specialists, CSM’s, Solution Consultants
and Field Marketing.
Creative problem-solving approach.
Experience in selling technology

Zur Unterstützung unseres DMS Teams suchen wir Dich als ECM Applications Developer (m/w/d) mit Deiner Fähigkeit und Leidenschaft im mobilen Arbeiten.

DEINE AUFGABE

Der Schwerpunkt deiner Tätigkeit ist die Weiterentwicklung bestehender und die Entwicklung neuer ECM Applikationen. Die Basis bildet unser Dokumentenmanagementsystem EASY DMS.
Du arbeitest teamorientiert an der Standardisierung von dokumentenintensiven Prozessen durch Customizing und Scripting in EASY DMS.
Zu Deinen Aufgaben gehören die Konzeption, der Entwurf, die Implementierung, die Qualitätssicherung und die Dokumentation Deiner Lösungen.
Du führst Optimierungen und Verbesserungen an unseren Produkten durch.

DEINE QUALIFIKATION

Du besitzt ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine Ausbildung zum Fachinformatiker bzw. einen vergleichbaren Ausbildungshintergrund.
Du verfügst über praktische Erfahrungen mit JavaScript, HTML, SQL, WebServices sowie Linux und Docker und möglichst mit mindestens einem ERP/CRM System.
Du bringst neben der Softwareentwicklung, Erfahrung in Kundenprojekten mit, die typische Geschäftsprozesse aus dem Bereich Procure-to-pay oder HR abbilden.
Du hast einen Blick für gute User Experience bei Endanwendern.
Gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden Dein Profil ab.

DEINE CHANCE

Wenn du nach einem Arbeitsplatz suchst, an dem Du dich rundum wohlfühlen und dein volles Potenzial entfalten kannst, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Die Persönlichkeiten in unserem Team sind so individuell wie unsere Kundenlösungen und jeder bringt seine eigenen Stärken mit ein. Wir bieten dir eine Unternehmenskultur mit viel Herz und Verstand, basierend auf Respekt, Vertrauen und offener, ehrlicher Kommunikation. Bei uns wird Eigenverantwortung großgeschrieben, daher gilt bei uns das Prinzip von flexiblen Arbeitszeiten.

Flexible Arbeitszeiten

Du hast Lust deine guten Ideen in einem Umfeld mit Start-Up Charakter und für unterschiedlichste Branchen zu verwirklichen? Du willst einen Job mit Verantwortung übernehmen? Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig!

Wir - die EASY ApiOmat, ein Unternehmen der EASY SOFTWARE Gruppe – zeichnen uns durch Start-Up Mentalität und eine agile, prozess- und kundenorientierte Arbeitsweise aus. Video: MEET US in 2 Minutes!

Are you brave enough to challenge yourself?

Siemens Digital Industries (DI) is an innovation leader in automation and digitalization. Closely, collaborating with partners and customers, we care about the digital transformation in the process and discrete industries. With our Digital Enterprise portfolio, we provide and encourage companies of all sizes with an end-to-end set of products, solutions, and services to integrate and digitalize the entire value chain. Meaningful optimization for the specific needs of each industry, our outstanding portfolio supports customers to achieve greater efficiency and flexibility. We are constantly adding innovations to its portfolio to integrate groundbreaking future technologies. We have our global headquarters in Nuremberg, Germany, and have around 75,000 employees internationally.

Siemens EDA is part of Siemens Digital Industries and a leader in electronic design automation. We enable companies to develop better electronic products faster and more efficiently. We pioneer digitalization of electronic design and bring elite digitalization to the vision for our customers.

Join our team as “Intern C++ Software Engineer” in our office in Katowice, Poland.

You’ll help our customers drive digital innovation by

Are you a forward-thinking and aspiring undergraduate ready to take your next steps in the world of IT? Join our Intern Development Program and see for yourself how it differs from any other. Could this be the next exciting step on your journey to your career? If yes, start your year in industry with us at Siemens!

This is your chance to learn about how our work impacts everyday life across the world and you could be there at the center of that work. From learning how a line of code develops into millions of downloads, to exploring the depths and heights of our varying cloud projects, build your skills and see how you can be here with us, shaping the future.

The Challenge:

You will receive an individual training plan to help develop the specific skills and knowledge required for your role. By the end of this great journey of being an intern, you will be set up with the best knowledge and hands-on experience to equip you for your professional career in our varying projects.

What do you need to succeed ?

Currently a student or graduate in Computer Science or a related field
Able to commit 30-40h/week for this job
You have basic knowledge in C++ programming language and are willing to increase skills in this area
You have a passion in software development
You think logically, willing to self-learn and research, and take a creative approach to problem solving
Willingness to work independently and as part of the team
Attention to details and high-quality work
Eligibility to work legally in Poland without immigration support

The rest you can learn with us 😊

How Long Will The Internship Last

11 months with a possibility to be converted into a permanent position with Siemens

What we offer?

Taking part in developing of complex EDA products used by leading tech companies
You can work remotely from anywhere in Poland and from our office in Katowice
Salary and benefits (Lunch Subvention, Social Budget, Sport Card, English Classes, Employee retirement plans , nice office with Billard, Ping-Pong, Playstation)
Working tools

We offer an international environment with more than 140,000 customers around the world who already rely on our expertise in digitization. We are involved in exciting and varied customer projects in the aerospace, automotive and transportation, consumer products and retail, electronics and semiconductors, energy and utilities, industrial machinery and heavy machinery, maritime, and medical devices and pharmaceuticals industries. With us, you will find a team-oriented work environment, comprehensive training options and attractive benefits. Through individual target agreements and diverse career models with specialization options, we offer you the opportunity to grow professionally and personally.

We are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. Be part of the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow‘s reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds

job_title: C++ Audio Applications Developer (All levels, Multiple roles / Remote)
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

C++ Audio Applications Developer (All levels, Multiple roles / Remote)

About Avid

At Avid we create the digital audio and video technology that creative professionals use to make the most loved media in the world. Our tools are used every day by the best and most celebrated media professionals and artists to create films, music, live concerts, TV shows and broadcasts among others, which has earned us some thrilling awards along the way including two Oscars, a Grammy, and 18 Emmys recognizing our innovation in the industry.

Just like our customers, our colleagues are creative and inventive. This makes our mission more personal and real, and our work more meaningful and fun.

For more information about Avid and our products, visit www.avid.com.

ABOUT THIS JOB POSTING:

We are looking for talented C++ developers of all levels of experience (from Junior level all the way up to technical leads) who want to have an impact in the future of the music industry by contributing to the Avid Pro Tools product family and surrounding products and technologies.

If this resonates with you and if you meet the minimum requirements listed below, do not hesitate to apply, someone from our recruitment team will review your application as soon as possible.

Although our main hiring locations are Spain and Poland (any city), other countries will also be considered on an individual basis.

WHAT WE OFFER:

Here are some of the things you can count on when working for Avid:

Being part of one of the most recognized brands in the movie, music and broadcast business (when we perform, Earth shakes and superheroes fly!).
A competitive salary, bonuses and benefits (such as private medical insurance, life insurance and sport package subsidies, depending on location).
Full employment contract.
Flexible working hours.
A modern work from home policy.
Visa sponsorship and relocation support (depending on the position).

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

Solid foundation in computer science and object-oriented programming principles, both in theory and in practice.
At least intermediate level of proficiency in C++, including familiarity with common libraries and frameworks.
Experience using an integrated environment to write, build, and debug software applications.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively in written and verbal English.
To be successful in this role you must feel comfortable using available resources independently as well as asking colleagues for help when needed.

Desirable Skills And Experience

While not required, we are always looking for engineers with experience in the following areas. Some of these may be expected for higher seniority levels:

Experience developing real-time Audio applications.
Advanced level of proficiency in C++. Examples: templates, modern C++, parallel programming.
Ability to design code that is clean, maintainable, reliable, and efficient.
Experience applying practices to ensure quality such as unit testing and integration testing.
Experience developing system level software, such as device drivers for macOS or Windows.
Experience using tools such as code analyzers, sanitizers, and profilers.
Audio and/or video domain knowledge (digital signal processing, music technology, codecs, broadcast formats, etc.) or previous experience developing audio and/or video application software or devices.
Familiarity with Git tools and workflows.
Previous experience working as part of a multi-cultural, distributed team.

Avid is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

job_title: Backend Software Engineer (Application Platform team) - Engagement Pillar
description:
Bloomreach is the world’s #1 Commerce Experience Cloud, empowering brands to deliver customer journeys so personalized, they feel like magic. It offers a suite of products that drive true personalization and digital commerce growth, including:
Discovery, offering AI-driven search and merchandising
Content, offering a headless CMS
Engagement, offering a leading CDP and marketing automation solutions

Together, these solutions combine the power of unified customer and product data with the speed and scale of AI optimization, enabling revenue-driving digital commerce experiences that convert on any channel and every journey. Bloomreach serves over 850 global brands including Albertsons, Bosch, Puma, FC Bayern München, and Marks & Spencer. Bloomreach recently raised $175 million in a Series F funding round, bringing its total valuation to $2.2 billion. The investment was led by Goldman Sachs Asset Management with participation from Bain Capital Ventures and Sixth Street Growth. For more information, visit Bloomreach.com.

We are currently expanding our Application Platform team and we are looking for Backend Software Engineer. Is "security", "curiosity" or "growth" your middle name? Then you are a good fit and you can be one of us. You can work remotely or from one of our local offices. The salary starts at €3,000 based on your experience level.

About your role and the team:

The Application Platform team empowers other engineering teams to build their services effectively and with security and compliance built-in by designing, implementing, and maintaining the magic solid foundations and the core frameworks of the Bloomreach Engagement.

Examples of the initiatives driven by this team are:
Integrated zero-trust authentication and authorization management system.
Platform for collecting and processing audit logs in a distributed environment.
Notification center, which allows other teams to communicate information to customers through a single unified channel (upcoming project).

What you might like about this role:
Wide reach - we deal with teams across the company - product, security, architects, engineers, even customers.
Security perspective will be a key element of your day-to-day work
Developing Cloud Native services consumed by customers as well as other engineering teams

What your typical day might look like:

You start your day with a code review of your colleague’s tasks while sipping a cup of fresh-brewed tea or coffee, looking for any signs of problems and possible optimizations. Then you join your teammates on a quick daily standup, where you discuss what you’re currently working on and the plan for the next few days.

After the meeting, you get into “the zone” and spend a few undisturbed hours working on the new authentication framework while making sure it’s safely covered by a suite of unit tests. With a few clicks you quickly spin up a brand new instance of the system in the development cluster, deploy your change and notify the frontend engineer that it’s ready.

You grab a snack and take a little break from coding. Instead, you help a fellow backend engineer from another team figure out the best way to integrate their new service with the audit logging platform. In the meantime the frontend engineer gets back to you and confirms that all the new endpoints work as expected, so you create a merge request and ask your teammates for a code review. It’s a complex piece of code, so you go through it together.

After your code is approved, you merge it, automatically deploying it to the staging environment where it receives further testing by the QA team and automated integration tests before being released to production.

You end your day in a short meeting with a product manager and the director of engineering, where you flesh out the idea you had over lunch yesterday for a new approach to release management that would make the whole process even faster.

Our tech stack:
Python & Go
MongoDB, Redis, Apache Kafka
Kubernetes (GKE)
Various Google Cloud Platform services (Pub/Sub, BigTable, DataFlow, ...)
Gitlab CI/CD, Prometheus and Grafana

What we expect of the candidate:

The ideal candidate has:
At least 3 year experience developing in Python or Golang
Designing and implementing production-grade REST APIs
Having experience with operating services in production is beneficial
A working understanding of fundamental web security principles (OWASP), Authentication and Authorization practices
Experience with database systems of different kinds (MongoDB, Redis, Apache Kafka)

Regional benefits:
Monthly lunch entitlement by up to 110€ per month
Pension scheme or Health insurance depending on region

More things you'll like about Bloomreach:

Culture:
A great deal of freedom and trust. At Bloomreach we don’t clock in and out, and we have neither corporate rules nor long approval processes. This freedom goes hand in hand with responsibility. We are interested in results from day one.
We have defined our 5 values and the 10 underlying key behaviors that we strongly believe in. We can only succeed if everyone lives these behaviors day to day. We've embedded them in our processes like recruitment, onboarding, feedback, personal development, performance review and internal communication.
We believe in flexible working hours to accommodate your working style.
We work remote-first with several Bloomreach Hubs available across three continents.
We organize company events to experience the global spirit of the company and get excited about what's ahead.
We encourage and support our employees to engage in volunteering activities - every Bloomreacher can take 5 paid days off to volunteer*.
The Bloomreach Glassdoor page elaborates on our stellar 4.6/5 rating. The Bloomreach Comparably page Culture score is even higher at 4.9/5

Personal Development:
We have a People Development Program -- participating in personal development workshops on various topics run by experts from inside the company. We are continuously developing & updating competency maps for select functions.
Our resident communication coach Ivo Večeřa is available to help navigate work-related communications & decision-making challenges.*
Our managers are strongly encouraged to participate in the Leader Development Program to develop in the areas we consider essential for any leader. The program includes regular comprehensive feedback, consultations with a coach and follow-up check-ins.
Bloomreachers utilize the $1,500 professional education budget on an annual basis to purchase education products (books, courses, certifications, etc.)*

Well-being:
The Employee Assistance Program -- with counselors -- is available for non-work-related challenges.*
Subscription to Calm - sleep and meditation app.*
We organize ‘DisConnect’ days where Bloomreachers globally enjoy one additional day off each quarter, allowing us to unwind together and focus on activities away from the screen with our loved ones.
We facilitate sports, yoga, and meditation opportunities for each other.

Compensation:
Stock options are granted depending on a team member’s role, seniority, and location.*
Everyone gets to participate in the company's success through the company performance bonus.*
We offer an employee referral bonus of up to $3,000 paid out immediately after the new hire starts.
We celebrate work anniversaries -- Bloomversaries!*

(*Subject to employment type. Interns are exempt from marked benefits, usually for the first 6 months.)

If this position doesn't suit you, but you know someone who might be a great fit, share it - we will be very grateful!

Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our website or to personal email accounts of employees of Bloomreach are considered property of Bloomreach and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

Job Details

Was Sie tun werden

Sie unterstützen Anwendungen und haben Kenntnisse in MS SQL, VB.NET und C#? Wenn ja, dann haben wir eine tolle Gelegenheit für Sie! Die Stelle vereint das Wissen und die Fähigkeiten, die mit der Unterstützung und Umgestaltung unseres Anwendungsbetriebs verbunden sind. Diese Position umfasst die praktische Fehlerbehebung und die Bereitstellung von Lösungen für Erweiterungen, Aktualisierungen und Migrationen.

Wie Sie es tun werden
In dieser Funktion arbeiten Sie mit Interessengruppen zusammen, um mehrere Anwendungsdienste bereitzustellen, die anspruchsvolle Geschäftsanforderungen erfüllen. Sie erstatten Bericht über kritische KPIs, überwachen die Leistung, bieten Verbesserungsmöglichkeiten an und arbeiten eng mit dem deutschen HR-Team, einschließlich Payroll, zusammen.
Sie werden bei der Lösung komplexer Probleme mit Anwendungen, die sich auf den Geschäftsbetrieb auswirken, praktisch tätig sein. Außerdem geben Sie die Richtung vor und erstellen Roadmaps für Anwendungen, die auf zukünftige strategische Plattformen umgestellt werden.
Sie beheben Probleme, um die Betriebszeit und Verfügbarkeit der Anwendungen zu gewährleisten.
Verfolgung und Meldung aller offenen und abgeschlossenen Vorfälle an die Führungsteams
Zusammenarbeit mit dem HR-Team und den Leitern der technischen Teams, um die Auswirkungen von Vorfällen auf Produkte und Dienste zu erörtern
Verantwortung für die Optimierung von Anwendungen im Betrieb entsprechend den Anforderungen des Unternehmens
Funktion als zentraler Ansprechpartner für HR-Datenprobleme
Was wir suchen

Erforderlich
Nachgewiesene Berufserfahrung in der Implementierung von Anwendungen oder im Support-Service
Fortgeschrittene Erfahrung mit Microsoft SQL-Server
Programmierkenntnisse in C#, VB.NET und T-SQL/MS SQL
Erfahrung mit Microsoft Visual Studio und Microsoft Management Studio
Ausgezeichnete mündliche und schriftliche Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch
Ausgeprägte zwischenmenschliche Fähigkeiten, die Fähigkeit, in verschiedenen Kulturen zu arbeiten und eine proaktive Denkweise
Hervorragende analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, Prioritäten zu setzen und Probleme schnell zu lösen
Bevorzugt
Praktische Erfahrung mit HR-bezogenen Technologien
Programmierkenntnisse auch in ASP.NET, JavaScript oder HTML
Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit Microsoft Reporting Services und Software Integration Services
Wer wir sind

Bei Johnson Controls gestalten wir die Zukunft, um eine Welt zu schaffen, die sicher, komfortabel und ausgewogen ist. Unser verteiltes Team entwickelt innovative, koordinierte Lösungen, um Städte besser zu vernetzen, Gebäude intelligenter und Fahrzeuge effizienter zu machen. Wir arbeiten mit Leidenschaft daran, die Art und Weise, wie die Welt lebt, arbeitet und spielt, zu verbessern. Die Zukunft erfordert mutige Ideen, eine ehrgeizige Denkweise und Teamarbeit über Grenzen hinweg.

Wir glauben, dass Vielfalt und Integration wichtig sind und einen Unterschied machen. Indem wir uns den wahren Wert von Vielfalt und Integration zu eigen machen, uns damit vertraut machen, kritische Gespräche zu führen und unterschiedliche Perspektiven zu schätzen, werden wir einer der begehrtesten Arbeitsplätze sein.

Business Analyse

Was uns antreibt

Als Teil von Zühlke bist du umgeben von Innovation. Wir setzen auf Teamwork, agile Zusammenarbeit und führende Technologien, um die Zukunft zu gestalten und den Status quo in Frage zu stellen. Wir lieben es, Grenzen aufzubrechen und Neuland zu betreten. Auf diese Weise treiben wir Innovationen voran.

Unsere Kreativität, unsere Fähigkeiten und unsere Energie ermöglichen es uns, intelligente Ideen in wertvolle Lösungen zu verwandeln. Lösungen, die unseren Kunden helfen, innovative, effektive und nachhaltige Produkte, Lösungen und Prozesse auf den Markt zu bringen. Dafür schlägt unser Herz: «empowering ideas».

Was dich bewegt

Du sprichst die Sprache des Kunden: Der Fokus deiner Arbeit liegt auf den Bedürfnissen unserer Kunden. Als Requirements Engineer bei Zühlke beziehst du alle Stakeholder ein, leitest Workshops und bist in der Lage, Kundenvorstellungen in Konzepte umzusetzen. Du arbeitest in interdisziplinären Teams und erstellst in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Product Owner:innen und Projektleiter:innen der Kunden fachliche Spezifikationen.

Du realisierst gerne: Die Produkt-Vision der Kunden übersetzt du in die Umsetzungs-Mission des Entwicklungsteams. Du definierst eine Roadmap mit Meilensteinen und gibst dem Team eine Richtung vor. Die Anforderungen überführst du in Use Cases und User Stories und hilfst dem Kunden bei der Priorisierung der nächsten Schritte. Als Scope Owner:in über das Backlog stehst du dem Entwicklungsteam für Rückfragen zur Verfügung. Dabei behältst du auch die Nutzerbedürfnisse stets im Blick.

Kommunikation ist deine Stärke: Als Schnittstelle zwischen Business und IT bist du in der Lage beide Sprachen zu sprechen, um den Projekterfolg sicherzustellen. Mit Empathie und klarer Zielfokussierung schaffst du es auch die härtesten Nüsse zu knacken und ihre Bedürfnisse zu erfassen.

Growth Mindset: Sowohl Deine persönliche als auch die Weiterentwicklung des Teams ist Dir wichtig, daher engagierst du dich als Sparringspartner:in und Coach für das Team. Du möchtest Expert:in in deinem Fachgebiet werden oder deine Führungs- und Beratungskompetenzen ausbauen und schrittweise mehr Verantwortung in deinen Projekten übernehmen? Egal für welchen Weg du dich entscheidest, kannst du auf ein Netzwerk an hochqualifizierten Kolleg:innen und Expert:innen zurückgreifen.

Was uns wichtig ist

Du konntest bereits mindestens zwei Jahre Projekterfahrung als Requirements Engineer in agilen Softwareentwicklungsprojekten sammeln.
Mit deinem guten Verständnis für komplexe und technische Sachverhalte bist du in der Lage, Kundenbedürfnisse zu präzisieren und diese methodisch im Projekt umzusetzen.
Du bist kommunikationsstark und legst Wert auf einen offenen Austausch mit deinem Team und gegenüber unseren Kunden.
Du kommunizierst sicher in Englisch und hast sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (C1-Level) für die Zusammenarbeit mit dem Kunden und den Teams.

Für einen unfairen Vorsprung, wie du dein Interview bei uns meisterst - schaue dir diesen Blogbeitrag an Blogbeitrag .

Was das Arbeiten bei Zühlke ausmacht

Bei Zühlke fördern wir ein Growth Mindset und unterstützen den Erfolg unserer Mitarbeitenden durch kontinuierliche Weiterbildung und Coaching, um deine Karriere, deine Fähigkeiten und deine Persönlichkeit zu fördern. Wir tauschen regelmäßig Ideen aus, geben uns gegenseitig Feedback und lernen voneinander. Dabei legen wir Wert auf eine offene Kommunikation miteinander.

Profitiere außerdem von einem attraktiven Leistungspaket und der gemeinsamen Leidenschaft, jeden Tag unser Bestes zu geben.

Flexible Arbeitsmodelle
Erfolgsbeteiligung
Familienfreundlicher Arbeitsplatz
Initiativen für Gesundheit und Wohlbefinden
Selbstmanagement und die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und an neuen Herausforderungen zu wachsen
Einzigartige Veranstaltungen und teambildende Events

Wir lernen alle ständig dazu

Du hast das Gefühl noch nicht alle Anforderungen zu erfüllen? Wir erfahren gerne mehr über dich, deine Ambitionen und Ideen und freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Klingt nach einer tollen Art zu arbeiten?

Festanstellung

Vollzeit/ Teilzeit

Frankfurt , Hamburg , Hannover , München , Remote Deutschland , Stuttgart

Jetzt bewerben

Antonia Pfoertner

antonia.pfoertner@zuehlke-careers.com

Binance is the global blockchain company behind the world’s largest digital asset exchange by trading volume and users, serving a greater mission to accelerate cryptocurrency adoption and increase the freedom of money.

Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world?

BUSD is the top 2 regulated stablecoin that ranks 13th in the overall crypto market and 3rd among stablecoins by market cap. In less than two years since its debut, BUSD has become one of the fastest-growing cryptocurrencies while featuring a variety of utilities, from trading to lending and payment. BUSD has been listed by more than 420+ DeFi protocols 35+ Exchange, 27+Wallets, and with a 3.1+million holders and mass adoption strong ecosystem.Are you looking to be a part of the most influential company in the blockchain industry and contribute to the crypto-currency revolution that is changing the world? It's the very first time we are expanding the agile team, to jump into a more interesting competition in a bigger market. If you're passionate, dedicated, desperate to join a leading tier of a professional narrative, and a fan of all things challenging, we'd love to hear from you!

What Experience You’ll Love To Have

Work in a rapidly growing team of best-in-class professionals to execute the regulated stablecoin into a scalable and reliable service
Build a leading blockchain company with a $10B market-proven valuation
Build creative microservices that support stablecoin business in these financial services including KYC, account management, payment and settlement, mint and redeem, deposit to earn, APIs, etc
Increase the leading insight and understanding of blockchain
Explore the stablecoin use case on centralized platforms (eg. exchanges, banks, card, and payment companies, etc) as well as decentralized blockchain ecosystems (eg. BNB Chain, Ethereum, Solona, Polkadot, Polygon, etc)

Responsibilities：

Lead the engineering team and collaborate with the product and business team to design, develop, test, and deliver the stablecoin platform and new features, across our Web and Mini program
Take complete end-to-end technical & engineering ownership of one or more applications/product features. Investigate and resolve technical issues
Take a hands-on role in influencing and guiding day-to-day development activities by leading architecture decisions, participating in designs, design review, code review, and implementation
Creatively deliver the integration of the existing features, exchange services, and bank/payment channel services
Build publicly accessible APIs that make it smart, secure, and fast for institutions and counterparties to integrate with KYC, payment, and settlement systems
Extending the stablecoin service based on the mass adoption requirement, to deliver a better user experience process and services.

Preferred qualifications:

5+ years of full-time software engineering experience. Strong plus if has stablecoin, exchanges, payment service, APIs experience. Fluency in English
Experienced in developing web-based applications and microservices using Javascript/ Typescript/Golang and others. (We don't expect everyone to be an expert in all of these, and everyone has their specialties, but the more platforms you're comfortable with, the faster we can move.)
Capable to code with stress and independently, excellent organizing and planning skills
Strong leadership, have experience leading engineering teams and driving large-scale projects and products, in collaboration with product, design, and commercial teams, to succeed, to be able to lead a team of young/ambitious developers
Strong understanding of system performance and scaling. Independent enough to make important technical decisions on your own.

Preferred Qualifications

Stablecoin related, Exchanges, Payment service, API service experience. (From leading Crypto companies such as Binance, Coinbase, Tether, Circle, Paxos, FTX, Crypto.com , etc.)
Bank/big tech /financial institution products-related experiences
Knows how to write migrations and deploy code to EVM-compatible networks, Strong interest or experience in the cryptocurrency, decentralized finance space
Fluency in English. Great communication skills.

Working at Binance

Do something meaningful; Be a part of the future of finance technology and the no.1 company in the industry
Fast moving, challenging and unique business problems
International work environment and flat organisation
Great career development opportunities in a growing company
Possibility for relocation and international transfers mid-career
Competitive salary
Flexible working hours, Casual work attire

By submitting a job application, you confirm that you have read and agree to our Candidate Privacy Notice .

Abteilung Information

Winkler+Dünnebier GmbH (W+D) hat sich seit der Gründung 1913 als im Maschinenbau weltweit führender Technologie- und Servicepartner für die Mail- und Hygieneindustrie etabliert. Das Unternehmen entwickelt hoch effiziente Systemlösungen zur Produktion, Bedruckung und Kuvertierung von Briefumschlägen sowie zur Herstellung von Hygieneprodukten. W+D ist Teil des Barry-Wehmiller Konzerns und dort in der BW Converting Solutions Plattform verankert. Unsere Mitarbeiter tragen mit ihrer meist langjährigen Erfahrung und ihrem großen Engagement wesentlich zu dem ausgezeichneten Ruf unserer Maschinen und dem hervorragenden Service von W+D bei. Neben unseren Standorten in Deutschland arbeiten wir eng mit unseren Dependancen in den USA und Malaysia zusammen. Wichtig ist uns dabei ein kollegiales, international geprägtes Betriebsklima.

Barry-Wehmiller ist ein breitgefächerter globaler Anbieter von Lösungen für Engineering, Beratung und Fertigungstechnologien für Verpackungs-, Wellpappen- und Papierverarbeitungsindustrien. Die Kombination eines mitarbeiterorientierten Führungsstils mit operativen Strategien und nachhaltigem Wachstum ließ Barry-Wehmiller zu einem 3 Milliarden USD Unternehmen wachsen, dessen fast 12.000 Mitarbeiter eine gemeinsame Vision haben: Building a Better World through Business.

Jobbeschreibung
Durchführen von Fehlerdiagnosen an Antriebs- und Automatisierungssystemen
Feststellen von Fehlfunktionen und deren Ursache, Einleitung von geeigneten Maßnahmen zur Abstellung der Fehlerursachen
Durchführung der Servicearbeiten mittels Telefons, E-Mail und Fernwartung zum kurzfristigen Support internationaler Kunden
Durchführen von Inbetriebnahmen in unserer Produktion
Projektbezogene Montagen vor Ort (ca. 30% jährlich)
Anforderungen
Wir erwarten eine abgeschlossene Technikerausbildung bzw. eine Weiterbildung zum staatlich geprüften Techniker (m/w/d) Fachrichtung Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation als Facharbeiter mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung im Bereich der Antriebs- und Automatisierungstechnik
Kenntnisse in der Programmierung von Antriebs- und SPS-Steuerungen (vorzugsweise Siemens oder Bosch Rexroth)
gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Teamfähigkeit
Kreativität und Freude an der Entwicklung innovativer Lösungen
Kundenorientierung
Zielführende Arbeitsweise und Qualitätsbewusstsein
Bei Barry-Wehmiller sind wir uns bewusst, dass Menschen eine Fülle von Erfahrungen und Talenten mitbringen, die über die technischen Anforderungen einer Stelle hinausgehen. Wenn Ihre Erfahrung dem, was Sie hier aufgelistet sehen, nur nahekommt, ziehen Sie bitte trotzdem eine Bewerbung in Betracht. Wir wissen, dass das, was uns voneinander unterscheidet, oft zu Innovation, Spitzenleistungen und sinnvoller Arbeit führen kann - daher ermutigen wir Menschen mit unterschiedlichem Hintergrund, sich auf unsere Stellen zu bewerben. Bitte lassen Sie uns wissen, wenn wir für Sie während des Interview Prozesses angemessene Vorkehrungen treffen können.

Company

Winkler+Dunnebier

Canonical is seeking experienced Python/Go developers to build highly performant and secure identity and access management solutions that will be used across all company products. From Ubuntu One SSO to Juju, LXD and MAAS your work will define the way all Canonical users, clients and community members access their favorite open source applications.

Bring your experience with Python, Go and Kubernetes to help us transform the future of identity management at Canonical. Experience in the identity and access management (IAM) field is desirable but not required. You will work with upstream open source projects, alongside internal teams to deliver high quality software that can be deployed on bare metal, public cloud and Kubernetes.

As a senior engineer on the team, you'll bring significant software development experience, Kubernetes knowledge and a keen eye for software design, performance and security. You will learn about identity and access management standards and will integrate them across all of our product portfolio.

You will be involved in all the aspects of the software development process: you will design software, write high-quality code and tests, provide insightful code reviews, write documentation and help to troubleshoot issues.

In addition to the engineering behind the project itself, you'll have the chance to work with industry-leading teams inside Canonical, ensuring your work is backed by rock-solid data stores, and highly observable using our Kubernetes-based Observability stack. You'll work with broader open source communities, participating in "hackfest" events, webinars and conferences.

Who you are
Expertise in Python and Go software development
Experience working with container technology and Kubernetes
Strong understanding of software/infrastructure security and performance
Experience designing and/or operating large scale distributed systems
Knowledge of identity and access management technologies and standards is desirable but not essential

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

Come join the company that is reinventing cloud security and empowering businesses to thrive in the cloud. As the fastest-growing startup ever, Wiz is on a mission to help organizations secure cloud environments that will accelerate their businesses. Trusted by security teams all over the world, we have a proven track record of success and a culture that values world-class talent.

Our Wizards from over 13 countries work together to protect the infrastructure of our hundreds of customers, including 30% of the Fortune 500, who trust us to scan and secure over 230 billion files daily. We’re the leading player in a massive and growing market, but it’s still early enough for you to make a significant impact. At Wiz, you’ll have the freedom to think creatively, dream big, and use your full range of skills to contribute to our record growth. Come join our team and help us create secure cloud environments that allow the best companies to move faster.

Summary

As an Enterprise Solutions Engineer, you will be responsible for supporting our enterprise customers, reporting to the regional Enterprise Solutions Engineer Manager. You will partner directly with regional account executives to help change our customers view and how they approach cloud security. You will be their trusted advisor for all matters related to cloud security across AWS, Azure, and GCP. We are passionate about technical sales and helping our customers achieve the maximum value from our solution.

What You’ll Do
Partner with the sales team to provide technical leadership to our customers and prospective customers in conjunction with helping our team meet their quarterly sales targets.
Provide presentations to our customers and prospective customers such as whiteboards, product demonstrations, slides, and proof of value outcomes.
Help our customers and prospective customers plan in-depth test plans for showing the value of the Wiz platform in their environment (proof of value).
Invest time in learning new product features, industry related developments, and broadening your overall technical skillset.
Represent Wiz in technical forums such as trade shows, technical meetups, and industry events.

What You’ll Bring
Ability to deliver world class demonstrations and training experience to our channel customers
Mastered the technical sales process
Thrive in a creative technical role assisting partners to build a technical business delivery model
Experience in a sales engineering role delivering solutions to C-level executives at enterprise customers
Ability to travel up to 50% in a post-COVID
Cloud security experience
AWS/Azure/GCP hands on experience
Network engineering experience
Strong operating system, virtual machine, and container knowledge
Knowledge of risk-based security assessments and frameworks
Understanding of cloud identity, access, certificates, and keys

BONUS POINTS:
Experience with traditional CSPM tools
SaaS experience
Awareness of the CI/CD process
Familiarity with Infrastructure as Code

If your experience is close but doesn’t fulfill all requirements, please apply. Wiz is on a mission to build a special company. To achieve our goal, we are focused on hiring Wizards with different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences.

Wiz is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

By submitting your application, you acknowledge that Wiz will process your personal data in accordance with Wiz's Privacy Policy.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer - External Device Interface (m/f/d)
description:
At CARIAD, it’s our mission to transform automotive mobility for everyone, everywhere, making it safer, more sustainable, and more comfortable in every way.

To deliver on that promise, we’re building a unified technology and software platform, including a vehicle OS and cloud platform, as well as a unified architecture. As a 100% subsidiary of the Volkswagen Group, we’re developing solutions for all of its brands, including Volkswagen, Audi, and Porsche, and will bring our software to over 40 million vehicles by 2030.

Is this an easy task? Not at all! To tackle such a huge challenge, we need a great team. And that’s where you come in. You’ll join more than 5,000 CARIDIANS already working on the latest vehicle features and functions like automated driving, state-of-the-art charging technology, as well as a new digital ecosystem. Together, we’re bringing sustainable change to one of the largest companies in the world.

YOUR TEAMThe Mobile & In-Car Apps department is building apps running on the mobile device as well as apps running on the infotainment system. The feature team Local Command & Control enables innovative features on the mobile device for direct communication with the vehicle. Examples are: Remote Parking (Control parking and pullout maneuver from outside of the vehicle), Personalisation (Automatically login to the infotainment system when approaching the vehicle), Light control (Demonstrate and personalize the exterior light of the vehicle), Holoride (Adapt virtual reality content to the movements of the vehicle), Calendar (Show calendar data from the mobile phone in the vehicle), External device interface (provides access to vehicle interfaces from a mobile device).

External device interface brings both worlds of mobile and in-car apps together: there is a software component on the infotainment system that makes the interfaces available over direct communication channels and there is an API on the mobile device that provides access to those interfaces. External device interface enables vendor specific extensions of CarPlay / Android Auto and controlling vehicle functions remotely from a mobile device from outside or inside of the vehicle.

#Infotainment

What You Will Do

Shape the software for providing access to vehicle interfaces on the infotainment system
Define and develop the software component in the infotainment system to make the vehicle interfaces available for certain use cases
Be actively involved in each step of the solution definition, including the feature definition, the architecture and the design
Collect and analyze requirements from stakeholders and turn them into features of the software component
Perform experiments in test benches or vehicles to evaluate the vehicle interfaces
Implement the software component, perform primal system integration and adapt it to new platforms
Analyze occurring issues along development chain
Be part of the validation and verification of the implemented solution at all levels

Who You Are

Successfully completed studies in the field computer science or an equivalent field
Several years of experience in Android development with Kotlin and/or Java an familiar with software development environments and analysis tools
Habituated in the usage of direct communication channels (Bluetooth Low Energy, WiFi, iAP2, Android VEC) inside Android
Experience in vehicle communication (SomeIP, CAN, …) and Android Automotive (AAOS or AOSP)
Ideally knowledge about the C and/or C++ programming language for native code and open to agile working model (SAFe, Scrum)
European Driving license class B
Fluent English language skills, German language skills are a plus

NICE TO KNOW

Remote work options
Temporary work from abroad in selected countries
Flextime / optional working hours
Company pension plan
Annual professional development
Sabbatical option up to 6 months
30 days paid + 10 days unpaid leave
Possibility for VW Group car leasing
If you have further questions about the candidate journey at Cariad, talk to Cari, our Cariad Chatbot. Can’t see it? Check your settings or visit our FAQ

Project Description:
-The Technical Support Engineer will support client products from a major network infrastructure manufacturer, working directly with the partners and customers.
-The Engineer will work with a highly knowledgeable group of customers and act as an escalation point for other groups within the organization.

WORKING ON SHIFTS to cover 8 am - 21 pm

Responsibilities:
• Provide L1 and L2 Support for VARs, Distributors, service providers, enterprise customers, and end users via telephone, e-mail, and web.
• Troubleshoot complicated hardware and software issues, replicate customer environments and network problems in the lab.
• Manage critical customer issues and facilitate communication between customers, escalation, and engineering.
• Participate in cross-functional tasks such as new product development projects, support readiness teams, KB and other documentation activities.
• Provide on-site support for customers when needed.

Mandatory Skills Description:
• English fluency both written and spoken

L1 requirements
• From a technical college or university with networking, security, programming and NFV experience, like Engineering or Computer Science Degree preferred.
• Associate network knowledge (or higher) preferred - JNCIA (CCNA) or ability to achieve this within 6 months.
• Eager to learn technology, interest in programming and scripting
• Network fundamentals including routing, switching and security technologies
• Excellent team player
• Strong problem-solving skills
• Knowledge in IP networking in layers 2-4(TCP/IP, Ethernet, VLANs, VLAN stacking QoS, STP, RSTP, OSPF, RIP, VRRP, IGMP, MPLS, Multicast routing protocols)
• Excellent Communications and Interpersonal Skills required, with a passion for the Internet, its growth, and related new technologies.
• Ability to learn and integrate new technologies in a fast-paced environment

L2 requirement
• L1 requirement
• 2-3+ years of experience in a support role (field engineers or as technical support engineer)
• Experience mentoring junior team members
• Achieved a minimum of JNCIS certification and preferably JNCIP (CCNP or eq.) level certification
• Working experience with traffic generators and network protocols analysis tools
• Presentation skills
• Strong problem-solving skills, applicable to large and complex network scenarios
• Proven escalation management and leadership skills
• Able to multitask when several critical issues happen simultaneously

Nice-to-Have Skills:
-Knowledge of UNIX/Linux operating systems
-Good understanding of TCP/IP
-Ability to analyze packet captures
-Excellent client-facing skills

Languages:
-English: C1 Advanced Romanian: C2 Proficient

Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.

location: Loire-Atlantique, Pays de la Loire, France
description:
Role: Surgical Sales Specialist

Location: France - West (Nantes, Rennes, Angers)

As a leading innovator of women’s health, we at Hologic are empowering people to live healthier lives everywhere, every day. Our sales team is the face of our business, playing a vital role in increasing revenue, developing a strong impact on our brand reputation, and building long term customer relationships all amounts to our products reaching those in need. Working in partnership with marketing means our medical devices are at the forefront of customer’s minds.

What To Expect:

Conducting sales calls and meeting with key decision makers to introduce/upsell our entire portfolio of products.
Building rapport with existing clients and new.
Presenting and working closely with surgeons, physicians, nursing staff, hospital administration, supply chain, payers, health care providers and other necessary to achieve sales objectives.
Providing surgical procedure and technical product support in surgery as well as ongoing customer service in accordance with company policy.
Keeping abreast of market information for your territory to ensure maximization of market share, product acceptance, and specifications.
Travelling across the West of France working within an team of experienced, driven sales professionals.

What We Expect:

Ability to produce and execute a tactical Sales Plan.
Commercial experience of successfully selling capital and consumables within the medical industry, specifically within surgical, to sales forecasts.
Strong stakeholder management, building new business pipelines and upselling within existing clients.
Proven track record in exceeding forecasted sales targets.

So why join Hologic?

We are committed to making Hologic the company where top talent comes to grow. For you to succeed, we want to enable you with the tools and knowledge required and so we provide comprehensive training when you join as well as continued development and training throughout your career.

We offer a competitive salary and annual bonus scheme, one of our talent partners can discuss this in more detail with you. From a benefits perspective, you will join our wide-ranging benefits policy including Pension, Health Insurance and many more!

If you have the right skills and experience and want to join our team, apply today.

We can’t wait to hear from you!

[CRS.CTECH – Electronics – Grow It] At UL, we know why we come to work. Na UL, nós sabemos porque viemos para o trabalho diariamente. A ciência está em nosso DNA; nós somos infinitamente curiosos e apaixonados para procurar e falar a verdade. Nos sentimos felizes em saber que nosso trabalho oferece contribuições que tem importância para a sociedade, e temos orgulho em ter uma cultura centrada na integridade, colaboração, inclusão e excelência. A UL está à frente do avanço tecnológico e continuamente nos desafiamos a adotar novos caminhos de incentivo a inovação e a mudança positiva. Satisfatório? Sim. Emocionante? Com certeza! Experiencia comprovada com conhecimento JAVA , Spring , Mysql

Pessoas: Pergunte a qualquer colaborador(a) da UL o que ele(a) mais ama sobre trabalhar aqui. Você sempre irá ouvir: “as pessoas”. Ir além do que é possível

é padrão na UL. Nós somos capazes de entregar o melhor porque contratamos os melhores.

Trabalho interessante: Todos os dias, vivenciamos algo diferente aqui e estamos ansiosamente antecipando a próxima inovação que nossos clientes desenvolvem. Nós somos inspirados a iniciar desafios que irão transformar como as pessoas vivem, trabalham e se divertem. Como uma empresa global, em diferentes posições, você terá a oportunidade de vivenciar uma experiência internacional, trabalhando com colegas de diferentes países do mundo.

Total Rewards: Salário e beneficios competitivos Learn More: Trabalhar na UL é uma jornada emocionante que muda diariamente. Nós prosperamos nas reviravoltas e nos deleitamos nas curvas. job_title: Software Engineer - Site Reliability / Java Backend
description:
Your opportunity
At New Relic, we provide our customers with real-time insights, so they can innovate faster. Our software delivers insightful observability tools across different technologies and distributed systems, enabling software engineering teams to quickly identify, understand and tackle issues, analyze performance and get the most of their software and infrastructure.

We work with data at a scale found at few companies, using a diverse tech stack such as Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Kafka, Kubernetes, Docker, Ansible, Jenkins, and many public cloud web services. We are focused on driving the Cloud transformation!

As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will work with a group of hardworking, encouraging, and friendly people who hold a desire to deliver phenomenal service, implement highly reliable systems, automate regularly, and grow as engineers. If you get a kick out of delighting customers and helping other people, you’ll enjoy this job. If you have an eye for solving enlightened problems with easy to use tools, have crafted solutions/processes, and love a challenge, you’ll fit right in!

We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to create more perfect software. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. We value diversity and what's most important for us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.

What you'll do
Build our infrastructure with code and automation, and lead our transition towards the public cloud.
Keep our services reliable, available and fast. This involves working closely with our services and our infrastructure in the cloud.
Investigate and resolve critical performance, availability, and resiliency issues in a multi-region, multi-tenant distributed database
Investigate incidents, drive retrospectives, and find creative solutions in collaboration with the teams.
Behave as advocate and mentor for most suitable practices among engineers inside and outside the team.

This role requires
Experience in writing software in OOP (Java/GO/Python/Ruby) and you are not afraid of adapting, learning and working with different languages and frameworks.
Experience with large-scale, complex distributed systems.
Passionate about DevOps/SRE philosophies.

Bonus points if you have
API design and development exposure and solving problems in a scalable environment with Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery
Experience with Public Cloud Providers (AWS/Azure/Google)
Experience with containerized environments (Kubernetes/Docker)
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform/CloudFormation/Ansible)
Excellent communication capability both verbally and in writing with an eagerness for growth and collaboration

We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to help every engineer do their best work, every day, using data, not opinions, at every stage of the software lifecycle. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.

We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional and business success through a workforce model called Flex First. Flex First allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or hybrid.

Read more about Flex First.

New Relic currently has offices in Germany, Ireland, Spain, and the United Kingdom, and based on business needs may approve work in Belgium, France, Italy, The Netherlands, Switzerland, Sweden, UAE, and other locations throughout the region. Some of our opportunities are limited to specific hiring locations. Talk with your recruiter about your goals and how we can work with you in our Flex First approach!

Our hiring process

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.

New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here.

job_title: Customer Experience Specialist – European Languages (Budapest based – Remote work not available)
description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

Agoda’s Customer Support Team understands that travel can be an everchanging environment. That is why we provide in-person, real-time help around the clock and in 38 languages. No matter the issue, we present the best of Agoda’s values to each and every customer with multiple support channels and a strong desire to serve. Certainly doing more than answering phone calls or replying to emails, our specialists actively look for ways to improve our customer’s experience. We quickly adapt to challenges by collaborating with other teams and experimenting on everything we can. This has allowed us to develop new and effective products that produce meaningful results and continue to drive Agoda’s business performance. Our Customer Support Team serves a daily role in contributing to a core strength and service of Agoda with a clear vision and a focus on efficient and satisfying customer support.

In this Role, you’ll get to:

To deliver excellent customer service and manage the needs of our customers (guests and partners) through our communication channels (phone and email)
Understand and deliver business strategies and improve customer services through the execution of self-service
Accountable for meeting individual and team goals (KPIs)
Continuously identify work process improvements and communicate to Team Leaders and (or) Manager

What you’ll Need to Succeed:

Must have advanced command of spoken and written English & Italian OR German OR French (level C1 or higher according to The Common European Framework)
Immaculate telephone manners and communication skills
Excellent listening skills, critical-thinker with attention to detail
Minimum typing speed of 35 words per minute
Willing to work on rotating shifts, public holidays, and weekends
Ability to work in both a team environment and independently
Demonstrate high degree of integrity and confidentiality

It’s Great if you have:

At least 1 year of working experience in the related field would be desirable although fresh graduates are welcome to apply

#EC1 #budapest #Hungary #Italy #Latvia #Portugal #Lisbon #France #CUST #2 #Germany #Berlin #Dusseldorf #Izmir #Ankara #Malta #Madrid

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The challenge

Our Sales team thrives being on the front lines, generating leads and prospects, selling a suite of Digital Experience services, closing deals and making money! We are looking for an energetic individual with an entrepreneurial spirit and consistent record of success selling in the mar-tech solutions space to join this elite team. The ideal candidate has enterprise level software solutions sales experience and will be responsible for selling customer journey management (CJM) solutions to medium and large enterprises. The Account Executive leads sales through forecasting, account resource allocation, account strategy, and planning. The Account Executive also participates in finding leads, in the development of presentations and sales propositions, negotiates contract and pricing, and manages the full sales cycle via solution selling techniques. This is a perfect opportunity to make a jump to a rapidly growing tech company

What you’ll do

Develop and implement specific territory and account plans to build pipeline and deliver on revenue targets via new business acquisition
Build relationships with key customer stakeholders and generate brand awareness
Maintain up-to-date on vertical trends, competitive landscapes, product, and ecosystem developments
Deliver compelling and polished sales presentations and utilize effective sales techniques in order to influence target markets
Use data, site audits, case studies, and benchmark reports to nurture, advise, and support customers’ decision process
Source, develop, qualify, and close new and existing leads for Adobe’s Customer Journey Management (CJM) products within a defined territory
Negotiate business terms with line-of-business, senior management, C-level executives, and business owners
Develop relationships and work closely with key internal stakeholders across a matrixed organization (e.g. Solutions Consultants, Customer Success, Support, Partnerships, SIs, and Services) to identify, service, and meet customer needs
Maintain professional communication with management regarding pipeline, activities, customer needs, and other business opportunities
Travel as needed to close business
Providing accurate and timely sales forecasts is a must!
What you need to succeed

Success in selling solution-based SAAS offerings, with Tier 1 and Tier 2 companies.
Expertise around CJM market is a plus
Experience in hunting for new clients in a “greenfield” context
Understanding of industry dynamics, industry challenges, related cost drivers, and customer needs
Understanding of broad competitive solution footprints for the Digital Experience marketplace is preferred
Experience with corporate sales methodologies
Be able to work with prospects to understand their business requirements and Return on Investment models
Ability to rapidly assimilate and then clearly articulate value propositions
Ability to work cross functionally and collaboratively bringing in the right resources to bear at the right stage in the selling process
Be a proficient networker. Ability to develop and use relationships with senior industry leaders and key influencers.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to “win people over”.

Deine Aufgaben.

Insbesondere Benötigen Wir Deine Unterstützung Bei Folgenden Themen

Als DevOps Engineer (m/w/d) bist du Teil des zentralen Bereichs "Digital Transformation" der WBS Gruppe und maßgeblich daran beteiligt, Menschen vernetztes und ortsunabhängiges Lernen zu ermöglichen. Begeistere dich mit uns für unsere digitalen Bildungsangebote und lebe Digitalisierung mit Herz. Gemeinsam mit deinen Kolleginnen und Kollegen pflegst und optimierst du unsere bereits bestehenden Software-Lösungen oder bist an der Implementierung neuer Software beteiligt.
Du unterstützt unser DevOps-Team bei Konzeption, Einführung, Betrieb und Ausbau der Microsoft Azure-Plattform.
Du automatisierst unsere Deployment-Pipelines und sorgst somit für die effiziente Auslieferung unserer Services.
Du orchestrierst und automatisierst das Einrichten, Betreiben und Skalieren von Container-Anwendungen mittels geeigneter Tools.
Du überwachst die genutzten Ressourcen durch ein geeignetes Monitoring und supportest bei auftretenden Inzidenzen.
Du stehst anderen Kolleg:innen beratend zur Seite und bist Ansprechpartner:in bei Themen wie Planung, Rollout und Troubleshooting.
Deine Stärken.

Idealerweise Wünschen Wir Uns Noch Folgendes Von Dir

Du begegnest all deinen Mitmenschen auf Augenhöhe, denkst dich schnell in komplexe Sachverhalte ein, bist selbstorganisiert und scheust dich nicht Dinge anzupacken. Du möchtest mit deiner Arbeit einen echten Beitrag für unsere Gesellschaft leisten und hast Freude an der Arbeit mit moderner Technologie. Dann werde Teil der WBS Gruppe.
Ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich IT oder alternativ eine Ausbildung zum Fachinformatiker:in für Systemintegration oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Fundiertes KnowHow in den Bereichen Kubernetes und Microsoft Azure und Erfahrung im Betrieb von Hybridszenarien.
Kenntnisse im Bereich Active Directory, Containerisierung und Monitoring runden dein Profil ab.
Du hast eine Affinität dazu wiederkehrende Aufgaben zu automatisieren und lernst auch gerne neue Dinge kennen.
Du hast Freude am Umgang mit Kolleg:innen und gibst dein Wissen gern hands on weiter.
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.
Das wäre schön.

Job Description Summary
Au sein du segment Ultrasons General Imaging, vous aurez pour responsabilité de fournir l’expertise technique et clinique formelle pendant le processus commercial sur le secteur géographique Île-de-France avec des déplacements prévus en Normandie.

Job Description
Vos responsabilités :
Contribuer à la réussite commerciale grâce à une solide expertise clinique et technique.
Démontrer sa capacité d’analyse dans le cycle de vente pour étudier l’environnement du client et déterminer l’adéquation des solutions GE HealthCare (la démonstration complète des fonctionnalités du produit en regard des besoins clients).
Développer, coordonner et fournir les formations produites aux clients.
Travailler en tant que collaborateur d’une équipe technico-commerciale pour créer et faire des démonstrations de produits aux nouveaux prospects et aux clients existants.
Mettre en place les offres d’éducation clinique sur le secteur (offre digitale ou sur site)
Collecter, analyser et communiquer des informations sur la concurrence.
S’assurer de la satisfaction client lors des installations sur son secteur (formations, réglages, personnalisation, niveau de connaissance des technico-commerciaux ultrasons)
Être en support des congrès et manifestations régionales et nationales : workshop, démonstrations et présentations technico-commerciales.
Rédiger des comptes rendus post-formation sur le niveau de satisfaction et les besoins de la clientèle.

Votre profil :
BAC+5, de préférence Ingénieur Biomédical
Expérience commerciale et/ou applicative clinique
Solides connaissances cliniques et techniques, de préférence dans le domaine de l’échographie
Maitrise des outils informatiques (Pack Office)
Anglais courant
Permis B

Compétences souhaitées :
Gestion des priorités
Orientation client
Qualités relationnelles et aisance en communication éprouvées
Capacité d'influence
Mobilité : déplacements en France
Basé sur le secteur commercial attribué
Capacité de travail en équipe
Connaissance du secteur et des processus de vente, des sites clés
Excellentes capacités de présentation
Flexibilité et capacité d’adaptation aux environnements de travail en évolution.

Inclusion et diversité
GE HealthCare est un employeur offrant l'égalité des chances où l'inclusion compte. Les décisions relatives à l'emploi sont prises sans tenir compte de l’origine national ou ethnique, de la religion, du sexe, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'identité ou de l'expression de genre, de l'âge, du handicap, du statut d'ancien combattant protégé ou d'autres caractéristiques protégées par la loi.

Nos rémunérations totales sont conçues pour libérer votre ambition en vous donnant la motivation et la flexibilité dont vous avez besoin pour transformer vos idées en réalités qui changent le monde. Nos salaires et nos avantages sociaux correspondent à tout ce que vous attendez d’une organisation ayant une dimension internationale, avec des possibilités de développement de carrière, dans une culture qui favorise la collaboration et le soutien.

A propos de nous
GE HealthCare est l'un des leaders mondiaux dans le domaine des technologies médicales et des solutions numériques. Il permet aux cliniciens de prendre des décisions plus rapides et plus pertinentes à travers des équipements intelligents, des analyses de données, des applications et des services. Avec plus de 100 ans d'expérience dans le secteur de la santé et environ 47 000 employés dans le monde, la société est au centre d'un écosystème qui travaille pour une médecine de précision.

Présent en France depuis 1987 avec aujourd’hui 2 800 collaborateurs, c’est un acteur solidement ancré dans l’hexagone à travers son empreinte industrielle, son centre de R&D et de production à Buc dans les Yvelines et des partenariats de recherche avec des entreprises et des centres de recherche français.
www.gehealthcare.com

Additional Information
Relocation Assistance Provided: No

We are looking for adaptable agile software developers who think outside the box and are curious! You do not have to be an expert in front- and back-end development, but you are interested in learning. You are not limited to a particular programming language, but always look for what the customer needs!

Your job role with us:

You help design software products
You continuously learn new technologies, programming languages , and architectural concepts
You will learn and teach Clean Code and Clean Architecture principles
You establish pair programming, TDD, and automatic delivery pipelines
What we're looking for:

You are able to speak - Fluent English + B1 German
You have several years of experience in software development
You have in-depth knowledge of at least one front end and/or back end technology, such as Java Spring Boot, Java Micronaut, JAVA EE, Angular, React, Vue.js
You are enthusiastic about agile software development
You ideally have a strong full-stack mentality
You are shaped by empathy, objectivity, the ability to deal with conflict, initiative and the ability to network
How we benefit you:

Fully remote within Germany.
Our employees are the focus and receive an attractive salary
A high work/life balance with locally-centered projects or as a remote activity
Time to learn together and have fun 6 days a year, Christmas party, summer party...

Description

Rozwój kodu wspólnego serwisów i aplikacji, w tym: autoryzacja, logowanie, metryki, raportowanie błędów, middleware aplikacji

Dbanie o bezpieczeństwo systemów, skalowalność, wysoką dostępność
Zarządzanie i utrzymanie VM (Linux)

Linux (Bash)
Kubernetes
Docker
