YOUR FUTURE, ON DEMAND

The ideal blend of stability and flexibility. A genuinely human employer that cares for people and the planet. True autonomy to shape what comes next, for us and you. This is the perfect platform to take your career where you want.

Back in 2005, we pioneered Europe’s first TV streaming service. Today, we’re the world’s first certified climate neutral TV streaming provider. 3 million users across three countries. Over 230 colleagues of 47 nationalities. We’re the grown-up start-up, helping to shape a better future since day one. That hasn’t changed, even if the world has. We’re friendly, international, inclusive – and our people say we’re reliable and transparent, too. It’s why they trust us and believe in what we do.

THE ROLE

Zattoo is searching for a highly motivated Android Playback Engineer (f/m/x) with a proven track record in streaming expertise to join our world class team. Zattoo’s mobile apps for Android are installed on millions of devices. We were among the first to bring Live and Catch Up TV to these platforms. In addition to mobile, we put a strong focus on new Android based big screen platforms such as Android TV and Amazon Fire TV.

We’re looking for someone who wants to push the boundaries of what’s possible on these platforms. You will find Zattoo to be a comfortable place to work with pragmatic decision making, fast approval paths and willingness to take risks. Most importantly, you’ll be surrounded by colleagues who’ll share your commitment to developing and selling world class products. You will belong to the video team that owns the whole streaming chain ingest/encoding/packaging/delivery/playback. Together with frontend video engineers of other platforms you will analyse and improve video playback at Zattoo and push the experience of Zattoo’s service to the next level.

THE PRODUCT CREATION TEAM

At the heart of Zattoo’s organisation, there is a group of people who are extremely passionate about TV Products and Technology. This diverse group of engineers, product managers, designers, SRE, network, QA and support specialists cover a large area of expertise and are building our vision of the streaming age TV platform. We value high quality, user oriented and sustainable work and strive to be at the forefront of technology and collaboration.

We encourage everybody to express their ideas and give autonomy and focus to independent teams. Our dream is to let people watch their favourite TV content in the simplest and most comfortable way. We see our strength in disrupting traditional broadcasting technology while collaborating closely with the great companies that produce this content.

What You’ll Do

Analyse, configure and maintain ExoPlayer, show good understanding of its internal logic
Adopt your knowledge of Android Media Stack for future proof development
Use debugging tools for investigation and research
Write clean and testable code
Collaborate with Video Backend Engineers and other Frontend Video Engineers
Become a valued member of Zattoo’s Engineering team and improve our core quality of experience

What You’ll Bring

4+ years of experience in Android streaming application development (video-on-demand and/or linear video playback)
High proficiency with Kotlin and Java
Knowledge of Android Media Stack, including internal logic and debugging tools
Experience with multithreaded programming and real time considerations
Bonus: Experience with video streaming technologies (DASH, HLS) and codecs (H.264, H.265)
Bonus: Experience with tracking playback events, errors, behaviour, user experience and A/B testing

WHY JOIN US?

At Zattoo, you’re always on firm ground with real freedom to explore. You’ll have the support and opportunity you need to go far, while you’re helping us create a sustainable and entertainment-filled future for all.

What We Offer You

Reward: strong market competitive salary
Recharge: 30 days vacation plus public holidays
Regulate: trust based flexible working hours and the option for remote working 8 weeks per year

Plus:

We’re sharing: Free access to the best streaming experience on the market
We're developing: your own development budget, German classes and Zattoo all-company hack days
We’re inclusive: ‘Zattooies’ are a fun, engaged, and diverse team made up of 44 nationalities
We’re healthy: yoga classes, health checks, team sports, organic fruit, vegan options and more!
We’re responsible: we are carbon neutral, an active employee Green team, discounted BVG tickets and free bike rentals
We’re sociable: a calendar of events with fireside chats, lunches, in-house bar, BBQ’s, monthly socials, summer party and an annual off-site event

Zattoo enables our users to view indiscriminately and we reflect that in our team too. Regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law we encourage everyone to apply and will give everyone equal consideration. We are an equal opportunities employer, join us and help build a diverse team dedicated to the future of TV.

You can learn more about us at: https://zattoo.com

Job Description & Summary
A career in Information Technology, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to support our core business functions by deploying applications that enable our people to work more efficiently and deliver the highest levels of service to our clients. Our Information Technology Generalist - Practice Support team focuses on managing the design and implementation of technology infrastructure within PwC, developing and enhancing internal applications, and providing technology tools that help create a competitive advantage for PwC to drive strategic business growth.


ServiceNow Platform Administrator

(System Support Area)
Location: Warszawa/Kraków/remote

PwC is driving major change across technology including the building of a centralized model to deliver and manage technology services across the entire network of member firms.
ServiceNow is the enterprise platform that enables Service Management at PwC. Using this platform, our team helps Internal Firm Services transform how they deliver and manage services to the business, and how the business manages services to our clients.
If you are seeking an exciting career with the scope to grow your ServiceNow skills through major change on a global scale, then PwC Technology will empower you to do so.

The role

Provide day-to-day end-user second level support for ServiceNow Platform modules and functionalities (including but not limited to: ITSM, ITBM, ITOM, Discovery, Agent Workspace, Virtual Agent, Discovery, Integrations):

Analyze and resolve incidents
Identify problems and log known errors
Manage service requests
Participate in change management process for changes
Troubleshoot issue and determine root-cause of problems users are facing
Resolve functional and technical problems, escalate and track problems appropriately
Manage system configuration
Monitor system scheduled tasks and take actions in case of errors identified
Provide documentation on how to use global system
Conduct testing for subsequent developments of the application
Perform special assignments as requested


Candidate profile

At least Bachelor, or Engineering degree in Technology or a related field.
2+ years of ITSM tool support would be expected
Experience in configuring and supporting the ServiceNow platform, or any other ITSM application suite
Experience working in a support analyst/specialist role for global clients
Service orientation with a focus on quality and customer satisfaction
Strong interpersonal and collaboration capabilities
Very good verbal and written communication skills
Understanding of ITSM best practice (ITIL)
Availability for shift work (start between 10 a.m. and 2 p.m.)
Fluent English is essential for this job
Previous experience in application testing will be considered as an asset


We offer

Career development and professional growth in a global team setting
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies and cloud-based platforms
Ability to pursue further professional development - access to the multiple trainings provided by PwC
Participation in multi-territory activities within the cross platform support area
Competitive salary and benefits package, including private healthcare, life and disability insurance, attractive voucher program
Inspiring and friendly work environment
Career development plan tailored to your preferences and ambitions
Flexible working arrangements based on the Polish Labor Law regulations including hybrid or remote model of work

With any queries please contact pl_ITrecruitment@pwc.com with job title in the subject.

Administratorem danych osobowych przetwarzanych w ramach procesu rekrutacji jest PwC Advisory spółka z ograniczoną odpowiedzialnością sp.k., lub inna spółka z sieci PwC, do której kierowana jest aplikacja - lista spółek: https://www.pwc.pl/pl/o-nas/lista-spolek-pwc.html z siedzibą w Warszawie (00-633) przy ul. Polnej 11 (dalej jako: PwC lub administrator). Administrator będzie przetwarzał dane osobowe w celu przeprowadzenia rekrutacji na oferowane stanowisko. Po wyrażeniu odrębnej zgody, dane osobowe będą przetwarzane również w celu udziału w przyszłych rekrutacjach prowadzonych przez PwC oraz wysyłania powiadomień o ofertach pracy w PwC i o wydarzeniach związanych z pracą, które organizowane są przez PwC lub z udziałem PwC (np. targi pracy). Pełną informację o przetwarzaniu danych osobowych można znaleźć w Polityce Prywatności.

job_title: Middle DevOps Engineer for Tooling Squad
Audio Software Engineer-Media Composer Audio Team
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Audio Software Engineer - Media Composer Audio Team

Avid is looking for a talented software engineer to join the Media Composer Audio Toolset Team. The candidate will have an opportunity to contribute to Media Composer, Avid's flagship professional video editor. Avid's products are used in the most recognizable films and TV shows streamed and broadcast around the world. The Audio Toolset Team supports the design and delivery of all of the audio editing image and signal processing and graphics features for many editing workflows.

Responsibilities And Duties

Design and implement high-quality software in C++
Implement and debug audio related solutions for Media Composer
Implement real-time algorithms using advanced multi-threaded concepts
Program on both Windows and macOS operating systems
Design and implement automation to accompany all features
Translate requests from a scrum Product Owner into working, maintainable production code
Monitor user forums and beta feedback for a user-centric approach to software engineering
Participate in daily stand-up scrum meetings to share progress and obstacles

Required Qualifications:

BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering or Math
Strong knowledge of Object-Oriented design and development in C++
Performance optimization experience, including multithreading programming
Audio, video, image or signal processing experience
Background in sound technology or music production highly desired
Passion for audio products
Understanding of professional audio standards highly desired
Ability to work with large and complex applications involving the writing of significant new code and refactoring legacy code
Experience programming on either Windows or macOS
Desire to work in a multi-site distributed team using Agile/Scrum
Creative and innovative mindset
Fluent in English
Strong communication and collaboration skills

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

job_title: Outbound Retail Agent - Fluent English Speakers - Temporary
description:
What will you be doing?

Providing an outstanding customer experience through every customer interaction
Handling telephone outbound calls to independent retailers and ensuring that all customer & client needs are met in a timely and professional manner
Accurate data capturing into the CRM system
Embracing our company values and acting as a brand ambassador


Requirements

What are we looking for?

A fluent level of English with exceptional grammar and spelling skills (knowledge of other languages is a plus)
A genuine passion for delivering outstanding customer service
Previous experience in a customer-facing role or a call centre environment would be a plus
Flexibility, adaptability, and ability to multi-task
Confidence and an enthusiastic telephone manner
Comfortable making outbound calls
Strong administrative skills with a keen eye for detail
A professional outlook and proactive approach to problem-solving
Strong team spirit and a "can do" attitude


Benefits

What do we offer?

Full-time contract (39 hours/week) - 1 month temporary contract
Schedule: Monday to Friday 10:00h - 19:00h (one short day per week)
Salary: 21,000€ gross per year
Completion of contract bonus: 250€
Holidays: 24/year
Work-from-home option
Interview conducted via video call using Microsoft Team
Start Date: March, 2023

Who we are

At CPM, we create and deliver insight into sales, marketing, and customer experience strategies, wherever and whenever our clients, customers, and shoppers can be influenced.

Today, CPM leads a diverse and inclusive working environment employing over 3000 people, delivering high-end customer experience solutions across 71 markets in over 26 different languages

We're People People

We understand what makes people tick. We also know that expertly trained and happy at work talented people do brilliant work for our clients daily.




CPM International does not discriminate based on race, creed, colour, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression, age, height, weight, physical or mental ability, veteran status, military obligations, or marital status


Desired Skills and Experience
Customer Service
Customer Success
Customer Support
Customer experience
English
Retail

Who We Are

In our Embedded Technologies department, we are focusing on client projects in the Automotive sector. The top-class services we provide consist mostly of software development and testing solutions for products such as Instrument Clusters and Head-up Displays, Control Units, Active and Passive Safety Systems (with a particular focus on Advanced Radar Systems) or even Low Level Drivers.

We are a friendly and distinguished community where colleagues are empowered to act, can choose their future development path and are great team players that truly care about the work they do in the industry.

What You'll Be Doing

Configuration and integration of embedded C software, working with AUTOSAR architecture standard
AUTOSAR Classic BSW development
OEM specific AUTOSAR BSW integration
AUTOSAR Classic project/product development according whole software development process
Analyze and review customer and AUTOSAR specifications
Perform module and integration tests for the implemented software on target
Ensure quality processes requested by automotive standards and coding rules (SW Documentation, SW Review, MISRA Checks, etc.)
Analyze and solve various software issues (bug fixes, debugging)
Participate in project planning and estimation process

What You'll Bring Along

University degree in electrical engineering, computer science or a comparable field of study
Strong knowledge and experience with embedded C
Min 2-3 years of experience in an Embedded SW development position, preferably using AUTOSAR architecture, in Automotive domain
Microcontrollers know-how is required
Autonomous and self-reliant way of working
Communicative and a strong team player
Interest in new technologies
Able to work independently in a structured and process oriented way (Experience with Agile or/and V-Model, ASPICE)
Software: tools (SVN, Jira, Jenkins, Crucible, Trace32, make, compilers), processes (V-Model, ASPICE, Agile), standards (AUTOSAR, MISRA etc.), AUTOSAR tools
Is considered a plus if you have: experience with EB Tresos tool, experiences in requirements management and Python knowledge, but also experience in software design and software test

Document

What’s In It For You

✔ New beginnings can be a challenge. We promise a smooth integration and a supportive mentor

✔ Pick your working style: choose from Remote, Hybrid or Office work opportunities

✔ Early bird or night owl? Our projects have different working hours to suit your needs

✔ Nobody is born an expert. Sharpen your tech skills with our sponsored certifications, trainings and top e-learning platforms

✔ We want you to stay healthy! Enjoy our Private Health Insurance ⁠– it’s custom-made for you

✔ A clear mind is a healthy mind. Attend individual coaching sessions or go one step further by joining our accredited Coaching School

✔ Make the most of our epic parties or themed events – they’re lovingly designed for our people and their families

Marcel Jansen

Are you looking for a hybrid or remote work opportunity? Are you interested in a workplace that allows for flexibility in your day? Are you ready for a workplace that provides benefits that suit your needs?

As a Senior Software Engineer , your primary mission will be to design, write, test, deploy, and support new and existing Relativity software products, in a brand new, startup-style Relativity office in Krakow, Poland.  We’re looking for someone who has an interest in developing next-generation technologies and passion for getting things done. Is experienced and leverages that to solve complex problems. Enjoys working with smart people and having fun building something great. The perfect team member is also versatile, displays leadership qualities and is enthusiastic about tackling new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward. Enjoys taking responsibility in a self-managing team and understands and supports principles of Agile, like iterative approach, ability to cope with the constant change, feedback culture where everything is assessed quickly and changed to fit.   If you have the desire to be continually challenged and work where boredom is an anomaly, then join our Krakow team and be part of a successful Agile-oriented company, experiencing rapid growth in the eDiscovery field, that is currently building its new R&D office in Poland!

The Enrichment Team

Relativity’s “Enrichment” product is the fastest way to feed terabytes of complex and abstract data into the Relativity’s Review platform. As part of the Enrichment team, you will work on modernizing the Enrichment user experience, deal with the unique challenge of processing a diverse set of documents, a tremendous amount of data and do complicated data extraction at blazing speeds. If an opportunity to deal with big-data, solve complex scalability challenges, and learn a distinct set of technologies on a secure SaaS platform excites you, then this is the right team for you.

Your Role in Action

Contributing to a Scrum team that solves complex challenges and builds working software.
Producing high quality code in an effective manner.
Being a dependable and highly skilled team member that is a role model for others and a source of knowledge and inspirations for them.
Troubleshooting issues by fixing defects and responding to client specific problems.
Working on a scalable and dynamic web system which supports integration with multiple search engines, clustering technologies and client component interaction through web services.
Building highly distributable eDiscovery system composed of multiple database, processing, and web servers, that have potential to be used in other industries that require heavy processing on big, unstructured document sets.

Senior Software Engineer performs the following functions, in addition to others, in the administration of their position:

Next-gen operations at scale, with pure Python infra-as-code, from bare metal to containers and applications. Our goal is to perfect enterprise infrastructure devops.

We run hundreds of private cloud, Kubernetes, and application clusters for customers across physical and public cloud estate, and we are raising the bar on what's possible with automation by embracing a universal operator pattern and model-driven operations.

To succeed in this role you need to believe in automation as a pure software engineering problem, not a hack-it-till-it-works-for-me problem. You need to be interested in the scientific approach to operations at scale, driven by metrics and code, and you need to be able to learn the entire stack, from bare metal networking and kernel up to serverless and open source applications.

Cloud Operations Engineer

Our cloud operations engineers bring Python software-engineering skills and rigour to the operations domain. We practice devsecops from bare metal to application. We architect and run OpenStack, Kubernetes and software defined storage, and we enable devsecops for applications running on that infrastructure too.

To become a member of this team, you need to be a software engineer fluent in Python, you need a genuine interest in the full open source infrastructure stack from metal to containers, and you need the ability to work in a high pressure operations environment with mission-critical services for global brand name customers.

As a member of the team you will gain experience in a broad range of cloud technologies. We evolve our offerings as the state of the art improves, so you get to stay current with the latest capabilities in open source infrastructure. We drive upgrades to keep our customers on the latest, best solutions.

What Canonical Offers
Technical management team that understands the details of what we are developing
A culture of openness and inclusiveness
Helpful and talented engineers who are world-class experts in many fields
Teams focused on good work life balance with long average retention rates
A wide range of engineering disciplines and career paths that can move between divisions
Fully remote company for career growth without relocation requirements

Requirements
Software Engineering or Computer Science degree
Linux experience and familiarity with Linux networking and storage
Python software development experience
Demonstrated drive for continual learning
Devops experience

Nice to haves
Experience with OpenStack or Kubernetes deployment or operations
We hope that you'll join us in helping to shape and build the future of free software together

Of course we also offer...
Learning and Development
Annual Compensation Review
Recognition Rewards
Annual Leave
Priority Pass for travel
Flexible working option

Accountmanager België bij Allshoes
Wil jij aan de slag bij een Great Place To Work? Allshoes zoekt versterking voor het team in België! Je zal klanten adviseren en ondersteunen in het gehele proces naar het beste assortiment safety sneakers. Uiteraard voor zowel de korte- als langetermijnstrategie. Kan jij van deze rol een succes maken? Lees dan vooral verder.

Where Protection meets Style. Dit is Allshoes!
Allshoes Benelux is de specialist in safety footwear. Wij zijn succesvol doordat we als eerste in een traditionele markt coole safety sneakers met een sportieve en modieuze uitstraling geïntroduceerd hebben. Allshoes verkoopt alleen A merken zoals Redbrick, Grisport, Reebok en Mr. Miles. Wij willen wij o.a. ons merk Redbrick niet alleen groot maken in de Benelux maar ook uitrollen in heel Europa.
Allshoes is uitgeroepen tot een Great Place To Work en dat zie je terug in onze kernwaarden maar ook in ons dagelijkse werk. Wij staan voor ondernemerschap, teamgeest en durf en hebben een enorme groeiambitie. Wij spelen in op de markt om te winnen. We kiezen ons eigen pad als organisatie! We werken elke dag met een team van gedreven mensen waar ieder zijn eigen expertise en enthousiasme heeft om elkaar verder te helpen. We motiveren en inspireren elkaar en vinden het belangrijk dat iedereen met veel plezier bij ons werkt.

Visie vertalen naar concrete acties
Allshoes is flink aan het groeien en daarom zijn we per direct op zoek naar versterking voor het team in België. Onder leiding van Toon (Business Developmentmanager) zal jij verantwoordelijk zijn voor het opbouwen en uitbreiden van klantenportefeuille in Vlaanderen en Wallonië. Na een duidelijk en leerrijk onboardingstraject zorgen wij dat je onze klanten leert kennen en alle vaardigheden in huis hebt om onze klanten het beste te adviseren. Jij biedt ondersteuning aan potentiële klanten in het gehele aankoopproces in haar zoektocht naar de beste safety sneaker. Op basis van (onuitgesproken) behoeftes van je klant, kan jij het beste advies formuleren die zowel voor de korte- als langere termijn voordelig uitpakt voor beide partijen. Het ten uitvoer brengen van deze afspraken overleg je op voorhand met Toon en de gemaakte afspraken communiceer je naar het team van Customer Service voor een correcte eindafhandeling. Daarnaast zal je proactief met Toon samenwerken in het verbeteren van onze positie in België.

Wij verwachten van jou:
Minimale beschikbaarheid van 32 uur per week, meer mag uiteraard ook;
Dat jij onze kernwaarden volharding, durf en team bij jezelf terug ziet;
Je hebt ervaring in Sales en bent als Accountmanager eerder werkzaam geweest;
Grenzeloze leergierigheid, focus op innovatie en oplossingsgerichtheid;
Dat jij graag werkt in een functie met veel zeggenschap en vrijheid;
Dat jij jezelf blijft ontwikkelen en ontplooien.
Succesvol zijn is voor ons een drijfveer, waarbij er ook genoeg tijd is voor ontspanning want we houden ervan onze successen te vieren! Naast leuke vrijdagmiddagborrels, doen we bijvoorbeeld mee aan events zoals de Dam tot Dam Loop en organiseren we met regelmaat (sportieve) bedrijfsuitjes. Benieuwd naar de sfeer bij Allshoes? Bekijk onze bedrijfsvideo op Youtube.

Wat kan je verder verwachten?
Allshoes biedt je een leuke werkomgeving in een klein (37 collega’s), ambitieus team en een goed salaris. Daarnaast ontvang je 26 vakantiedagen per jaar en daarboven op ontvang je drie betaalde vrijwilligersdagen om vrij te besteden ten behoeve van een maatschappelijk doel. Ben je ambitieus? Daar houden we van! Naast een ontwikkelingsbudget, komt er geregeld een persoonlijke jobcoach zodat je het beste in jezelf naar boven kunt halen. Daarnaast zorgen we voor een goede werkplek met moderne voorzieningen en staat er elke dag vers fruit voor je klaar.

Wil jij ons team komen versterken, dan gaan wij graag een gesprek met je aan. Wij zien je motivatie en CV graag tegemoet via de “solliciteren” knop t.a.v. Eefje Hutjes (HR). Alleen reacties die via deze weg binnen komen worden in behandeling genomen. Voor inhoudelijke vragen kun je contact opnemen met Eefje via 06 - 303 53 950.

As a global B2B FinTech software company, Serrala helps organizations automate their complex finance processes to stay ahead of the curve. With locations in Europe, North America and Asia, our 700+ employees are dedicated to servicing our customers in all industry sectors, from medium-sized companies to global players. Our customers represent 20% of Fortune 500 and 50% of DAX 30 enterprises.

Your tasks:
• On the agenda: with your consulting skills, your knowledge of procure-to-pay processes and your SAP expertise, you will support us in integrating our SAP software solutions into the customer's business environment.
• From A to Z: You are responsible for the preparation and implementation of our software projects from conception to implementation and go-live.
• Communication professional: You are responsible for the majority of communication with our national and international customers. You are the contact person for topics such as the connection of external data suppliers, certificates, encryption and data exchange.
• Lots of development potential: in addition to analyzing relevant business processes, recording customer requirements and creating technical concepts, your tasks also include conducting and documenting system tests.

Your profile:
• A basis that convinces: You have a degree in a technical / business discipline or a comparable education with professional experience.
• Technical know-how: Ideally, you have initial practical experience as an SAP FI / CO / MM consultant or as an FI / CO / MM key user in the specialist area. Alternatively, you have industry experience in the area of accounts payable, purchasing, software or finance.
• Nice to have: Initial knowledge of SAP customizing is an advantage.
• The tone makes the music: You bring very good communication and presentation skills in both German and English.
• Travel: If you want to work in more complex operational areas, you will have to travel about 10-20% of your working time. But it is not a must The remuneration will be adjusted accordingly. Please indicate your willingness to travel in your application.

Als weltweit tätige Digitalagentur verknüpft Valtech langjährige Technologiekompetenz mit umfassendem Marketing-Know-how und unterstützt Unternehmen bei ihrer digitalen Transformation. Unsere Leistungen reichen von IT-Consulting und Beratung in agiler Methodik über digitale Anwendungen, Online-Kampagnen, E-Commerce- und Customer-Engagement-Lösungen bis hin zu maßgeschneiderter Software und Digital-Experience-Plattformen.

Die Valtech Group hat rund 5.500 Mitarbeiter:innen an 50 Standorten in 22 Ländern. In Deutschland arbeiten rund 250 Digitalexpert:innen in Düsseldorf, Hamburg, Köln und München sowie remote. Wir denken anders. Und wir arbeiten anders. Nicht, weil wir das schick finden, sondern weil wir anders sind – dank eines bunten Teams aus kreativen Entwickler:innen, Tüftler:innen, Agilist:innen und Visionär:innen mit unterschiedlichsten Erfahrungen, Ideen und Horizonten.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir flexibel an einem unserer Standorte zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine:n

Projektmanager:in eCommerce (m/w/d)

Als Projekt Manager:in übernimmst du die Leitung eines eCommerce-Projekts für einen großen Kunden im Bereich Luxury Beauty. Der Fokus dieses Projekts liegt auf der Pflege und Optimierung verschiedener eShops, weiterer Online-Kanäle sowie der Aktualisierung von Produkten und Content.

Dein Job:

Du kümmerst dich eigenständig um das gesamte Projektmanagement (Ziel, Zeit, Budget, Priorisierung, Kontrolle).
Du erarbeitest zusammen mit den Kund:innen die Projektanforderungen und steuerst die erfolgreiche Umsetzung der Vorgaben und Wünsche unter Berücksichtigung interner Möglichkeiten und Ressourcen.
Du förderst die Erreichung der Projektziele durch deine gewinnende Persönlichkeit.
Du steuerst über mehrere Standorte verteilte Teams souverän und stellst eine klare Kommunikation in Richtung unserer Kund:innen und Teams sicher.
Du nimmst den Kund:innen gegenüber eine beratende Funktion ein und stellst dabei die Account-Entwicklung sicher.

Dein Profil:

Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich E-Commerce, BWL, Marketing oder eine ähnliche Qualifikation.
Du hast bereits mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Projektmanagement in einer vergleichbaren Position und Branche.
Du kennst verschiedene Shopsysteme und kennst dich idealerweise mit Salesforce Commerce Cloud aus.
Dich zeichnet eine hohe Serviceorientierung aus.
Du lebst Teamgeist, indem du Kund:innen und Kolleg:innen als engagierte:r und zuverlässige:r Partner:in zur Seite stehst.
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch und Englisch, denn in diesen Sprachen kommunizierst du täglich mit internationalen Kolleg:innen und Kund:innen.
Nicht alle der bislang genannten Punkte treffen auf dich zu? Macht nichts! Bewirb dich trotzdem, wenn du große Lust darauf hast, mit Kund:innen und Kolleg:innen an der „Digitalen Transformation“ zu arbeiten. Was du noch nicht kannst, lernst du in unseren internen Weiterbildungen.

Unser Angebot – Das bieten wir Dir:

Eine unbefristete Festanstellung in einer weltweit tätigen Digitalagentur, die in Deutschland in den Top 10 gelistet ist.
Wir legen großen Wert auf Diversität und Inklusion und möchten eine faire und lebenswerte Arbeitswelt schaffen. Dafür unterstützen wir alle Menschen ungeachtet ihrer Herkunft und ihres Hintergrunds. Alle sollen sich so wohlfühlen, dass sie sich entwickeln, wachsen und ihre Ziele erreichen können – welche auch immer das sein mögen.
Dich erwartet ein hoch professionelles Arbeitsumfeld, bei dem Teamgeist und Wissenstransfer keine Floskeln sind und wo sich flache Hierarchien wirklich auszahlen.
Unsere zentral gelegenen Büros sind an unsere hybride Arbeitsweise angepasst und bieten dir den perfekten Ausgleich zum Homeoffice.
Unsere Arbeitszeit- und Homeoffice-Regelungen sind flexibel und basieren auf einer 40-Stunden-Woche und 30 Tagen Jahresurlaub.
Du erhältst neben einem fixen Gehalt auch einen variablen Gehaltsanteil, der auf Basis von Unternehmenszielen monatlich ausbezahlt wird.
Wir zahlen dir außerdem einen betrieblichen Zuschuss zur Altersvorsorge.
Wir halten dich fit: Egal ob durch Snacks, die Möglichkeit des JobRads oder das Angebot des Urban Sports Club.
Wir fördern, dass du dich weiterbildest – über die Valtech Academy, bei externen Trainings oder auf Konferenzen.
Ein Highlight für alle Valtechies sind die gemeinsamen Feiern im Jahresverlauf, die du dir auf keinen Fall entgehen lassen solltest.
Come as you are: Bei uns gibt es keinen Dresscode. Du kommst so zur Arbeit, wie du dich am wohlsten fühlst.

Acerca de Almato

Almato es una filial al 100 de DATAGROUP SE que cotiza en bolsa. La empresa es uno de los principales proveedores de software y servicios para la digitalización inteligente de las empresas. Con el software de Almato las empresas automatizan y movilizan sus procesos de negocio. Las aplicaciones incluyen la automatización de procesos robóticos (RPA) asistentes digitales aplicaciones inteligentes robots de software ya preparados servicios de aprendizaje automático así como soluciones completas para tareas individuales como la gestión de la mano de obra. Almato emplea a más de 120 personas en sus sedes de Bonn Duisburgo Hamburgo Reutlingen Stuttgart y Barcelona.

Empresas de todos los sectores utilizan el software de Almato para reducir sus costes y mejorar su servicio. Entre los clientes de Almato se encuentran Aida Deichmann Deutsche Telekom H M Innogy Lands End Lidl Sparda Santander y Tchibo.

Almato mantiene asociaciones como revendedor de valor añadido con proveedores de tecnología de importancia mundial como Abbyy Automation Anywhere Nuance SAP y UiPath y emplea a más de 120 personas en sus sedes de Bonn Duisburgo Hamburgo Reutlingen Stuttgart y Barcelona.

Project Description:

Hirschmann Automation and Control is the Technology and Market Leader in Industrial Networking. Part of the Belden Inc Group from 2007, Hirschmann develops innovative solutions, which are geared towards its customers' requirements in terms of performance, efficiency and investment reliability. Covering markets like Transportation, Energy, Oil&Gas, Manufacturing, Automotive Hirschmann has become the leader in data communication and automation systems offering high quality, high availability line of industrial networking devices and systems. Our projects are including the full cycle of software development, for the entire line of products: starting with BSP and driver development for new HW components, OS integration (both Linux and VxWorks), feature development and integration (L2-L3 Ethernet-based communication protocols or Industrial Protocols), bug fixing and support ending with manual or automated testing using an internal in-house developed framework. Runs on cutting-edge HW platforms designed in-house using the newest technologies from Broadcom, all the software is developed under Agile methodology using a modern continuous integration approach. The local team consists of 65 members organized in 7 Scrum teams. Each team can either take the responsibility of an entire release, including management or work with several teams to the same product line or software release.

Responsibilities:

Feature developing and bug fixing for Client's Industrial Switches Platform family

Mandatory Skills Description:


- Experience in embedded software development, preferably for network equipment
- Experience with C programming on VxWorks/Linux/Unix environments
- Experience with cross compilers, debuggers, etc.
- Good understanding of Ethernet and IP networking
- Familiarity with git
- Knowledge of RTOS application development (VxWorks / NetBSD / Linux)
- Understanding multi-process system software architectures
- Experience with one or more of the following: POSIX threads, SNMP, XML
- Shell Scripting

Nice-to-Have Skills:

-Agile/Scrum experience

Languages:

English: B1 Intermediate

job_title: Software Engineer - Site Reliability / Java Backend
description:
Your opportunity
At New Relic, we provide our customers with real-time insights, so they can innovate faster. Our software delivers insightful observability tools across different technologies and distributed systems, enabling software engineering teams to quickly identify, understand and tackle issues, analyze performance and get the most of their software and infrastructure.

We work with data at a scale found at few companies, using a diverse tech stack such as Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Kafka, Kubernetes, Docker, Ansible, Jenkins, and many public cloud web services. We are focused on driving the Cloud transformation!

As a Site Reliability Engineer, you will work with a group of hardworking, encouraging, and friendly people who hold a desire to deliver phenomenal service, implement highly reliable systems, automate regularly, and grow as engineers. If you get a kick out of delighting customers and helping other people, you’ll enjoy this job. If you have an eye for solving enlightened problems with easy to use tools, have crafted solutions/processes, and love a challenge, you’ll fit right in!

We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to create more perfect software. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. We value diversity and what's most important for us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.

What you'll do
Build our infrastructure with code and automation, and lead our transition towards the public cloud.
Keep our services reliable, available and fast. This involves working closely with our services and our infrastructure in the cloud.
Investigate and resolve critical performance, availability, and resiliency issues in a multi-region, multi-tenant distributed database
Investigate incidents, drive retrospectives, and find creative solutions in collaboration with the teams.
Behave as advocate and mentor for most suitable practices among engineers inside and outside the team.

This role requires
Experience in writing software in OOP (Java/GO/Python/Ruby) and you are not afraid of adapting, learning and working with different languages and frameworks.
Experience with large-scale, complex distributed systems.
Passionate about DevOps/SRE philosophies.

Bonus points if you have
API design and development exposure and solving problems in a scalable environment with Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery
Experience with Public Cloud Providers (AWS/Azure/Google)
Experience with containerized environments (Kubernetes/Docker)
Experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform/CloudFormation/Ansible)
Excellent communication capability both verbally and in writing with an eagerness for growth and collaboration

We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to help every engineer do their best work, every day, using data, not opinions, at every stage of the software lifecycle. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.

We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional and business success through a workforce model called Flex First. Flex First allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or hybrid.

Read more about Flex First.

New Relic currently has offices in Germany, Ireland, Spain, and the United Kingdom, and based on business needs may approve work in Belgium, France, Italy, The Netherlands, Switzerland, Sweden, UAE, and other locations throughout the region. Some of our opportunities are limited to specific hiring locations. Talk with your recruiter about your goals and how we can work with you in our Flex First approach!

Our hiring process

Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.

New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here.

As a future member of the team you will have the opportunity to:
• Use and improve your language skills
• Communicate with an international customer via telephone
• Have daily chats in Russian, English and Polish
• Learn a lot and develop your professional profile
• Gain some IT knowledge
• Participate in trainings and talent programs
• Have a stable workplace with flexible scheduling
• Work in safe and friendly atmosphere, where people matter

We offer various benefits such as:
• Private medical healthcare and cafeteria
• Competitive salary and annual bonus
• Extensive 1-month induction training fully paid
• Opportunity for development to technical or managerial careers
• Brand new and modern office within easy distance
• Home office opportunity and remote recruitment process
• Additional day off for birthday

You are the ideal candidate if…
• You speak Russian, English and Polish (min. B2 level)
• You know how to ask the right questions to reach the core
• You have outstanding communication skills and costumer focused mind-set
• You have the ability to do multitasking in a fast-paced environment
• You enjoy teamwork

job_title: Programador Fullstack Ruby on Rails + React
description:
Descripción de la empresa

Devoteam es una consultora europea líder enfocada en estrategia digital, plataformas tecnológicas, ciberseguridad y transformación empresarial a través de la tecnología. Centrada en 6 áreas de especialización, abordamos los desafíos estratégicos de nuestros clientes: Digital Business & Products, Data-driven Intelligence, Distributed Cloud, Business Automation, Ciberseguridad y la Sostenibilidad conseguida por la Digitalización.

La Tecnología está en nuestro ADN y creemos en ella como una palanca capaz de impulsar el cambio para mejorar, manteniendo un equilibrio que nos permite ofrecer a nuestros clientes herramientas tecnológicas de primer nivel pero siempre con la cercanía y profesionalidad de un equipo que actúa como guía durante el camino.

Nuestros 25 años de experiencia nos convierten en una consultora innovadora, consolidada y madura que permite el desarrollo de nuestras 8.000 personas, certificando continuamente a nuestros consultores en las últimas tecnologías y contando con expertos en: Cloud, BI, Data Analytics, Excelencia en Procesos de Negocio, Gestión de la Relación con clientes, Ciberseguridad, Marketing Digital, Machine Learning, Ingeniería y desarrollo del Software.

Devoteam ha sido premiado como Partner del año 2021 de los 5 líderes de la nube: AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, Salesforce y ServiceNow.

#CreativeTechForBetterChange


Descripción del empleo

Buscamos incorporar un Programador Fullstack para una contratación indefinida con los siguientes requisitos:

- Experiencia en Ruby on Rails y React

- Experiencia con Python

- Buen nivel de inglés.

Si cumples el perfil y quieres saber más ¡No dudes en inscribirte para valorar tu candidatura!

job_title: Linux System Engineer - QA, Tooling, Automation
description:
We are seeking a software engineer passionate about software quality, Ubuntu, and the open source community, to join the Ubuntu Quality Engineering team as we expand the set of open source packages we fully support and secure.

We see quality engineering as a first class engineering practice and are looking for people who can bring deep engineering insights to automation, testing capabilities, reporting and data analytics, as well as run processes in partnership with Canonical and community teams.

Ubuntu strives to deliver the latest-best free software components, in an easy to use and highly reliable form. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer the industry.

As an Ubuntu Quality Engineer, you must be passionate about the future of Ubuntu, about quality and continuous integration and testing. You will work closely with multiple teams at the heart of Ubuntu and drive quality excellence. You will work closely with the Ubuntu Desktop, Server and Foundations team and put in place metrics for quality. You will research existing issues, troubleshoot and resolve problems, and identify opportunities for improvement and communicate them to the rest of the organization to drive the overall quality of Ubuntu.

What you'll do
Monitor indicators of quality across the Ubuntu ecosystem and products
Troubleshoot and resolve issues in Ubuntu Desktop, Ubuntu Server and Ubuntu Core
Enhance our continuous integration to guard Ubuntu image, release and package quality
Report on KPIs and analytical insights
Empower other teams for better planning and constant quality improvements
Develop, enhance and automate test cases, from unit tests to end-to-end multi machine workloads
Work from home with international travel twice a year, for events up to two weeks long

Valued Skills And Experience
A strong software engineering, Linux, and open source background
In-depth knowledge of Python and Shell scripting
Experience with C/C++
Excellent troubleshooting skills and experience working with others to identify, isolate and resolve issues
Experience with quality processes and continuous integration tools
Experience working in an agile development environment

Experience with Debian/Ubuntu based operating system and good understanding of Debian packaging and snaps would also be a considerable advantage.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

#stack

Job Description

Join our team to create the future of mobility by producing car seats for top automotive brands and helping to make Slovakia a vibrant hub of innovation.

Your responsibilities

Guide Windows System Admins and Support Analysts
Install Windows operating systems, system software, and upgrades
Administer Windows configuration and services for our client's data centers
Maintain systems within vendors' support requirements
Develop backup and recovery processes and procedures to ensure system continuity
Participate in Disaster Recovery rehearsals
Adhere to SOX policies and develop and maintain procedures
Apply security policies to the Windows Platform as determined by IT Security
Resolve the most complex hardware and software issues
Monitor system availability and performance
Support capacity planning
Interface with other teams
Stay up-to-date with the latest Windows Platform developments
Provide effective technical documentation
Maintain a customer service attitude
Adhere to the Company's ethics standards.

Our requirements

Willingness to work on two shifts. Morning shift 8-16 and afternoon shift 15:30 - 23:30 changing weekly.
3 - 6 years of Windows Platform experience
Ability to work with a diverse group of people of different skills, backgrounds, departments and management levels
Excellent communication skills and proficiency in speaking English
Extensive knowledge and experience in maintaining and configuring Windows server hardware, operating system software and peripherals
Advanced knowledge and skills of the Microsoft server operating system is required
Strong analytical skills are required to understand, diagnose and resolve technical situations to provide and maintain 24 by 7 data center services
Experience with Powershell, VMware and Citrix is strongly desired

Benefits

Remote work ()
Flexible type of employment (COW OR B2B)
Internal Mobility Program – enjoy many opportunities for career growth, job rotations, diversity of projects & technologies
International, diverse, and inclusive working environment – get experience in global projects for worldwide leaders and enjoy multinational teams
Referral Program – enjoy cooperation with your colleagues and get the bonus!
5/10 years NATEK club – we offer long term cooperation and celebrate each fifth year cooperation anniversary with gifts
NATEK CSR Events & team buildings – enjoy our values: accountability, partnership and expertise and #workITwithus
Education – benefit from our know how, learning courses and certificates and IT events – be part of community of leaders of the industry and take part as a speaker or a visitor

Only for CoW:

Relocation Bonus – reimbursement for moving expenses for out-of-town candidates
Bonuses for Personal Events – we congratulate you important events of your life: giving birth to children, university graduation, etc.
Benefit Plus (Cafeteria) – use our e-shop with corporate benefits like travel, theater tickets, books etc.
Additional Medical health care – on top of standard health insurance
Multisport Club Card
Technical and Personal training – we are investing in your skills growthLanguage courses
1 paid day off for volunteering – we are supportive in all charity ideas
Meal contribution/ food vouchers

About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 25+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 5000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

The Financial Crime Operations department is at the forefront of Revolut’s efforts to keep customers and their money safe 🥷 Those ninjas work directly with customers to resolve issues and flag potential concerns. Using cutting edge technology, we aim to prevent financial crime in a way the banking world hasn’t seen so far 💫

FinCrime Analysts is the key person to ensure we’ve got it under control, working with the Revolut Compliance team. It’s only for the most responsible, conscientious, brave individuals. The ones who aren’t afraid of challenges of the complex financial world 🕶

👉 We’re a global financial super app, so we have to be available 24/7. That sometimes means working nights and weekends. We’ll compensate you for night shifts but we understand this still isn’t for everyone so please bear that in mind before applying.

What You’ll Be Doing
Liaising with law enforcement
Responding to Court Orders, DPAs and POs and complying with legislation like POCA & DPA
Ensuring that all requests are completed within the applicable time scales
Liaising with the legal team as necessary or prepare documentation for third party requests.
Conducting fraud-related investigations based on the reports received
Generating reports and create alerts for suspicious activity
Discussing FinCrime concerns with members of the company across all levels

What You'll Need
Proficient English language skills
Flawless German (exceptional communication and writing skills)
Prior experience in a Retail Bank environment
Legal experience desirable
Experience of dealing with external law enforcement and other government agencies
Knowledge of the Court Orders, DPA, PO and preparing witness statements
Confidence in communicating with people at all levels both externally and within the organisation
Close attention to detail

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

By applying for the above position, you will confirm that you have reviewed and agreed to our Data Privacy Notice for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates

Ort / Branche

Nürnberg/ remote - IT-Dienstleistung

Hast Du Lust auf spannende und vielfältige Projekte, die Du mitgestalten kannst? Hast Du zudem Spaß im Umgang mit Menschen und der Entwicklung von komplexen Architekturen und Lösungen? Dann werde Teil von uns.

Höchste Qualität und Partnerschaft auf Augenhöhe – darauf setzen wir bei Cegeka. Denn kurzfristige Erfolge sind zwar wichtig, aber nicht das, worauf es uns als Familienunternehmen mit über 25-jähriger Geschichte ankommt. Mit mehr als 6.000 Mitarbeiter/-innen in elf europäischen Ländern identifizieren und erschließen wir die Potenziale neuer Technologien, ohne uns von Hypes blenden zu lassen, und entwickeln maßgeschneiderte Lösungen, die unsere Kunden den entscheidenden Schritt voranbringen.

Beginn / Dauer

Ab sofort / unbefristet

Aufgaben
Du setzt spannende Projekte um und schaffst zusammen mit Deinem Team Innovationen, die unseren Kunden das Leben erleichtern.
Du arbeitest während der gesamten Softwareentwicklung nach agilen Methoden wie Scrum oder Kanban, stellst die Qualität der Software sicher und sammelst Deine Erfahrung vorrangig durch Learning-by-Doing - ein erfahrener Kollege (m/w/d) begleitet Dich dabei.
Von Anfang an bekommst Du verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben in den Bereichen: Design, Modellierung, Implementierung und Dokumentation von komplexen Anwendungen.
Du findest heraus was Du am besten kannst, indem Du unterschiedliche Rollen im Team, sowie in der Entwicklung übernimmst und somit Deine eigenen Schwerpunkte setzt.
Bei uns agierst Du nicht nur hinter den Kulissen, sondern bist von Anfang an Teil unseres Teams und kannst direkt Deine Fähigkeiten einsetzen, um unsere Kunden glücklich zu machen.

Qualifikation
Ob IT-Studium oder Ausbildung, viel wichtiger ist Deine Leidenschaft für die Softwareentwicklung.
Du bringst mindestens ein Jahr Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung mit.
Java ist für Dich mehr als nur eine Insel.
Idealerweise verfügst Du über Kenntnisse in den Bereichen: REST, Spring Boot, HTML5 und Angular 2+/React.
Du arbeitest gern im Team, stehst mit klarer Kommunikation nicht auf Kriegsfuß, bist kreativ, engagiert und bereit Neues zu lernen.
Außerdem sprichst Du sehr gut Deutsch und gutes Englisch. Kurz: Du bist der ideale Kandidat für uns.

Unser Angebot

Was du allerdings sicher noch nicht weißt, ist: Warum Du bei uns arbeiten solltest:
Du stehst bei uns im Mittelpunkt.
Deine Meinung wird gehört und Du kannst vieles selbst beeinflussen.
Wir bieten Dir den Freiraum, den Du brauchst, um Deine Arbeit richtig gut zu machen.
Dafür interessieren wir uns nicht nur für Deine Stärken, sondern auch für Deine Schwächen um sie zusammen mit Dir anzugehen.
Denn wir wollen Dir jeden Tag die Möglichkeit geben, Dich weiterzuentwickeln. In die Richtung, die Dir am besten gefällt.

Hard Facts:
We care about you! Dein Arbeitsort ist freiwählbar – Ob im Büro oder Remote, wir bieten Dir ein hohes Maß an Flexibilität.
Standortnaher Einsatz in Nürnberg.
„Duz“-Kultur.
Großes Unternehmen aber Start-Up-Feeling in Nürnberg.
Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege.
Eigenes Budget für Weiterbildungen, welches Du selbst verwalten kannst.
Freie Wahl Deines Notebooks und Deines Smartphones.
Ein dynamisches Team und eine flexible Arbeitsumgebung mit modernsten Technologien.
Regelmäßige Fortbildungen und Zertifizierungen, damit Du immer up-to-date bist.
Ein unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis mit spannenden Aufgaben.
Individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle nach Deinen Bedürfnissen für eine dauerhaft ausgeglichene Work-Life-Balance.
Eine ausgeprägte Open-Door-Mentalität, in der neue Ideen gerne gehört werden.
Attraktive Prämienprogramme für gute Arbeit, gute Ideen und Deine eigenen Projekte

Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann lass‘ uns herausfinden, wohin unsere gemeinsame Reise gehen soll. Melde Dich dafür einfach bei Habibe.

Habibe Ali, HR Ansprechpartnerin am Nürnberger Standort, verrät Dir, warum Cegeka vielleicht auch Dein perfekter Arbeitgeber wäre.

Hier das Video dazu: Warum Cegeka?

job_title: Solution Engineer - Security - Different languages - Opportunity for Working Remotely
description:
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?

When you're working for a company that shares your values, it's easier to enjoy what you do. At VMware we unite under a core set of EPIC2 Values: Execution, Passion, Integrity, Customer, and Community. Our guiding principle is "innovate in everything". Each day you will be challenged to bring curiosity, diversity, and an eagerness to collaborate toward bold ideas across all aspects of our business. We do it with a spirit of inclusion and trust acting as 'One VMware' to help our customers win.

As a Solution Engineer (SE) in the VMware Security team, you will get the opportunity to work with our VMware Carbon Black security products portfolio and other VMware products.

Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6-12 months you will work toward completing?

Become a Solution Engineer capable of demonstrating the security solutions, lead product trials and act as a trusted advisor.

Within 30 days:

Complete onboarding and become familiar with VMware as a company, including various teams and processes used.
Gain understanding how our solutions and use cases fit into the VMware Vision and Strategy.

Within 60 days:

Gain knowledge of the Carbon Black Cloud product range with the ability to deliver product demonstrations to prospects and assist in product trials (POV).
Gain understanding how we can help customers secure their environments and the unique value they can get from our solutions and services.
You will create new whiteboard presentations and deliver content in your own unique way.

Within 90 days:

Gain knowledge of the Carbon Black OnPremise product range with the ability to deliver product demonstrations and lead product trials (POV) of all products.

Further:

You will become a trusted advisor and partner with the sales team to drive business.
You will develop scenario-based solution demonstrations based upon real world examples.
You will establish solid working relationships with other VMware teams like the Channel Team, Technical Support, Professional Services and other Specialist teams.

The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?

As part of the SE team, you can expect a variety of the following assignments. Most of the work is done remotely with occasional visits to customers:

Demonstrating products from VMware Carbon Black - articulate business and technical benefits of our solution, explain use cases, showcase the use of products
Lead technical trials – Proof of Value (POV) – help install products, provide information about best practices, define success criteria, troubleshoot issues
Lead technical Workshops to demonstrate details of solutions
Pre-sales support – advise on best fitting product, answer technical questions about the products, assist with objection handling, answer Requests for Information
Provide technical enablement to Sales and Partner teams
Work with other VMware BUs on cross product projects with prospects
Maintain your own demo lab environment
Represent the company in various trade shows to provide product information
Use your language skills to support local markets: nice to have - Spanish/Italian/Hebrew/Eastern European languages and mandatory English

What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?

The Solution Engineering leadership in VMware supports the development of strong professionals, both from a technical and sales perspective. You’ll be joining a friendly and supportive environment with a customer-centric and growth mindset approach.

The Hiring Manager for this role is Aleksander Siranko, SE Manager – Security, who has been in the company for 4 and a half years. Prior to becoming the manager of the team, Aleksander was a Solution Engineer within the same team. His focus is individual and team development.

The team is distributed across the EMEA region with most of the team in Barcelona, Spain. The team is part of the EMEA Solution Engineers for Security team reporting to the Director for the EMEA SE team.

The team follows a friendly and open atmosphere with support and collaboration as its core values.

Where is this role located?

The role is considered flexible within the hiring country and will be a mix of working from a local VMware office and remote depending on your preferences and the arrangements determined with your future manager.

What are the benefits and perks of working at VMware?

You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights, or you can view the complete benefits package by visiting benefits.vmware.com

Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types
Generous Time Off Programs
40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)
Wellbeing annual program

Category : Sales

Subcategory: Systems Engineering

Experience: Manager and Professional

Vil du arbejde med ledelse, ressourcestyring og kvalitetssikring i en organisation i god udvikling og vækst? Ønsker du en central rolle i forbindelse med spændende fjernvarme projekter på Sjælland? Vil du garanteres faglig såvel som personlig udvikling? Så er stillingen som projektleder noget for dig.

Om jobbet

Vi søger en stærk og erfaren projektleder, der er klar til at tage ansvar og være med til at sikre, at anlægsentrepriserne på vores projekter kommer godt i mål. Med udgangspunkt i Køge tilbydes du et spændende og ansvarsfuldt job, der dagligt vil kræve, at du gør dig umage og bringer din ekspertise og erfaring i spil. Med reference til afdelingschefen og i samarbejde med de andre dygtige og engagerede medarbejdere i teamet får du ansvaret for at ledelse og overordnet projektstyring af anlægsentrepriser.

Dine Arbejdsopgaver Omfatter Bl.a.
Daglig ledelse af anlægsprojekter inden for fjernvarme
Projekt- og økonomiopfølgning samt rapportering
Tidsplansstyring og kvalitetssikring
Løbende kundekontakt og kundepleje.
Hvem er du?

For at kunne matche jobbets ansvar og kompleksitet har du erfaring fra en lignende rolle inden for entreprenørbranchen, hvor du med succes har drevet mellemstore projekter. Uddannelsesmæssigt har du en baggrund som ingeniør inden for byggeri/infrastruktur, bygningskonstruktør eller lignende. Du har erfaring med sagsøkonomi og begår dig både skriftligt og mundtligt effektivt og præcist. Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring med KS, kalkulationer og beregninger indenfor jordentrepriser. Du er erfaren bruger af Microsoft Office.

Som person er du handlingsorienteret, kvalitetsbevidst og har et stort overblik. Du er en teamplayer og bidrager aktivt til produktivitet og trivsel i dit team. Du arbejder struktureret og har styr på dine ting, hvilket gør, at du kan håndtere arbejdsdage, der sjældent er ens. Du har økonomisk sans og udviser stor ansvarlighed for at sikre, at din del af entreprisen holder sig inden for budgettet. Som kollega og leder er du fleksibel, en god sparringspartner og du bidrager med energi, vedholdenhed til et godt arbejdsmiljø.

Vi tilbyder

Et alsidigt og udfordrende job hos Nordens førende leverandør af tekniske installations- og serviceydelser. Der er gode udviklingsmuligheder i jobbet og du vil løbende få opdateret din tekniske viden inden for anlægsområdet. Du får frihed under ansvar samt en bred kontaktflade med dygtige kolleger og kunder. Vi har gode og stabile arbejds- og ansættelsesforhold. Du bliver du en del af et team, hvor fællesskab er i højsæde.

Interesseret?

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen er du velkommen til at kontakte Therkel Nielsen på telefon 2525 4360 eller Therkel.nielsen@bravida.dk.

Ansøgning

Send din ansøgning og CV nedenfor.

Vi ønsker stillingen besat hurtigst muligt, men venter gerne på den rette kandidat.

Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Yugabyte, Spark and Kafka, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis, MongoDB and Opensearch, all the way to structured SQL engines like PostgreSQL and MySQL.

This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about delivering high quality, reliable and automated infrastructure based on open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.

Experience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technologies.

Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, automation, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of open source community dynamics, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.

What you'll do
Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
Write high quality, idiomatic Python code to create new features
Debug issues and interact with upstream communities, in the open
Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events

Who you are
You love technology and working with brilliant people
You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
You are experienced with Linux systems administration, package management, and operations
You have hands-on experience with at least one public cloud and experience with private cloud solutions like OpenStack
You are experienced with Kubernetes and believe it can be used for serious persistent data services
You are an accomplished Python programmer that enjoys challenging projects in mission-critical environments
You have experience operating and managing data platform technologies like PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Opensearch, Kafka, Yugabyte

Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.

Stellenbeschreibung

Als Technischer Support Ingenieur unterstützen Sie Kunden, Kunden-Support-Mitarbeiter und Außendienstmitarbeiter bei der erweiterten Diagnose, Fehlerbehebung, Reparatur und Fehlersuche für NetApp Produkte, einschließlich Hardware-, Software- und Multisystem-/Multi-Hersteller-/Multi-Netzwerk-Interoperabilitätsproblemen. Sie reagieren auf Situationen, in denen der First-Line-Produktsupport nicht in der Lage ist, Probleme mit Hardware- oder Softwareprodukten zu isolieren oder zu beheben, und stellen sicher, dass Sie optimale Ergebnisse erzielen. Sie müssen ein Fachmann sein, der über nachweisliche technische Problemlösungskompetenz verfügt, ein Experte auf diesem Gebiet ist und über eine ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung und -erfahrung verfügt.

Wir bieten ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell, sodass Sie auch grundsätzlich vom Homeoffice aus arbeiten können. Idealerweise, wohnen sie in der Nähe einer der folgenden NetApp Standorte: München, Stuttgart, Frankfurt, Walldorf, Düsseldorf, Hamburg, Berlin

Anforderungsprofil
Ausgeprägte schriftliche und mündliche Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch.
Mentoring-Fähigkeiten zur Unterstützung anderer Technischer Support-Ingenieure bei Bedarf
Ausgeprägte zwischenmenschliche Kommunikations- und Kundendienstfähigkeiten in stressigen und/oder ambivalenten Situationen.
Ausgeprägte Fähigkeit, neue Technologien zu erlernen und zu verstehen, wie sie in einer kundenorientierten Umgebung eingesetzt werden können.
Fähigkeit, standardmäßige technische Prinzipien und Praktiken zu befolgen und bei Bedarf zu eskalieren.
Kreativer Ansatz zur Problemlösung.
Solides Verständnis eines oder mehrerer der folgenden Protokolle, Anwendungen und Plattformen: NFS, CIFS, SAN, iSCSI, TCP/IP und Networking, RAID, NetApp Storage System Betriebssysteme wie Data ONTAP oder E-Series Operating System (EOS), DNS, NIS und AD.

Sie müssen über mindestens 1 oder mehrere Fachgebiete verfügen, z. B:
NetApp Cluster-Mode Storage-Lösungen und verwandte Technologien
Data ONTAP Betriebssystem und NetApp High-Availability (HA) Technologie
UNIX/Linux-Konfiguration, -Administration und technischer Support
Konfiguration, Systemadministration und technischer Support für Microsoft Windows Umgebungen
NAS- und/oder SAN-Speicher und die dazugehörige Infrastruktur
Interoperabilität von Unternehmensapplikationen (z. B. Microsoft Exchange, Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle und SAP) mit NetApp Storage-Systemen und -Lösungen
Server- und Desktop-Virtualisierungslösungen (z. B. VMware, Microsoft Hyper-V, Citrix)
NetApp Storage-Management-Software-Suite
Performance-Probleme im Zusammenhang mit NetApp Storage-Lösungen
Fachkenntnisse in einer oder mehreren Cloud-Lösungen sind von Vorteil

Ausbildung und Erfahrung

Bachelor of Science-Abschluss in Informatik, Elektrotechnik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet oder gleichwertige Berufserfahrung; 4 - 7 Jahre Erfahrung in UNIX, Storage-Administration oder technischem Support.
